33 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_MAJOR 3
34 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_MINOR 4
35 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_PATCH 0

37 #include <algorithm> // all_of, find, for_each, copy
38 #include <cassert> // assert
39 #include <ciso646> // and, not, or

66 namespace json
67 {
75 template<typename T = void, typename SFINAE = void>
76 struct adl_serializer;
77 
78 template<template<typename U, typename V, typename... Args> class ObjectType =
79  std::map,
80  template<typename U, typename... Args> class ArrayType = std::vector,
81  class StringType = std::string, class BooleanType = bool,
82  class NumberIntegerType = std::int64_t,
83  class NumberUnsignedType = std::uint64_t,
84  class NumberFloatType = double,
85  template<typename U> class AllocatorType = std::allocator,
86  template<typename T, typename SFINAE = void> class JSONSerializer =
87  adl_serializer>
88 class basic_json;
89 
101 template<typename BasicJsonType>
102 class json_pointer;
103 
112 template<class K, class V, class dummy_compare, class A>
113 using workaround_fifo_map = nlohmann::fifo_map<K, V, nlohmann::fifo_map_compare<K>, A>;
114 using json = basic_json<workaround_fifo_map>;

117 } // namespace json

121 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
122 
123 
124 // This file contains all internal macro definitions
125 // You MUST include macro_unscope.hpp at the end of json.hpp to undef all of them
126 
127 // exclude unsupported compilers
128 #if !defined(JSON_SKIP_UNSUPPORTED_COMPILER_CHECK)
129  #if defined(__clang__)
130  #if (__clang_major__ * 10000 + __clang_minor__ * 100 + __clang_patchlevel__) < 30400
131  #error "unsupported Clang version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
132  #endif
133  #elif defined(__GNUC__) && !(defined(__ICC) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER))
134  #if (__GNUC__ * 10000 + __GNUC_MINOR__ * 100 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) < 40800
135  #error "unsupported GCC version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
136  #endif
137  #endif
138 #endif
139 
140 // disable float-equal warnings on GCC/clang
141 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
142  #pragma GCC diagnostic push
143  #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
144 #endif
145 
146 // disable documentation warnings on clang
147 #if defined(__clang__)
148  #pragma GCC diagnostic push
149  #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdocumentation"
150 #endif
151 
152 // allow for portable deprecation warnings
153 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
154  #define JSON_DEPRECATED __attribute__((deprecated))
155 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
156  #define JSON_DEPRECATED __declspec(deprecated)
157 #else
158  #define JSON_DEPRECATED
159 #endif
160 
161 // allow to disable exceptions
162 #if (defined(__cpp_exceptions) || defined(__EXCEPTIONS) || defined(_CPPUNWIND)) && !defined(JSON_NOEXCEPTION)
163  #define JSON_THROW(exception) throw exception
164  #define JSON_TRY try
165  #define JSON_CATCH(exception) catch(exception)
166  #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH(exception) catch(exception)
167 #else
168  #define JSON_THROW(exception) std::abort()
169  #define JSON_TRY if(true)
170  #define JSON_CATCH(exception) if(false)
171  #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH(exception) if(false)
172 #endif
173 
174 // override exception macros
175 #if defined(JSON_THROW_USER)
176  #undef JSON_THROW
177  #define JSON_THROW JSON_THROW_USER
178 #endif
179 #if defined(JSON_TRY_USER)
180  #undef JSON_TRY
181  #define JSON_TRY JSON_TRY_USER
182 #endif
183 #if defined(JSON_CATCH_USER)
184  #undef JSON_CATCH
185  #define JSON_CATCH JSON_CATCH_USER
186  #undef JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH
187  #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH JSON_CATCH_USER
188 #endif
189 #if defined(JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH_USER)
190  #undef JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH
191  #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH_USER
192 #endif
193 
194 // manual branch prediction
195 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
196  #define JSON_LIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 1)
197  #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 0)
198 #else
199  #define JSON_LIKELY(x) x
200  #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) x
201 #endif
202 
203 // C++ language standard detection
204 #if (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201703L) || (defined(_HAS_CXX17) && _HAS_CXX17 == 1) // fix for issue #464
205  #define JSON_HAS_CPP_17
206  #define JSON_HAS_CPP_14
207 #elif (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201402L) || (defined(_HAS_CXX14) && _HAS_CXX14 == 1)
208  #define JSON_HAS_CPP_14
209 #endif
210 
216 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_SERIALIZE_ENUM(ENUM_TYPE, ...) \
217  template<typename BasicJsonType> \
218  inline void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const ENUM_TYPE& e) \
219  { \
220  static_assert(std::is_enum<ENUM_TYPE>::value, #ENUM_TYPE " must be an enum!"); \
221  static const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType> m[] = __VA_ARGS__; \
222  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(m), std::end(m), \
223  [e](const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType>& ej_pair) -> bool \
224  { \
225  return ej_pair.first == e; \
226  }); \
227  j = ((it != std::end(m)) ? it : std::begin(m))->second; \
228  } \
229  template<typename BasicJsonType> \
230  inline void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ENUM_TYPE& e) \
231  { \
232  static_assert(std::is_enum<ENUM_TYPE>::value, #ENUM_TYPE " must be an enum!"); \
233  static const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType> m[] = __VA_ARGS__; \
234  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(m), std::end(m), \
235  [j](const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType>& ej_pair) -> bool \
236  { \
237  return ej_pair.second == j; \
238  }); \
239  e = ((it != std::end(m)) ? it : std::begin(m))->first; \
240  }
241 
242 // Ugly macros to avoid uglier copy-paste when specializing basic_json. They
243 // may be removed in the future once the class is split.
244 
245 #define NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION \
246  template<template<typename, typename, typename...> class ObjectType, \
247  template<typename, typename...> class ArrayType, \
248  class StringType, class BooleanType, class NumberIntegerType, \
249  class NumberUnsignedType, class NumberFloatType, \
250  template<typename> class AllocatorType, \
251  template<typename, typename = void> class JSONSerializer>
252 
253 #define NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL \
254  basic_json<ObjectType, ArrayType, StringType, BooleanType, \
255  NumberIntegerType, NumberUnsignedType, NumberFloatType, \
256  AllocatorType, JSONSerializer>
257 
258 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/cpp_future.hpp>
259 
260 
261 #include <ciso646> // not
262 #include <cstddef> // size_t
263 #include <type_traits> // conditional, enable_if, false_type, integral_constant, is_constructible, is_integral, is_same, remove_cv, remove_reference, true_type
264 
265 namespace json
266 {
267 namespace detail
268 {
269 // alias templates to reduce boilerplate
270 template<bool B, typename T = void>
271 using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
272 
273 template<typename T>
274 using uncvref_t = typename std::remove_cv<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::type;
275 
276 // implementation of C++14 index_sequence and affiliates
277 // source: https://stackoverflow.com/a/32223343
278 template<std::size_t... Ints>
279 struct index_sequence
280 {
281  using type = index_sequence;
282  using value_type = std::size_t;
283  static constexpr std::size_t size() noexcept
284  {
285  return sizeof...(Ints);
286  }
287 };
288 
289 template<class Sequence1, class Sequence2>
290 struct merge_and_renumber;
291 
292 template<std::size_t... I1, std::size_t... I2>
293 struct merge_and_renumber<index_sequence<I1...>, index_sequence<I2...>>
294  : index_sequence < I1..., (sizeof...(I1) + I2)... > {};
295 
296 template<std::size_t N>
297 struct make_index_sequence
298  : merge_and_renumber < typename make_index_sequence < N / 2 >::type,
299  typename make_index_sequence < N - N / 2 >::type > {};
300 
301 template<> struct make_index_sequence<0> : index_sequence<> {};
302 template<> struct make_index_sequence<1> : index_sequence<0> {};
303 
304 template<typename... Ts>
305 using index_sequence_for = make_index_sequence<sizeof...(Ts)>;
306 
307 // dispatch utility (taken from ranges-v3)
308 template<unsigned N> struct priority_tag : priority_tag < N - 1 > {};
309 template<> struct priority_tag<0> {};
310 
311 // taken from ranges-v3
312 template<typename T>
313 struct static_const
314 {
315  static constexpr T value{};
316 };
317 
318 template<typename T>
319 constexpr T static_const<T>::value;
320 } // namespace detail
321 } // namespace json
322

324 
325 
326 #include <ciso646> // not
327 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
328 #include <type_traits> // false_type, is_constructible, is_integral, is_same, true_type
329 #include <utility> // declval

334 
335 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/detected.hpp>

337 
338 #include <type_traits>
339 
340 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/void_t.hpp>
341 
342 
343 namespace json
344 {
345 namespace detail
346 {
347 template <typename ...Ts> struct make_void
348 {
349  using type = void;
350 };
351 template <typename ...Ts> using void_t = typename make_void<Ts...>::type;
352 } // namespace detail
353 } // namespace json
354 
355 
356 // http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/experimental/is_detected
357 namespace json
358 {
359 namespace detail
360 {
361 struct nonesuch
362 {
363  nonesuch() = delete;
364  ~nonesuch() = delete;
365  nonesuch(nonesuch const&) = delete;
366  void operator=(nonesuch const&) = delete;
367 };
368 
369 template <class Default,
370  class AlwaysVoid,
371  template <class...> class Op,
372  class... Args>
373 struct detector
374 {
375  using value_t = std::false_type;
376  using type = Default;
377 };
378 
379 template <class Default, template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
380 struct detector<Default, void_t<Op<Args...>>, Op, Args...>
381 {
382  using value_t = std::true_type;
383  using type = Op<Args...>;
384 };
385 
386 template <template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
387 using is_detected = typename detector<nonesuch, void, Op, Args...>::value_t;
388 
389 template <template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
390 using detected_t = typename detector<nonesuch, void, Op, Args...>::type;
391 
392 template <class Default, template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
393 using detected_or = detector<Default, void, Op, Args...>;
394 
395 template <class Default, template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
396 using detected_or_t = typename detected_or<Default, Op, Args...>::type;
397 
398 template <class Expected, template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
399 using is_detected_exact = std::is_same<Expected, detected_t<Op, Args...>>;
400 
401 template <class To, template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
402 using is_detected_convertible =
403  std::is_convertible<detected_t<Op, Args...>, To>;
404 } // namespace detail
405 } // namespace json
406 
407 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
408 
409 
410 namespace json
411 {
420 namespace detail
421 {
423 // helpers //
425 
426 // Note to maintainers:
427 //
428 // Every trait in this file expects a non CV-qualified type.
429 // The only exceptions are in the 'aliases for detected' section
430 // (i.e. those of the form: decltype(T::member_function(std::declval<T>())))
431 //
432 // In this case, T has to be properly CV-qualified to constraint the function arguments
433 // (e.g. to_json(BasicJsonType&, const T&))
434 
435 template<typename> struct is_basic_json : std::false_type {};
436 
437 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
438 struct is_basic_json<NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL> : std::true_type {};
439 
441 // aliases for detected //
443 
444 template <typename T>
445 using mapped_type_t = typename T::mapped_type;
446 
447 template <typename T>
448 using key_type_t = typename T::key_type;
449 
450 template <typename T>
451 using value_type_t = typename T::value_type;
452 
453 template <typename T>
454 using difference_type_t = typename T::difference_type;
455 
456 template <typename T>
457 using pointer_t = typename T::pointer;
458 
459 template <typename T>
460 using reference_t = typename T::reference;
461 
462 template <typename T>
463 using iterator_category_t = typename T::iterator_category;
464 
465 template <typename T>
466 using iterator_t = typename T::iterator;
467 
468 template <typename T, typename... Args>
469 using to_json_function = decltype(T::to_json(std::declval<Args>()...));
470 
471 template <typename T, typename... Args>
472 using from_json_function = decltype(T::from_json(std::declval<Args>()...));
473 
474 template <typename T, typename U>
475 using get_template_function = decltype(std::declval<T>().template get<U>());
476 
477 // trait checking if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&, udt&) exists
478 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename = void>
479 struct has_from_json : std::false_type {};
480 
481 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
482 struct has_from_json<BasicJsonType, T,
483  enable_if_t<not is_basic_json<T>::value>>
484 {
485  using serializer = typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>;
486 
487  static constexpr bool value =
488  is_detected_exact<void, from_json_function, serializer,
489  const BasicJsonType&, T&>::value;
490 };
491 
492 // This trait checks if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&) exists
493 // this overload is used for non-default-constructible user-defined-types
494 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename = void>
495 struct has_non_default_from_json : std::false_type {};
496 
497 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
498 struct has_non_default_from_json<BasicJsonType, T, enable_if_t<not is_basic_json<T>::value>>
499 {
500  using serializer = typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>;
501 
502  static constexpr bool value =
503  is_detected_exact<T, from_json_function, serializer,
504  const BasicJsonType&>::value;
505 };
506 
507 // This trait checks if BasicJsonType::json_serializer<T>::to_json exists
508 // Do not evaluate the trait when T is a basic_json type, to avoid template instantiation infinite recursion.
509 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename = void>
510 struct has_to_json : std::false_type {};
511 
512 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
513 struct has_to_json<BasicJsonType, T, enable_if_t<not is_basic_json<T>::value>>
514 {
515  using serializer = typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>;
516 
517  static constexpr bool value =
518  is_detected_exact<void, to_json_function, serializer, BasicJsonType&,
519  T>::value;
520 };
521 
522 
524 // is_ functions //
526 
527 template <typename T, typename = void>
528 struct is_iterator_traits : std::false_type {};
529 
530 template <typename T>
531 struct is_iterator_traits<std::iterator_traits<T>>
532 {
533  private:
534  using traits = std::iterator_traits<T>;
535 
536  public:
537  static constexpr auto value =
538  is_detected<value_type_t, traits>::value &&
539  is_detected<difference_type_t, traits>::value &&
540  is_detected<pointer_t, traits>::value &&
541  is_detected<iterator_category_t, traits>::value &&
542  is_detected<reference_t, traits>::value;
543 };
544 
545 // source: https://stackoverflow.com/a/37193089/4116453
546 
547 template <typename T, typename = void>
548 struct is_complete_type : std::false_type {};
549 
550 template <typename T>
551 struct is_complete_type<T, decltype(void(sizeof(T)))> : std::true_type {};
552 
553 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
554  typename = void>
555 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl : std::false_type {};
556 
557 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType>
558 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl <
559  BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType,
560  enable_if_t<is_detected<mapped_type_t, CompatibleObjectType>::value and
561  is_detected<key_type_t, CompatibleObjectType>::value >>
562 {
563 
564  using object_t = typename BasicJsonType::object_t;
565 
566  // macOS's is_constructible does not play well with nonesuch...
567  static constexpr bool value =
568  std::is_constructible<typename object_t::key_type,
569  typename CompatibleObjectType::key_type>::value and
570  std::is_constructible<typename object_t::mapped_type,
571  typename CompatibleObjectType::mapped_type>::value;
572 };
573 
574 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType>
575 struct is_compatible_object_type
576  : is_compatible_object_type_impl<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType> {};
577 
578 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType,
579  typename = void>
580 struct is_constructible_object_type_impl : std::false_type {};
581 
582 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType>
583 struct is_constructible_object_type_impl <
584  BasicJsonType, ConstructibleObjectType,
585  enable_if_t<is_detected<mapped_type_t, ConstructibleObjectType>::value and
586  is_detected<key_type_t, ConstructibleObjectType>::value >>
587 {
588  using object_t = typename BasicJsonType::object_t;
589 
590  static constexpr bool value =
591  (std::is_constructible<typename ConstructibleObjectType::key_type, typename object_t::key_type>::value and
592  std::is_same<typename object_t::mapped_type, typename ConstructibleObjectType::mapped_type>::value) or
593  (has_from_json<BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType::mapped_type>::value or
594  has_non_default_from_json<BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType::mapped_type >::value);
595 };
596 
597 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType>
598 struct is_constructible_object_type
599  : is_constructible_object_type_impl<BasicJsonType,
600  ConstructibleObjectType> {};
601 
602 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleStringType,
603  typename = void>
604 struct is_compatible_string_type_impl : std::false_type {};
605 
606 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleStringType>
607 struct is_compatible_string_type_impl <
608  BasicJsonType, CompatibleStringType,
609  enable_if_t<is_detected_exact<typename BasicJsonType::string_t::value_type,
610  value_type_t, CompatibleStringType>::value >>
611 {
612  static constexpr auto value =
613  std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t, CompatibleStringType>::value;
614 };
615 
616 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleStringType>
617 struct is_compatible_string_type
618  : is_compatible_string_type_impl<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleStringType> {};
619 
620 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleStringType,
621  typename = void>
622 struct is_constructible_string_type_impl : std::false_type {};
623 
624 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleStringType>
625 struct is_constructible_string_type_impl <
626  BasicJsonType, ConstructibleStringType,
627  enable_if_t<is_detected_exact<typename BasicJsonType::string_t::value_type,
628  value_type_t, ConstructibleStringType>::value >>
629 {
630  static constexpr auto value =
631  std::is_constructible<ConstructibleStringType,
632  typename BasicJsonType::string_t>::value;
633 };
634 
635 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleStringType>
636 struct is_constructible_string_type
637  : is_constructible_string_type_impl<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleStringType> {};
638 
639 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType, typename = void>
640 struct is_compatible_array_type_impl : std::false_type {};
641 
642 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
643 struct is_compatible_array_type_impl <
644  BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType,
645  enable_if_t<is_detected<value_type_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
646  is_detected<iterator_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
647 // This is needed because json_reverse_iterator has a ::iterator type...
648 // Therefore it is detected as a CompatibleArrayType.
649 // The real fix would be to have an Iterable concept.
650  not is_iterator_traits<
651  std::iterator_traits<CompatibleArrayType>>::value >>
652 {
653  static constexpr bool value =
654  std::is_constructible<BasicJsonType,
655  typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>::value;
656 };
657 
658 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
659 struct is_compatible_array_type
660  : is_compatible_array_type_impl<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType> {};
661 
662 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType, typename = void>
663 struct is_constructible_array_type_impl : std::false_type {};
664 
665 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType>
666 struct is_constructible_array_type_impl <
667  BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType,
668  enable_if_t<std::is_same<ConstructibleArrayType,
669  typename BasicJsonType::value_type>::value >>
670  : std::true_type {};
671 
672 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType>
673 struct is_constructible_array_type_impl <
674  BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType,
675  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<ConstructibleArrayType,
676  typename BasicJsonType::value_type>::value and
677  is_detected<value_type_t, ConstructibleArrayType>::value and
678  is_detected<iterator_t, ConstructibleArrayType>::value and
679  is_complete_type<
680  detected_t<value_type_t, ConstructibleArrayType>>::value >>
681 {
682  static constexpr bool value =
683  // This is needed because json_reverse_iterator has a ::iterator type,
684  // furthermore, std::back_insert_iterator (and other iterators) have a base class `iterator`...
685  // Therefore it is detected as a ConstructibleArrayType.
686  // The real fix would be to have an Iterable concept.
687  not is_iterator_traits <
688  std::iterator_traits<ConstructibleArrayType >>::value and
689 
690  (std::is_same<typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type, typename BasicJsonType::array_t::value_type>::value or
691  has_from_json<BasicJsonType,
692  typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type>::value or
693  has_non_default_from_json <
694  BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type >::value);
695 };
696 
697 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType>
698 struct is_constructible_array_type
699  : is_constructible_array_type_impl<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType> {};
700 
701 template <typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType,
702  typename = void>
703 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl : std::false_type {};
704 
705 template <typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
706 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl <
707  RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType,
708  enable_if_t<std::is_integral<RealIntegerType>::value and
709  std::is_integral<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
710  not std::is_same<bool, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value >>
711 {
712  // is there an assert somewhere on overflows?
713  using RealLimits = std::numeric_limits<RealIntegerType>;
714  using CompatibleLimits = std::numeric_limits<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>;
715 
716  static constexpr auto value =
717  std::is_constructible<RealIntegerType,
718  CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
719  CompatibleLimits::is_integer and
720  RealLimits::is_signed == CompatibleLimits::is_signed;
721 };
722 
723 template <typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
724 struct is_compatible_integer_type
725  : is_compatible_integer_type_impl<RealIntegerType,
726  CompatibleNumberIntegerType> {};
727 
728 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleType, typename = void>
729 struct is_compatible_type_impl: std::false_type {};
730 
731 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleType>
732 struct is_compatible_type_impl <
733  BasicJsonType, CompatibleType,
734  enable_if_t<is_complete_type<CompatibleType>::value >>
735 {
736  static constexpr bool value =
737  has_to_json<BasicJsonType, CompatibleType>::value;
738 };
739 
740 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleType>
741 struct is_compatible_type
742  : is_compatible_type_impl<BasicJsonType, CompatibleType> {};
743 } // namespace detail
744 } // namespace json
745 
746 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
747 
748 
749 #include <exception> // exception
750 #include <stdexcept> // runtime_error
751 #include <string> // to_string
752 
753 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/position_t.hpp>
754 
755 
756 #include <cstddef> // size_t
757 
758 namespace json
759 {
760 namespace detail
761 {
763 struct position_t
764 {
766  std::size_t chars_read_total = 0;
768  std::size_t chars_read_current_line = 0;
770  std::size_t lines_read = 0;
771 
773  constexpr operator size_t() const
774  {
775  return chars_read_total;
776  }
777 };
778 
779 }
780 }
781 
782 
783 namespace json
784 {
785 namespace detail
786 {
788 // exceptions //
790 
819 class exception : public std::exception
820 {
821  public:
823  const char* what() const noexcept override
824  {
825  return m.what();
826  }
827 
829  const int id;
830 
831  protected:
832  exception(int id_, const char* what_arg) : id(id_), m(what_arg) {}
833 
834  static std::string name(const std::string& ename, int id_)
835  {
836  return "[json.exception." + ename + "." + std::to_string(id_) + "] ";
837  }
838 
839  private:
841  std::runtime_error m;
842 };
843 
888 class parse_error : public exception
889 {
890  public:
900  static parse_error create(int id_, const position_t& pos, const std::string& what_arg)
901  {
902  std::string w = exception::name("parse_error", id_) + "parse error" +
903  position_string(pos) + ": " + what_arg;
904  return parse_error(id_, pos.chars_read_total, w.c_str());
905  }
906 
907  static parse_error create(int id_, std::size_t byte_, const std::string& what_arg)
908  {
909  std::string w = exception::name("parse_error", id_) + "parse error" +
910  (byte_ != 0 ? (" at byte " + std::to_string(byte_)) : "") +
911  ": " + what_arg;
912  return parse_error(id_, byte_, w.c_str());
913  }
914 
924  const std::size_t byte;
925 
926  private:
927  parse_error(int id_, std::size_t byte_, const char* what_arg)
928  : exception(id_, what_arg), byte(byte_) {}
929 
930  static std::string position_string(const position_t& pos)
931  {
932  return " at line " + std::to_string(pos.lines_read + 1) +
933  ", column " + std::to_string(pos.chars_read_current_line);
934  }
935 };
936 
974 class invalid_iterator : public exception
975 {
976  public:
977  static invalid_iterator create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
978  {
979  std::string w = exception::name("invalid_iterator", id_) + what_arg;
980  return invalid_iterator(id_, w.c_str());
981  }
982 
983  private:
984  invalid_iterator(int id_, const char* what_arg)
985  : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
986 };
987 
1027 class type_error : public exception
1028 {
1029  public:
1030  static type_error create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
1031  {
1032  std::string w = exception::name("type_error", id_) + what_arg;
1033  return type_error(id_, w.c_str());
1034  }
1035 
1036  private:
1037  type_error(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
1038 };
1039 
1073 class out_of_range : public exception
1074 {
1075  public:
1076  static out_of_range create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
1077  {
1078  std::string w = exception::name("out_of_range", id_) + what_arg;
1079  return out_of_range(id_, w.c_str());
1080  }
1081 
1082  private:
1083  out_of_range(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
1084 };
1085 
1110 class other_error : public exception
1111 {
1112  public:
1113  static other_error create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
1114  {
1115  std::string w = exception::name("other_error", id_) + what_arg;
1116  return other_error(id_, w.c_str());
1117  }
1118 
1119  private:
1120  other_error(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
1121 };
1122 } // namespace detail
1123 } // namespace json
1124 
1125 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
1126 
1127 
1128 #include <array> // array
1129 #include <ciso646> // and
1130 #include <cstddef> // size_t
1131 #include <cstdint> // uint8_t
1132 
1133 namespace json
1134 {
1135 namespace detail
1136 {
1138 // JSON type enumeration //
1140 
1165 enum class value_t : std::uint8_t
1166 {
1167  null,
1168  object,
1169  array,
1170  string,
1171  boolean,
1172  number_integer,
1173  number_unsigned,
1174  number_float,
1175  discarded
1176 };
1177 
1188 inline bool operator<(const value_t lhs, const value_t rhs) noexcept
1189 {
1190  static constexpr std::array<std::uint8_t, 8> order = {{
1191  0 /* null */, 3 /* object */, 4 /* array */, 5 /* string */,
1192  1 /* boolean */, 2 /* integer */, 2 /* unsigned */, 2 /* float */
1193  }
1194  };
1195 
1196  const auto l_index = static_cast<std::size_t>(lhs);
1197  const auto r_index = static_cast<std::size_t>(rhs);
1198  return l_index < order.size() and r_index < order.size() and order[l_index] < order[r_index];
1199 }
1200 } // namespace detail
1201 } // namespace json
1202 
1203 // #include <nlohmann/detail/conversions/from_json.hpp>
1204 
1205 
1206 #include <algorithm> // transform
1207 #include <array> // array
1208 #include <ciso646> // and, not
1209 #include <forward_list> // forward_list
1210 #include <iterator> // inserter, front_inserter, end
1211 #include <map> // map
1212 #include <string> // string
1213 #include <tuple> // tuple, make_tuple
1214 #include <type_traits> // is_arithmetic, is_same, is_enum, underlying_type, is_convertible
1215 #include <unordered_map> // unordered_map
1216 #include <utility> // pair, declval
1217 #include <valarray> // valarray
1218 
1219 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
1220 
1221 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
1222 
1223 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/cpp_future.hpp>
1224 
1225 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
1226 
1227 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
1228 
1229 
1230 namespace json
1231 {
1232 namespace detail
1233 {
1234 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1235 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename std::nullptr_t& n)
1236 {
1237  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_null()))
1238  {
1239  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be null, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1240  }
1241  n = nullptr;
1242 }
1243 
1244 // overloads for basic_json template parameters
1245 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
1246  enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
1247  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
1248  int> = 0>
1249 void get_arithmetic_value(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val)
1250 {
1251  switch (static_cast<value_t>(j))
1252  {
1253  case value_t::number_unsigned:
1254  {
1255  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
1256  break;
1257  }
1258  case value_t::number_integer:
1259  {
1260  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
1261  break;
1262  }
1263  case value_t::number_float:
1264  {
1265  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
1266  break;
1267  }
1268 
1269  default:
1270  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1271  }
1272 }
1273 
1274 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1275 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t& b)
1276 {
1277  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_boolean()))
1278  {
1279  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1280  }
1281  b = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>();
1282 }
1283 
1284 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1285 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
1286 {
1287  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_string()))
1288  {
1289  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be string, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1290  }
1291  s = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::string_t*>();
1292 }
1293 
1294 template <
1295  typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleStringType,
1296  enable_if_t <
1297  is_constructible_string_type<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleStringType>::value and
1298  not std::is_same<typename BasicJsonType::string_t,
1299  ConstructibleStringType>::value,
1300  int > = 0 >
1301 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ConstructibleStringType& s)
1302 {
1303  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_string()))
1304  {
1305  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be string, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1306  }
1307 
1308  s = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::string_t*>();
1309 }
1310 
1311 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1312 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t& val)
1313 {
1314  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1315 }
1316 
1317 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1318 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t& val)
1319 {
1320  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1321 }
1322 
1323 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1324 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t& val)
1325 {
1326  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1327 }
1328 
1329 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType,
1330  enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
1331 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, EnumType& e)
1332 {
1333  typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type val;
1334  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1335  e = static_cast<EnumType>(val);
1336 }
1337 
1338 // forward_list doesn't have an insert method
1339 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename Allocator,
1340  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, T>::value, int> = 0>
1341 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::forward_list<T, Allocator>& l)
1342 {
1343  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1344  {
1345  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1346  }
1347  std::transform(j.rbegin(), j.rend(),
1348  std::front_inserter(l), [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1349  {
1350  return i.template get<T>();
1351  });
1352 }
1353 
1354 // valarray doesn't have an insert method
1355 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
1356  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, T>::value, int> = 0>
1357 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::valarray<T>& l)
1358 {
1359  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1360  {
1361  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1362  }
1363  l.resize(j.size());
1364  std::copy(j.m_value.array->begin(), j.m_value.array->end(), std::begin(l));
1365 }
1366 
1367 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1368 void from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr, priority_tag<3> /*unused*/)
1369 {
1370  arr = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::array_t*>();
1371 }
1372 
1373 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, std::size_t N>
1374 auto from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, std::array<T, N>& arr,
1375  priority_tag<2> /*unused*/)
1376 -> decltype(j.template get<T>(), void())
1377 {
1378  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < N; ++i)
1379  {
1380  arr[i] = j.at(i).template get<T>();
1381  }
1382 }
1383 
1384 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType>
1385 auto from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, ConstructibleArrayType& arr, priority_tag<1> /*unused*/)
1386 -> decltype(
1387  arr.reserve(std::declval<typename ConstructibleArrayType::size_type>()),
1388  j.template get<typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type>(),
1389  void())
1390 {
1391  using std::end;
1392 
1393  arr.reserve(j.size());
1394  std::transform(j.begin(), j.end(),
1395  std::inserter(arr, end(arr)), [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1396  {
1397  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
1398  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
1399  return i.template get<typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type>();
1400  });
1401 }
1402 
1403 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType>
1404 void from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, ConstructibleArrayType& arr,
1405  priority_tag<0> /*unused*/)
1406 {
1407  using std::end;
1408 
1409  std::transform(
1410  j.begin(), j.end(), std::inserter(arr, end(arr)),
1411  [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1412  {
1413  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
1414  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
1415  return i.template get<typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type>();
1416  });
1417 }
1418 
1419 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType,
1420  enable_if_t <
1421  is_constructible_array_type<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType>::value and
1422  not is_constructible_object_type<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType>::value and
1423  not is_constructible_string_type<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType>::value and
1424  not is_basic_json<ConstructibleArrayType>::value,
1425  int > = 0 >
1426 
1427 auto from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ConstructibleArrayType& arr)
1428 -> decltype(from_json_array_impl(j, arr, priority_tag<3> {}),
1429 j.template get<typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type>(),
1430 void())
1431 {
1432  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1433  {
1434  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " +
1435  std::string(j.type_name())));
1436  }
1437 
1438  from_json_array_impl(j, arr, priority_tag<3> {});
1439 }
1440 
1441 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType,
1442  enable_if_t<is_constructible_object_type<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleObjectType>::value, int> = 0>
1443 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ConstructibleObjectType& obj)
1444 {
1445  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_object()))
1446  {
1447  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be object, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1448  }
1449 
1450  auto inner_object = j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::object_t*>();
1451  using value_type = typename ConstructibleObjectType::value_type;
1452  std::transform(
1453  inner_object->begin(), inner_object->end(),
1454  std::inserter(obj, obj.begin()),
1455  [](typename BasicJsonType::object_t::value_type const & p)
1456  {
1457  return value_type(p.first, p.second.template get<typename ConstructibleObjectType::mapped_type>());
1458  });
1459 }
1460 
1461 // overload for arithmetic types, not chosen for basic_json template arguments
1462 // (BooleanType, etc..); note: Is it really necessary to provide explicit
1463 // overloads for boolean_t etc. in case of a custom BooleanType which is not
1464 // an arithmetic type?
1465 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
1466  enable_if_t <
1467  std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
1468  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>::value and
1469  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>::value and
1470  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>::value and
1471  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
1472  int> = 0>
1473 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val)
1474 {
1475  switch (static_cast<value_t>(j))
1476  {
1477  case value_t::number_unsigned:
1478  {
1479  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
1480  break;
1481  }
1482  case value_t::number_integer:
1483  {
1484  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
1485  break;
1486  }
1487  case value_t::number_float:
1488  {
1489  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
1490  break;
1491  }
1492  case value_t::boolean:
1493  {
1494  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>());
1495  break;
1496  }
1497 
1498  default:
1499  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1500  }
1501 }
1502 
1503 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename A1, typename A2>
1504 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::pair<A1, A2>& p)
1505 {
1506  p = {j.at(0).template get<A1>(), j.at(1).template get<A2>()};
1507 }
1508 
1509 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename Tuple, std::size_t... Idx>
1510 void from_json_tuple_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, Tuple& t, index_sequence<Idx...> /*unused*/)
1511 {
1512  t = std::make_tuple(j.at(Idx).template get<typename std::tuple_element<Idx, Tuple>::type>()...);
1513 }
1514 
1515 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
1516 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::tuple<Args...>& t)
1517 {
1518  from_json_tuple_impl(j, t, index_sequence_for<Args...> {});
1519 }
1520 
1521 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename Key, typename Value, typename Compare, typename Allocator,
1522  typename = enable_if_t<not std::is_constructible<
1523  typename BasicJsonType::string_t, Key>::value>>
1524 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::map<Key, Value, Compare, Allocator>& m)
1525 {
1526  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1527  {
1528  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1529  }
1530  for (const auto& p : j)
1531  {
1532  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not p.is_array()))
1533  {
1534  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(p.type_name())));
1535  }
1536  m.emplace(p.at(0).template get<Key>(), p.at(1).template get<Value>());
1537  }
1538 }
1539 
1540 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename Key, typename Value, typename Hash, typename KeyEqual, typename Allocator,
1541  typename = enable_if_t<not std::is_constructible<
1542  typename BasicJsonType::string_t, Key>::value>>
1543 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::unordered_map<Key, Value, Hash, KeyEqual, Allocator>& m)
1544 {
1545  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1546  {
1547  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1548  }
1549  for (const auto& p : j)
1550  {
1551  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not p.is_array()))
1552  {
1553  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(p.type_name())));
1554  }
1555  m.emplace(p.at(0).template get<Key>(), p.at(1).template get<Value>());
1556  }
1557 }
1558 
1559 struct from_json_fn
1560 {
1561  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1562  auto operator()(const BasicJsonType& j, T& val) const
1563  noexcept(noexcept(from_json(j, val)))
1564  -> decltype(from_json(j, val), void())
1565  {
1566  return from_json(j, val);
1567  }
1568 };
1569 } // namespace detail
1570 
1574 namespace
1575 {
1576 constexpr const auto& from_json = detail::static_const<detail::from_json_fn>::value;
1577 } // namespace
1578 } // namespace json
1579 
1580 // #include <nlohmann/detail/conversions/to_json.hpp>
1581 
1582 
1583 #include <ciso646> // or, and, not
1584 #include <iterator> // begin, end
1585 #include <tuple> // tuple, get
1586 #include <type_traits> // is_same, is_constructible, is_floating_point, is_enum, underlying_type
1587 #include <utility> // move, forward, declval, pair
1588 #include <valarray> // valarray
1589 #include <vector> // vector
1590 
1591 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/cpp_future.hpp>
1592 
1593 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
1594 
1595 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
1596 
1597 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/iteration_proxy.hpp>
1598 
1599 
1600 #include <cstddef> // size_t
1601 #include <string> // string, to_string
1602 #include <iterator> // input_iterator_tag
1603 
1604 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
1605 
1606 
1607 namespace json
1608 {
1609 namespace detail
1610 {
1612 template<typename IteratorType> class iteration_proxy
1613 {
1614  private:
1616  class iteration_proxy_internal
1617  {
1618  public:
1619  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
1620  using value_type = iteration_proxy_internal;
1621  using pointer = iteration_proxy_internal*;
1622  using reference = iteration_proxy_internal&;
1623  using iterator_category = std::input_iterator_tag;
1624 
1625  private:
1627  IteratorType anchor;
1629  std::size_t array_index = 0;
1631  mutable std::size_t array_index_last = 0;
1633  mutable std::string array_index_str = "0";
1635  const std::string empty_str = "";
1636 
1637  public:
1638  explicit iteration_proxy_internal(IteratorType it) noexcept : anchor(it) {}
1639 
1641  iteration_proxy_internal& operator*()
1642  {
1643  return *this;
1644  }
1645 
1647  iteration_proxy_internal& operator++()
1648  {
1649  ++anchor;
1650  ++array_index;
1651 
1652  return *this;
1653  }
1654 
1656  bool operator==(const iteration_proxy_internal& o) const noexcept
1657  {
1658  return anchor == o.anchor;
1659  }
1660 
1662  bool operator!=(const iteration_proxy_internal& o) const noexcept
1663  {
1664  return anchor != o.anchor;
1665  }
1666 
1668  const std::string& key() const
1669  {
1670  assert(anchor.m_object != nullptr);
1671 
1672  switch (anchor.m_object->type())
1673  {
1674  // use integer array index as key
1675  case value_t::array:
1676  {
1677  if (array_index != array_index_last)
1678  {
1679  array_index_str = std::to_string(array_index);
1680  array_index_last = array_index;
1681  }
1682  return array_index_str;
1683  }
1684 
1685  // use key from the object
1686  case value_t::object:
1687  return anchor.key();
1688 
1689  // use an empty key for all primitive types
1690  default:
1691  return empty_str;
1692  }
1693  }
1694 
1696  typename IteratorType::reference value() const
1697  {
1698  return anchor.value();
1699  }
1700  };
1701 
1703  typename IteratorType::reference container;
1704 
1705  public:
1707  explicit iteration_proxy(typename IteratorType::reference cont) noexcept
1708  : container(cont) {}
1709 
1711  iteration_proxy_internal begin() noexcept
1712  {
1713  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.begin());
1714  }
1715 
1717  iteration_proxy_internal end() noexcept
1718  {
1719  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.end());
1720  }
1721 };
1722 } // namespace detail
1723 } // namespace json
1724 
1725 
1726 namespace json
1727 {
1728 namespace detail
1729 {
1731 // constructors //
1733 
1734 template<value_t> struct external_constructor;
1735 
1736 template<>
1737 struct external_constructor<value_t::boolean>
1738 {
1739  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1740  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t b) noexcept
1741  {
1742  j.m_type = value_t::boolean;
1743  j.m_value = b;
1744  j.assert_invariant();
1745  }
1746 };
1747 
1748 template<>
1749 struct external_constructor<value_t::string>
1750 {
1751  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1752  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
1753  {
1754  j.m_type = value_t::string;
1755  j.m_value = s;
1756  j.assert_invariant();
1757  }
1758 
1759  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1760  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t&& s)
1761  {
1762  j.m_type = value_t::string;
1763  j.m_value = std::move(s);
1764  j.assert_invariant();
1765  }
1766 
1767  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleStringType,
1768  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleStringType, typename BasicJsonType::string_t>::value,
1769  int> = 0>
1770  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleStringType& str)
1771  {
1772  j.m_type = value_t::string;
1773  j.m_value.string = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::string_t>(str);
1774  j.assert_invariant();
1775  }
1776 };
1777 
1778 template<>
1779 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_float>
1780 {
1781  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1782  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t val) noexcept
1783  {
1784  j.m_type = value_t::number_float;
1785  j.m_value = val;
1786  j.assert_invariant();
1787  }
1788 };
1789 
1790 template<>
1791 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>
1792 {
1793  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1794  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t val) noexcept
1795  {
1796  j.m_type = value_t::number_unsigned;
1797  j.m_value = val;
1798  j.assert_invariant();
1799  }
1800 };
1801 
1802 template<>
1803 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>
1804 {
1805  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1806  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t val) noexcept
1807  {
1808  j.m_type = value_t::number_integer;
1809  j.m_value = val;
1810  j.assert_invariant();
1811  }
1812 };
1813 
1814 template<>
1815 struct external_constructor<value_t::array>
1816 {
1817  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1818  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr)
1819  {
1820  j.m_type = value_t::array;
1821  j.m_value = arr;
1822  j.assert_invariant();
1823  }
1824 
1825  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1826  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t&& arr)
1827  {
1828  j.m_type = value_t::array;
1829  j.m_value = std::move(arr);
1830  j.assert_invariant();
1831  }
1832 
1833  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
1834  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleArrayType, typename BasicJsonType::array_t>::value,
1835  int> = 0>
1836  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr)
1837  {
1838  using std::begin;
1839  using std::end;
1840  j.m_type = value_t::array;
1841  j.m_value.array = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::array_t>(begin(arr), end(arr));
1842  j.assert_invariant();
1843  }
1844 
1845  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1846  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& arr)
1847  {
1848  j.m_type = value_t::array;
1849  j.m_value = value_t::array;
1850  j.m_value.array->reserve(arr.size());
1851  for (const bool x : arr)
1852  {
1853  j.m_value.array->push_back(x);
1854  }
1855  j.assert_invariant();
1856  }
1857 
1858  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
1859  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, BasicJsonType>::value, int> = 0>
1860  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const std::valarray<T>& arr)
1861  {
1862  j.m_type = value_t::array;
1863  j.m_value = value_t::array;
1864  j.m_value.array->resize(arr.size());
1865  std::copy(std::begin(arr), std::end(arr), j.m_value.array->begin());
1866  j.assert_invariant();
1867  }
1868 };
1869 
1870 template<>
1871 struct external_constructor<value_t::object>
1872 {
1873  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1874  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& obj)
1875  {
1876  j.m_type = value_t::object;
1877  j.m_value = obj;
1878  j.assert_invariant();
1879  }
1880 
1881  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1882  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::object_t&& obj)
1883  {
1884  j.m_type = value_t::object;
1885  j.m_value = std::move(obj);
1886  j.assert_invariant();
1887  }
1888 
1889  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
1890  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleObjectType, typename BasicJsonType::object_t>::value, int> = 0>
1891  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& obj)
1892  {
1893  using std::begin;
1894  using std::end;
1895 
1896  j.m_type = value_t::object;
1897  j.m_value.object = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::object_t>(begin(obj), end(obj));
1898  j.assert_invariant();
1899  }
1900 };
1901 
1903 // to_json //
1905 
1906 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
1907  enable_if_t<std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value, int> = 0>
1908 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, T b) noexcept
1909 {
1910  external_constructor<value_t::boolean>::construct(j, b);
1911 }
1912 
1913 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleString,
1914  enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t, CompatibleString>::value, int> = 0>
1915 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleString& s)
1916 {
1917  external_constructor<value_t::string>::construct(j, s);
1918 }
1919 
1920 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1921 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t&& s)
1922 {
1923  external_constructor<value_t::string>::construct(j, std::move(s));
1924 }
1925 
1926 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename FloatType,
1927  enable_if_t<std::is_floating_point<FloatType>::value, int> = 0>
1928 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, FloatType val) noexcept
1929 {
1930  external_constructor<value_t::number_float>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>(val));
1931 }
1932 
1933 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberUnsignedType,
1934  enable_if_t<is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t, CompatibleNumberUnsignedType>::value, int> = 0>
1935 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberUnsignedType val) noexcept
1936 {
1937  external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>(val));
1938 }
1939 
1940 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType,
1941  enable_if_t<is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value, int> = 0>
1942 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberIntegerType val) noexcept
1943 {
1944  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>(val));
1945 }
1946 
1947 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType,
1948  enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
1949 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, EnumType e) noexcept
1950 {
1951  using underlying_type = typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type;
1952  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(j, static_cast<underlying_type>(e));
1953 }
1954 
1955 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1956 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& e)
1957 {
1958  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, e);
1959 }
1960 
1961 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
1962  enable_if_t<is_compatible_array_type<BasicJsonType,
1963  CompatibleArrayType>::value and
1964  not is_compatible_object_type<
1965  BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
1966  not is_compatible_string_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
1967  not is_basic_json<CompatibleArrayType>::value,
1968  int> = 0>
1969 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr)
1970 {
1971  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
1972 }
1973 
1974 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
1975  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, BasicJsonType>::value, int> = 0>
1976 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::valarray<T>& arr)
1977 {
1978  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, std::move(arr));
1979 }
1980 
1981 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1982 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t&& arr)
1983 {
1984  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, std::move(arr));
1985 }
1986 
1987 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
1988  enable_if_t<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType>::value and not is_basic_json<CompatibleObjectType>::value, int> = 0>
1989 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& obj)
1990 {
1991  external_constructor<value_t::object>::construct(j, obj);
1992 }
1993 
1994 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1995 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::object_t&& obj)
1996 {
1997  external_constructor<value_t::object>::construct(j, std::move(obj));
1998 }
1999 
2000 template <
2001  typename BasicJsonType, typename T, std::size_t N,
2002  enable_if_t<not std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t,
2003  const T (&)[N]>::value,
2004  int> = 0 >
2005 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const T (&arr)[N])
2006 {
2007  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
2008 }
2009 
2010 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
2011 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::pair<Args...>& p)
2012 {
2013  j = {p.first, p.second};
2014 }
2015 
2016 // for https://github.com/nlohmann/json/pull/1134
2017 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
2018  enable_if_t<std::is_same<T, typename iteration_proxy<typename BasicJsonType::iterator>::iteration_proxy_internal>::value, int> = 0>
2019 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const T& b)
2020 {
2021  j = {{b.key(), b.value()}};
2022 }
2023 
2024 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename Tuple, std::size_t... Idx>
2025 void to_json_tuple_impl(BasicJsonType& j, const Tuple& t, index_sequence<Idx...> /*unused*/)
2026 {
2027  j = {std::get<Idx>(t)...};
2028 }
2029 
2030 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
2031 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::tuple<Args...>& t)
2032 {
2033  to_json_tuple_impl(j, t, index_sequence_for<Args...> {});
2034 }
2035 
2036 struct to_json_fn
2037 {
2038  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
2039  auto operator()(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val) const noexcept(noexcept(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val))))
2040  -> decltype(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val)), void())
2041  {
2042  return to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val));
2043  }
2044 };
2045 } // namespace detail
2046 
2048 namespace
2049 {
2050 constexpr const auto& to_json = detail::static_const<detail::to_json_fn>::value;
2051 } // namespace
2052 } // namespace json
2053 
2054 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/input_adapters.hpp>
2055 
2056 
2057 #include <cassert> // assert
2058 #include <cstddef> // size_t
2059 #include <cstring> // strlen
2060 #include <istream> // istream
2061 #include <iterator> // begin, end, iterator_traits, random_access_iterator_tag, distance, next
2062 #include <memory> // shared_ptr, make_shared, addressof
2063 #include <numeric> // accumulate
2064 #include <string> // string, char_traits
2065 #include <type_traits> // enable_if, is_base_of, is_pointer, is_integral, remove_pointer
2066 #include <utility> // pair, declval
2067 
2068 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
2069 
2070 
2071 namespace json
2072 {
2073 namespace detail
2074 {
2076 enum class input_format_t { json, cbor, msgpack, ubjson, bson };
2077 
2079 // input adapters //
2081 
2093 struct input_adapter_protocol
2094 {
2096  virtual std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() = 0;
2097  virtual ~input_adapter_protocol() = default;
2098 };
2099 
2101 using input_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<input_adapter_protocol>;
2102 
2112 class input_stream_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
2113 {
2114  public:
2115  ~input_stream_adapter() override
2116  {
2117  // clear stream flags; we use underlying streambuf I/O, do not
2118  // maintain ifstream flags, except eof
2119  is.clear(is.rdstate() & std::ios::eofbit);
2120  }
2121 
2122  explicit input_stream_adapter(std::istream& i)
2123  : is(i), sb(*i.rdbuf())
2124  {}
2125 
2126  // delete because of pointer members
2127  input_stream_adapter(const input_stream_adapter&) = delete;
2128  input_stream_adapter& operator=(input_stream_adapter&) = delete;
2129  input_stream_adapter(input_stream_adapter&&) = delete;
2130  input_stream_adapter& operator=(input_stream_adapter&&) = delete;
2131 
2132  // std::istream/std::streambuf use std::char_traits<char>::to_int_type, to
2133  // ensure that std::char_traits<char>::eof() and the character 0xFF do not
2134  // end up as the same value, eg. 0xFFFFFFFF.
2135  std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() override
2136  {
2137  auto res = sb.sbumpc();
2138  // set eof manually, as we don't use the istream interface.
2139  if (res == EOF)
2140  {
2141  is.clear(is.rdstate() | std::ios::eofbit);
2142  }
2143  return res;
2144  }
2145 
2146  private:
2148  std::istream& is;
2149  std::streambuf& sb;
2150 };
2151 
2153 class input_buffer_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
2154 {
2155  public:
2156  input_buffer_adapter(const char* b, const std::size_t l) noexcept
2157  : cursor(b), limit(b + l)
2158  {}
2159 
2160  // delete because of pointer members
2161  input_buffer_adapter(const input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
2162  input_buffer_adapter& operator=(input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
2163  input_buffer_adapter(input_buffer_adapter&&) = delete;
2164  input_buffer_adapter& operator=(input_buffer_adapter&&) = delete;
2165  ~input_buffer_adapter() override = default;
2166 
2167  std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() noexcept override
2168  {
2169  if (JSON_LIKELY(cursor < limit))
2170  {
2171  return std::char_traits<char>::to_int_type(*(cursor++));
2172  }
2173 
2174  return std::char_traits<char>::eof();
2175  }
2176 
2177  private:
2179  const char* cursor;
2181  const char* const limit;
2182 };
2183 
2184 template<typename WideStringType, size_t T>
2185 struct wide_string_input_helper
2186 {
2187  // UTF-32
2188  static void fill_buffer(const WideStringType& str, size_t& current_wchar, std::array<std::char_traits<char>::int_type, 4>& utf8_bytes, size_t& utf8_bytes_index, size_t& utf8_bytes_filled)
2189  {
2190  utf8_bytes_index = 0;
2191 
2192  if (current_wchar == str.size())
2193  {
2194  utf8_bytes[0] = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
2195  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2196  }
2197  else
2198  {
2199  // get the current character
2200  const auto wc = static_cast<int>(str[current_wchar++]);
2201 
2202  // UTF-32 to UTF-8 encoding
2203  if (wc < 0x80)
2204  {
2205  utf8_bytes[0] = wc;
2206  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2207  }
2208  else if (wc <= 0x7FF)
2209  {
2210  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xC0 | ((wc >> 6) & 0x1F);
2211  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | (wc & 0x3F);
2212  utf8_bytes_filled = 2;
2213  }
2214  else if (wc <= 0xFFFF)
2215  {
2216  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xE0 | ((wc >> 12) & 0x0F);
2217  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | ((wc >> 6) & 0x3F);
2218  utf8_bytes[2] = 0x80 | (wc & 0x3F);
2219  utf8_bytes_filled = 3;
2220  }
2221  else if (wc <= 0x10FFFF)
2222  {
2223  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xF0 | ((wc >> 18) & 0x07);
2224  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | ((wc >> 12) & 0x3F);
2225  utf8_bytes[2] = 0x80 | ((wc >> 6) & 0x3F);
2226  utf8_bytes[3] = 0x80 | (wc & 0x3F);
2227  utf8_bytes_filled = 4;
2228  }
2229  else
2230  {
2231  // unknown character
2232  utf8_bytes[0] = wc;
2233  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2234  }
2235  }
2236  }
2237 };
2238 
2239 template<typename WideStringType>
2240 struct wide_string_input_helper<WideStringType, 2>
2241 {
2242  // UTF-16
2243  static void fill_buffer(const WideStringType& str, size_t& current_wchar, std::array<std::char_traits<char>::int_type, 4>& utf8_bytes, size_t& utf8_bytes_index, size_t& utf8_bytes_filled)
2244  {
2245  utf8_bytes_index = 0;
2246 
2247  if (current_wchar == str.size())
2248  {
2249  utf8_bytes[0] = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
2250  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2251  }
2252  else
2253  {
2254  // get the current character
2255  const auto wc = static_cast<int>(str[current_wchar++]);
2256 
2257  // UTF-16 to UTF-8 encoding
2258  if (wc < 0x80)
2259  {
2260  utf8_bytes[0] = wc;
2261  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2262  }
2263  else if (wc <= 0x7FF)
2264  {
2265  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xC0 | ((wc >> 6));
2266  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | (wc & 0x3F);
2267  utf8_bytes_filled = 2;
2268  }
2269  else if (0xD800 > wc or wc >= 0xE000)
2270  {
2271  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xE0 | ((wc >> 12));
2272  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | ((wc >> 6) & 0x3F);
2273  utf8_bytes[2] = 0x80 | (wc & 0x3F);
2274  utf8_bytes_filled = 3;
2275  }
2276  else
2277  {
2278  if (current_wchar < str.size())
2279  {
2280  const auto wc2 = static_cast<int>(str[current_wchar++]);
2281  const int charcode = 0x10000 + (((wc & 0x3FF) << 10) | (wc2 & 0x3FF));
2282  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xf0 | (charcode >> 18);
2283  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | ((charcode >> 12) & 0x3F);
2284  utf8_bytes[2] = 0x80 | ((charcode >> 6) & 0x3F);
2285  utf8_bytes[3] = 0x80 | (charcode & 0x3F);
2286  utf8_bytes_filled = 4;
2287  }
2288  else
2289  {
2290  // unknown character
2291  ++current_wchar;
2292  utf8_bytes[0] = wc;
2293  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2294  }
2295  }
2296  }
2297  }
2298 };
2299 
2300 template<typename WideStringType>
2301 class wide_string_input_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
2302 {
2303  public:
2304  explicit wide_string_input_adapter(const WideStringType& w) noexcept
2305  : str(w)
2306  {}
2307 
2308  std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() noexcept override
2309  {
2310  // check if buffer needs to be filled
2311  if (utf8_bytes_index == utf8_bytes_filled)
2312  {
2313  fill_buffer<sizeof(typename WideStringType::value_type)>();
2314 
2315  assert(utf8_bytes_filled > 0);
2316  assert(utf8_bytes_index == 0);
2317  }
2318 
2319  // use buffer
2320  assert(utf8_bytes_filled > 0);
2321  assert(utf8_bytes_index < utf8_bytes_filled);
2322  return utf8_bytes[utf8_bytes_index++];
2323  }
2324 
2325  private:
2326  template<size_t T>
2327  void fill_buffer()
2328  {
2329  wide_string_input_helper<WideStringType, T>::fill_buffer(str, current_wchar, utf8_bytes, utf8_bytes_index, utf8_bytes_filled);
2330  }
2331 
2333  const WideStringType& str;
2334 
2336  std::size_t current_wchar = 0;
2337 
2339  std::array<std::char_traits<char>::int_type, 4> utf8_bytes = {{0, 0, 0, 0}};
2340 
2342  std::size_t utf8_bytes_index = 0;
2344  std::size_t utf8_bytes_filled = 0;
2345 };
2346 
2347 class input_adapter
2348 {
2349  public:
2350  // native support
2351 
2353  input_adapter(std::istream& i)
2354  : ia(std::make_shared<input_stream_adapter>(i)) {}
2355 
2357  input_adapter(std::istream&& i)
2358  : ia(std::make_shared<input_stream_adapter>(i)) {}
2359 
2360  input_adapter(const std::wstring& ws)
2361  : ia(std::make_shared<wide_string_input_adapter<std::wstring>>(ws)) {}
2362 
2363  input_adapter(const std::u16string& ws)
2364  : ia(std::make_shared<wide_string_input_adapter<std::u16string>>(ws)) {}
2365 
2366  input_adapter(const std::u32string& ws)
2367  : ia(std::make_shared<wide_string_input_adapter<std::u32string>>(ws)) {}
2368 
2370  template<typename CharT,
2371  typename std::enable_if<
2372  std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
2373  std::is_integral<typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
2374  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
2375  int>::type = 0>
2376  input_adapter(CharT b, std::size_t l)
2377  : ia(std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b), l)) {}
2378 
2379  // derived support
2380 
2382  template<typename CharT,
2383  typename std::enable_if<
2384  std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
2385  std::is_integral<typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
2386  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
2387  int>::type = 0>
2388  input_adapter(CharT b)
2389  : input_adapter(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b),
2390  std::strlen(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b))) {}
2391 
2393  template<class IteratorType,
2394  typename std::enable_if<
2395  std::is_same<typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category, std::random_access_iterator_tag>::value,
2396  int>::type = 0>
2397  input_adapter(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
2398  {
2399 #ifndef NDEBUG
2400  // assertion to check that the iterator range is indeed contiguous,
2401  // see http://stackoverflow.com/a/35008842/266378 for more discussion
2402  const auto is_contiguous = std::accumulate(
2403  first, last, std::pair<bool, int>(true, 0),
2404  [&first](std::pair<bool, int> res, decltype(*first) val)
2405  {
2406  res.first &= (val == *(std::next(std::addressof(*first), res.second++)));
2407  return res;
2408  }).first;
2409  assert(is_contiguous);
2410 #endif
2411 
2412  // assertion to check that each element is 1 byte long
2413  static_assert(
2414  sizeof(typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type) == 1,
2415  "each element in the iterator range must have the size of 1 byte");
2416 
2417  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(first, last));
2418  if (JSON_LIKELY(len > 0))
2419  {
2420  // there is at least one element: use the address of first
2421  ia = std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(&(*first)), len);
2422  }
2423  else
2424  {
2425  // the address of first cannot be used: use nullptr
2426  ia = std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(nullptr, len);
2427  }
2428  }
2429 
2431  template<class T, std::size_t N>
2432  input_adapter(T (&array)[N])
2433  : input_adapter(std::begin(array), std::end(array)) {}
2434 
2436  template<class ContiguousContainer, typename
2437  std::enable_if<not std::is_pointer<ContiguousContainer>::value and
2438  std::is_base_of<std::random_access_iterator_tag, typename std::iterator_traits<decltype(std::begin(std::declval<ContiguousContainer const>()))>::iterator_category>::value,
2439  int>::type = 0>
2440  input_adapter(const ContiguousContainer& c)
2441  : input_adapter(std::begin(c), std::end(c)) {}
2442 
2443  operator input_adapter_t()
2444  {
2445  return ia;
2446  }
2447 
2448  private:
2450  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
2451 };
2452 } // namespace detail
2453 } // namespace json
2454 
2455 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/lexer.hpp>
2456 
2457 
2458 #include <clocale> // localeconv
2459 #include <cstddef> // size_t
2460 #include <cstdlib> // strtof, strtod, strtold, strtoll, strtoull
2461 #include <cstdio> // snprintf
2462 #include <initializer_list> // initializer_list
2463 #include <string> // char_traits, string
2464 #include <vector> // vector
2465 
2466 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
2467 
2468 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/input_adapters.hpp>
2469 
2470 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/position_t.hpp>
2471 
2472 
2473 namespace json
2474 {
2475 namespace detail
2476 {
2478 // lexer //
2480 
2486 template<typename BasicJsonType>
2487 class lexer
2488 {
2489  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
2490  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
2491  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
2492  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
2493 
2494  public:
2496  enum class token_type
2497  {
2498  uninitialized,
2499  literal_true,
2500  literal_false,
2501  literal_null,
2502  value_string,
2503  value_unsigned,
2504  value_integer,
2505  value_float,
2506  begin_array,
2507  begin_object,
2508  end_array,
2509  end_object,
2510  name_separator,
2511  value_separator,
2512  parse_error,
2513  end_of_input,
2514  literal_or_value
2515  };
2516 
2518  static const char* token_type_name(const token_type t) noexcept
2519  {
2520  switch (t)
2521  {
2522  case token_type::uninitialized:
2523  return "<uninitialized>";
2524  case token_type::literal_true:
2525  return "true literal";
2526  case token_type::literal_false:
2527  return "false literal";
2528  case token_type::literal_null:
2529  return "null literal";
2530  case token_type::value_string:
2531  return "string literal";
2532  case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned:
2533  case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
2534  case lexer::token_type::value_float:
2535  return "number literal";
2536  case token_type::begin_array:
2537  return "'['";
2538  case token_type::begin_object:
2539  return "'{'";
2540  case token_type::end_array:
2541  return "']'";
2542  case token_type::end_object:
2543  return "'}'";
2544  case token_type::name_separator:
2545  return "':'";
2546  case token_type::value_separator:
2547  return "','";
2548  case token_type::parse_error:
2549  return "<parse error>";
2550  case token_type::end_of_input:
2551  return "end of input";
2552  case token_type::literal_or_value:
2553  return "'[', '{', or a literal";
2554  // LCOV_EXCL_START
2555  default: // catch non-enum values
2556  return "unknown token";
2557  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
2558  }
2559  }
2560 
2561  explicit lexer(detail::input_adapter_t&& adapter)
2562  : ia(std::move(adapter)), decimal_point_char(get_decimal_point()) {}
2563 
2564  // delete because of pointer members
2565  lexer(const lexer&) = delete;
2566  lexer(lexer&&) = delete;
2567  lexer& operator=(lexer&) = delete;
2568  lexer& operator=(lexer&&) = delete;
2569  ~lexer() = default;
2570 
2571  private:
2573  // locales
2575 
2577  static char get_decimal_point() noexcept
2578  {
2579  const auto loc = localeconv();
2580  assert(loc != nullptr);
2581  return (loc->decimal_point == nullptr) ? '.' : *(loc->decimal_point);
2582  }
2583 
2585  // scan functions
2587 
2603  int get_codepoint()
2604  {
2605  // this function only makes sense after reading `\u`
2606  assert(current == 'u');
2607  int codepoint = 0;
2608 
2609  const auto factors = { 12, 8, 4, 0 };
2610  for (const auto factor : factors)
2611  {
2612  get();
2613 
2614  if (current >= '0' and current <= '9')
2615  {
2616  codepoint += ((current - 0x30) << factor);
2617  }
2618  else if (current >= 'A' and current <= 'F')
2619  {
2620  codepoint += ((current - 0x37) << factor);
2621  }
2622  else if (current >= 'a' and current <= 'f')
2623  {
2624  codepoint += ((current - 0x57) << factor);
2625  }
2626  else
2627  {
2628  return -1;
2629  }
2630  }
2631 
2632  assert(0x0000 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0xFFFF);
2633  return codepoint;
2634  }
2635 
2651  bool next_byte_in_range(std::initializer_list<int> ranges)
2652  {
2653  assert(ranges.size() == 2 or ranges.size() == 4 or ranges.size() == 6);
2654  add(current);
2655 
2656  for (auto range = ranges.begin(); range != ranges.end(); ++range)
2657  {
2658  get();
2659  if (JSON_LIKELY(*range <= current and current <= *(++range)))
2660  {
2661  add(current);
2662  }
2663  else
2664  {
2665  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
2666  return false;
2667  }
2668  }
2669 
2670  return true;
2671  }
2672 
2688  token_type scan_string()
2689  {
2690  // reset token_buffer (ignore opening quote)
2691  reset();
2692 
2693  // we entered the function by reading an open quote
2694  assert(current == '\"');
2695 
2696  while (true)
2697  {
2698  // get next character
2699  switch (get())
2700  {
2701  // end of file while parsing string
2702  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
2703  {
2704  error_message = "invalid string: missing closing quote";
2705  return token_type::parse_error;
2706  }
2707 
2708  // closing quote
2709  case '\"':
2710  {
2711  return token_type::value_string;
2712  }
2713 
2714  // escapes
2715  case '\\':
2716  {
2717  switch (get())
2718  {
2719  // quotation mark
2720  case '\"':
2721  add('\"');
2722  break;
2723  // reverse solidus
2724  case '\\':
2725  add('\\');
2726  break;
2727  // solidus
2728  case '/':
2729  add('/');
2730  break;
2731  // backspace
2732  case 'b':
2733  add('\b');
2734  break;
2735  // form feed
2736  case 'f':
2737  add('\f');
2738  break;
2739  // line feed
2740  case 'n':
2741  add('\n');
2742  break;
2743  // carriage return
2744  case 'r':
2745  add('\r');
2746  break;
2747  // tab
2748  case 't':
2749  add('\t');
2750  break;
2751 
2752  // unicode escapes
2753  case 'u':
2754  {
2755  const int codepoint1 = get_codepoint();
2756  int codepoint = codepoint1; // start with codepoint1
2757 
2758  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint1 == -1))
2759  {
2760  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
2761  return token_type::parse_error;
2762  }
2763 
2764  // check if code point is a high surrogate
2765  if (0xD800 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDBFF)
2766  {
2767  // expect next \uxxxx entry
2768  if (JSON_LIKELY(get() == '\\' and get() == 'u'))
2769  {
2770  const int codepoint2 = get_codepoint();
2771 
2772  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint2 == -1))
2773  {
2774  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
2775  return token_type::parse_error;
2776  }
2777 
2778  // check if codepoint2 is a low surrogate
2779  if (JSON_LIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint2 and codepoint2 <= 0xDFFF))
2780  {
2781  // overwrite codepoint
2782  codepoint =
2783  // high surrogate occupies the most significant 22 bits
2784  (codepoint1 << 10)
2785  // low surrogate occupies the least significant 15 bits
2786  + codepoint2
2787  // there is still the 0xD800, 0xDC00 and 0x10000 noise
2788  // in the result so we have to subtract with:
2789  // (0xD800 << 10) + DC00 - 0x10000 = 0x35FDC00
2790  - 0x35FDC00;
2791  }
2792  else
2793  {
2794  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
2795  return token_type::parse_error;
2796  }
2797  }
2798  else
2799  {
2800  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
2801  return token_type::parse_error;
2802  }
2803  }
2804  else
2805  {
2806  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDFFF))
2807  {
2808  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must follow U+D800..U+DBFF";
2809  return token_type::parse_error;
2810  }
2811  }
2812 
2813  // result of the above calculation yields a proper codepoint
2814  assert(0x00 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
2815 
2816  // translate codepoint into bytes
2817  if (codepoint < 0x80)
2818  {
2819  // 1-byte characters: 0xxxxxxx (ASCII)
2820  add(codepoint);
2821  }
2822  else if (codepoint <= 0x7FF)
2823  {
2824  // 2-byte characters: 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
2825  add(0xC0 | (codepoint >> 6));
2826  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
2827  }
2828  else if (codepoint <= 0xFFFF)
2829  {
2830  // 3-byte characters: 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
2831  add(0xE0 | (codepoint >> 12));
2832  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
2833  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
2834  }
2835  else
2836  {
2837  // 4-byte characters: 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
2838  add(0xF0 | (codepoint >> 18));
2839  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3F));
2840  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
2841  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
2842  }
2843 
2844  break;
2845  }
2846 
2847  // other characters after escape
2848  default:
2849  error_message = "invalid string: forbidden character after backslash";
2850  return token_type::parse_error;
2851  }
2852 
2853  break;
2854  }
2855 
2856  // invalid control characters
2857  case 0x00:
2858  {
2859  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0000 (NUL) must be escaped to \\u0000";
2860  return token_type::parse_error;
2861  }
2862 
2863  case 0x01:
2864  {
2865  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0001 (SOH) must be escaped to \\u0001";
2866  return token_type::parse_error;
2867  }
2868 
2869  case 0x02:
2870  {
2871  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0002 (STX) must be escaped to \\u0002";
2872  return token_type::parse_error;
2873  }
2874 
2875  case 0x03:
2876  {
2877  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0003 (ETX) must be escaped to \\u0003";
2878  return token_type::parse_error;
2879  }
2880 
2881  case 0x04:
2882  {
2883  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0004 (EOT) must be escaped to \\u0004";
2884  return token_type::parse_error;
2885  }
2886 
2887  case 0x05:
2888  {
2889  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0005 (ENQ) must be escaped to \\u0005";
2890  return token_type::parse_error;
2891  }
2892 
2893  case 0x06:
2894  {
2895  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0006 (ACK) must be escaped to \\u0006";
2896  return token_type::parse_error;
2897  }
2898 
2899  case 0x07:
2900  {
2901  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0007 (BEL) must be escaped to \\u0007";
2902  return token_type::parse_error;
2903  }
2904 
2905  case 0x08:
2906  {
2907  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0008 (BS) must be escaped to \\u0008 or \\b";
2908  return token_type::parse_error;
2909  }
2910 
2911  case 0x09:
2912  {
2913  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0009 (HT) must be escaped to \\u0009 or \\t";
2914  return token_type::parse_error;
2915  }
2916
