2917  case 0x0A:
2918  {
2919  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000A (LF) must be escaped to \\u000A or \\n";
2920  return token_type::parse_error;
2921  }
2922 
2923  case 0x0B:
2924  {
2925  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000B (VT) must be escaped to \\u000B";
2926  return token_type::parse_error;
2927  }
2928 
2929  case 0x0C:
2930  {
2931  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000C (FF) must be escaped to \\u000C or \\f";
2932  return token_type::parse_error;
2933  }
2934 
2935  case 0x0D:
2936  {
2937  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000D (CR) must be escaped to \\u000D or \\r";
2938  return token_type::parse_error;
2939  }
2940 
2941  case 0x0E:
2942  {
2943  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000E (SO) must be escaped to \\u000E";
2944  return token_type::parse_error;
2945  }
2946 
2947  case 0x0F:
2948  {
2949  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000F (SI) must be escaped to \\u000F";
2950  return token_type::parse_error;
2951  }
2952 
2953  case 0x10:
2954  {
2955  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0010 (DLE) must be escaped to \\u0010";
2956  return token_type::parse_error;
2957  }
2958 
2959  case 0x11:
2960  {
2961  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0011 (DC1) must be escaped to \\u0011";
2962  return token_type::parse_error;
2963  }
2964 
2965  case 0x12:
2966  {
2967  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0012 (DC2) must be escaped to \\u0012";
2968  return token_type::parse_error;
2969  }
2970 
2971  case 0x13:
2972  {
2973  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0013 (DC3) must be escaped to \\u0013";
2974  return token_type::parse_error;
2975  }
2976 
2977  case 0x14:
2978  {
2979  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0014 (DC4) must be escaped to \\u0014";
2980  return token_type::parse_error;
2981  }
2982 
2983  case 0x15:
2984  {
2985  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0015 (NAK) must be escaped to \\u0015";
2986  return token_type::parse_error;
2987  }
2988 
2989  case 0x16:
2990  {
2991  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0016 (SYN) must be escaped to \\u0016";
2992  return token_type::parse_error;
2993  }
2994 
2995  case 0x17:
2996  {
2997  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0017 (ETB) must be escaped to \\u0017";
2998  return token_type::parse_error;
2999  }
3000 
3001  case 0x18:
3002  {
3003  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0018 (CAN) must be escaped to \\u0018";
3004  return token_type::parse_error;
3005  }
3006 
3007  case 0x19:
3008  {
3009  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0019 (EM) must be escaped to \\u0019";
3010  return token_type::parse_error;
3011  }
3012 
3013  case 0x1A:
3014  {
3015  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001A (SUB) must be escaped to \\u001A";
3016  return token_type::parse_error;
3017  }
3018 
3019  case 0x1B:
3020  {
3021  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001B (ESC) must be escaped to \\u001B";
3022  return token_type::parse_error;
3023  }
3024 
3025  case 0x1C:
3026  {
3027  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001C (FS) must be escaped to \\u001C";
3028  return token_type::parse_error;
3029  }
3030 
3031  case 0x1D:
3032  {
3033  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001D (GS) must be escaped to \\u001D";
3034  return token_type::parse_error;
3035  }
3036 
3037  case 0x1E:
3038  {
3039  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001E (RS) must be escaped to \\u001E";
3040  return token_type::parse_error;
3041  }
3042 
3043  case 0x1F:
3044  {
3045  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001F (US) must be escaped to \\u001F";
3046  return token_type::parse_error;
3047  }
3048 
3049  // U+0020..U+007F (except U+0022 (quote) and U+005C (backspace))
3050  case 0x20:
3051  case 0x21:
3052  case 0x23:
3053  case 0x24:
3054  case 0x25:
3055  case 0x26:
3056  case 0x27:
3057  case 0x28:
3058  case 0x29:
3059  case 0x2A:
3060  case 0x2B:
3061  case 0x2C:
3062  case 0x2D:
3063  case 0x2E:
3064  case 0x2F:
3065  case 0x30:
3066  case 0x31:
3067  case 0x32:
3068  case 0x33:
3069  case 0x34:
3070  case 0x35:
3071  case 0x36:
3072  case 0x37:
3073  case 0x38:
3074  case 0x39:
3075  case 0x3A:
3076  case 0x3B:
3077  case 0x3C:
3078  case 0x3D:
3079  case 0x3E:
3080  case 0x3F:
3081  case 0x40:
3082  case 0x41:
3083  case 0x42:
3084  case 0x43:
3085  case 0x44:
3086  case 0x45:
3087  case 0x46:
3088  case 0x47:
3089  case 0x48:
3090  case 0x49:
3091  case 0x4A:
3092  case 0x4B:
3093  case 0x4C:
3094  case 0x4D:
3095  case 0x4E:
3096  case 0x4F:
3097  case 0x50:
3098  case 0x51:
3099  case 0x52:
3100  case 0x53:
3101  case 0x54:
3102  case 0x55:
3103  case 0x56:
3104  case 0x57:
3105  case 0x58:
3106  case 0x59:
3107  case 0x5A:
3108  case 0x5B:
3109  case 0x5D:
3110  case 0x5E:
3111  case 0x5F:
3112  case 0x60:
3113  case 0x61:
3114  case 0x62:
3115  case 0x63:
3116  case 0x64:
3117  case 0x65:
3118  case 0x66:
3119  case 0x67:
3120  case 0x68:
3121  case 0x69:
3122  case 0x6A:
3123  case 0x6B:
3124  case 0x6C:
3125  case 0x6D:
3126  case 0x6E:
3127  case 0x6F:
3128  case 0x70:
3129  case 0x71:
3130  case 0x72:
3131  case 0x73:
3132  case 0x74:
3133  case 0x75:
3134  case 0x76:
3135  case 0x77:
3136  case 0x78:
3137  case 0x79:
3138  case 0x7A:
3139  case 0x7B:
3140  case 0x7C:
3141  case 0x7D:
3142  case 0x7E:
3143  case 0x7F:
3144  {
3145  add(current);
3146  break;
3147  }
3148 
3149  // U+0080..U+07FF: bytes C2..DF 80..BF
3150  case 0xC2:
3151  case 0xC3:
3152  case 0xC4:
3153  case 0xC5:
3154  case 0xC6:
3155  case 0xC7:
3156  case 0xC8:
3157  case 0xC9:
3158  case 0xCA:
3159  case 0xCB:
3160  case 0xCC:
3161  case 0xCD:
3162  case 0xCE:
3163  case 0xCF:
3164  case 0xD0:
3165  case 0xD1:
3166  case 0xD2:
3167  case 0xD3:
3168  case 0xD4:
3169  case 0xD5:
3170  case 0xD6:
3171  case 0xD7:
3172  case 0xD8:
3173  case 0xD9:
3174  case 0xDA:
3175  case 0xDB:
3176  case 0xDC:
3177  case 0xDD:
3178  case 0xDE:
3179  case 0xDF:
3180  {
3181  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF})))
3182  {
3183  return token_type::parse_error;
3184  }
3185  break;
3186  }
3187 
3188  // U+0800..U+0FFF: bytes E0 A0..BF 80..BF
3189  case 0xE0:
3190  {
3191  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0xA0, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3192  {
3193  return token_type::parse_error;
3194  }
3195  break;
3196  }
3197 
3198  // U+1000..U+CFFF: bytes E1..EC 80..BF 80..BF
3199  // U+E000..U+FFFF: bytes EE..EF 80..BF 80..BF
3200  case 0xE1:
3201  case 0xE2:
3202  case 0xE3:
3203  case 0xE4:
3204  case 0xE5:
3205  case 0xE6:
3206  case 0xE7:
3207  case 0xE8:
3208  case 0xE9:
3209  case 0xEA:
3210  case 0xEB:
3211  case 0xEC:
3212  case 0xEE:
3213  case 0xEF:
3214  {
3215  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3216  {
3217  return token_type::parse_error;
3218  }
3219  break;
3220  }
3221 
3222  // U+D000..U+D7FF: bytes ED 80..9F 80..BF
3223  case 0xED:
3224  {
3225  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0x9F, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3226  {
3227  return token_type::parse_error;
3228  }
3229  break;
3230  }
3231 
3232  // U+10000..U+3FFFF F0 90..BF 80..BF 80..BF
3233  case 0xF0:
3234  {
3235  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x90, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3236  {
3237  return token_type::parse_error;
3238  }
3239  break;
3240  }
3241 
3242  // U+40000..U+FFFFF F1..F3 80..BF 80..BF 80..BF
3243  case 0xF1:
3244  case 0xF2:
3245  case 0xF3:
3246  {
3247  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3248  {
3249  return token_type::parse_error;
3250  }
3251  break;
3252  }
3253 
3254  // U+100000..U+10FFFF F4 80..8F 80..BF 80..BF
3255  case 0xF4:
3256  {
3257  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0x8F, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3258  {
3259  return token_type::parse_error;
3260  }
3261  break;
3262  }
3263 
3264  // remaining bytes (80..C1 and F5..FF) are ill-formed
3265  default:
3266  {
3267  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
3268  return token_type::parse_error;
3269  }
3270  }
3271  }
3272  }
3273 
3274  static void strtof(float& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
3275  {
3276  f = std::strtof(str, endptr);
3277  }
3278 
3279  static void strtof(double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
3280  {
3281  f = std::strtod(str, endptr);
3282  }
3283 
3284  static void strtof(long double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
3285  {
3286  f = std::strtold(str, endptr);
3287  }
3288 
3329  token_type scan_number() // lgtm [cpp/use-of-goto]
3330  {
3331  // reset token_buffer to store the number's bytes
3332  reset();
3333 
3334  // the type of the parsed number; initially set to unsigned; will be
3335  // changed if minus sign, decimal point or exponent is read
3336  token_type number_type = token_type::value_unsigned;
3337 
3338  // state (init): we just found out we need to scan a number
3339  switch (current)
3340  {
3341  case '-':
3342  {
3343  add(current);
3344  goto scan_number_minus;
3345  }
3346 
3347  case '0':
3348  {
3349  add(current);
3350  goto scan_number_zero;
3351  }
3352 
3353  case '1':
3354  case '2':
3355  case '3':
3356  case '4':
3357  case '5':
3358  case '6':
3359  case '7':
3360  case '8':
3361  case '9':
3362  {
3363  add(current);
3364  goto scan_number_any1;
3365  }
3366 
3367  // LCOV_EXCL_START
3368  default:
3369  {
3370  // all other characters are rejected outside scan_number()
3371  assert(false);
3372  }
3373  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
3374  }
3375 
3376 scan_number_minus:
3377  // state: we just parsed a leading minus sign
3378  number_type = token_type::value_integer;
3379  switch (get())
3380  {
3381  case '0':
3382  {
3383  add(current);
3384  goto scan_number_zero;
3385  }
3386 
3387  case '1':
3388  case '2':
3389  case '3':
3390  case '4':
3391  case '5':
3392  case '6':
3393  case '7':
3394  case '8':
3395  case '9':
3396  {
3397  add(current);
3398  goto scan_number_any1;
3399  }
3400 
3401  default:
3402  {
3403  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '-'";
3404  return token_type::parse_error;
3405  }
3406  }
3407 
3408 scan_number_zero:
3409  // state: we just parse a zero (maybe with a leading minus sign)
3410  switch (get())
3411  {
3412  case '.':
3413  {
3414  add(decimal_point_char);
3415  goto scan_number_decimal1;
3416  }
3417 
3418  case 'e':
3419  case 'E':
3420  {
3421  add(current);
3422  goto scan_number_exponent;
3423  }
3424 
3425  default:
3426  goto scan_number_done;
3427  }
3428 
3429 scan_number_any1:
3430  // state: we just parsed a number 0-9 (maybe with a leading minus sign)
3431  switch (get())
3432  {
3433  case '0':
3434  case '1':
3435  case '2':
3436  case '3':
3437  case '4':
3438  case '5':
3439  case '6':
3440  case '7':
3441  case '8':
3442  case '9':
3443  {
3444  add(current);
3445  goto scan_number_any1;
3446  }
3447 
3448  case '.':
3449  {
3450  add(decimal_point_char);
3451  goto scan_number_decimal1;
3452  }
3453 
3454  case 'e':
3455  case 'E':
3456  {
3457  add(current);
3458  goto scan_number_exponent;
3459  }
3460 
3461  default:
3462  goto scan_number_done;
3463  }
3464 
3465 scan_number_decimal1:
3466  // state: we just parsed a decimal point
3467  number_type = token_type::value_float;
3468  switch (get())
3469  {
3470  case '0':
3471  case '1':
3472  case '2':
3473  case '3':
3474  case '4':
3475  case '5':
3476  case '6':
3477  case '7':
3478  case '8':
3479  case '9':
3480  {
3481  add(current);
3482  goto scan_number_decimal2;
3483  }
3484 
3485  default:
3486  {
3487  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '.'";
3488  return token_type::parse_error;
3489  }
3490  }
3491 
3492 scan_number_decimal2:
3493  // we just parsed at least one number after a decimal point
3494  switch (get())
3495  {
3496  case '0':
3497  case '1':
3498  case '2':
3499  case '3':
3500  case '4':
3501  case '5':
3502  case '6':
3503  case '7':
3504  case '8':
3505  case '9':
3506  {
3507  add(current);
3508  goto scan_number_decimal2;
3509  }
3510 
3511  case 'e':
3512  case 'E':
3513  {
3514  add(current);
3515  goto scan_number_exponent;
3516  }
3517 
3518  default:
3519  goto scan_number_done;
3520  }
3521 
3522 scan_number_exponent:
3523  // we just parsed an exponent
3524  number_type = token_type::value_float;
3525  switch (get())
3526  {
3527  case '+':
3528  case '-':
3529  {
3530  add(current);
3531  goto scan_number_sign;
3532  }
3533 
3534  case '0':
3535  case '1':
3536  case '2':
3537  case '3':
3538  case '4':
3539  case '5':
3540  case '6':
3541  case '7':
3542  case '8':
3543  case '9':
3544  {
3545  add(current);
3546  goto scan_number_any2;
3547  }
3548 
3549  default:
3550  {
3551  error_message =
3552  "invalid number; expected '+', '-', or digit after exponent";
3553  return token_type::parse_error;
3554  }
3555  }
3556 
3557 scan_number_sign:
3558  // we just parsed an exponent sign
3559  switch (get())
3560  {
3561  case '0':
3562  case '1':
3563  case '2':
3564  case '3':
3565  case '4':
3566  case '5':
3567  case '6':
3568  case '7':
3569  case '8':
3570  case '9':
3571  {
3572  add(current);
3573  goto scan_number_any2;
3574  }
3575 
3576  default:
3577  {
3578  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after exponent sign";
3579  return token_type::parse_error;
3580  }
3581  }
3582 
3583 scan_number_any2:
3584  // we just parsed a number after the exponent or exponent sign
3585  switch (get())
3586  {
3587  case '0':
3588  case '1':
3589  case '2':
3590  case '3':
3591  case '4':
3592  case '5':
3593  case '6':
3594  case '7':
3595  case '8':
3596  case '9':
3597  {
3598  add(current);
3599  goto scan_number_any2;
3600  }
3601 
3602  default:
3603  goto scan_number_done;
3604  }
3605 
3606 scan_number_done:
3607  // unget the character after the number (we only read it to know that
3608  // we are done scanning a number)
3609  unget();
3610 
3611  char* endptr = nullptr;
3612  errno = 0;
3613 
3614  // try to parse integers first and fall back to floats
3615  if (number_type == token_type::value_unsigned)
3616  {
3617  const auto x = std::strtoull(token_buffer.data(), &endptr, 10);
3618 
3619  // we checked the number format before
3620  assert(endptr == token_buffer.data() + token_buffer.size());
3621 
3622  if (errno == 0)
3623  {
3624  value_unsigned = static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(x);
3625  if (value_unsigned == x)
3626  {
3627  return token_type::value_unsigned;
3628  }
3629  }
3630  }
3631  else if (number_type == token_type::value_integer)
3632  {
3633  const auto x = std::strtoll(token_buffer.data(), &endptr, 10);
3634 
3635  // we checked the number format before
3636  assert(endptr == token_buffer.data() + token_buffer.size());
3637 
3638  if (errno == 0)
3639  {
3640  value_integer = static_cast<number_integer_t>(x);
3641  if (value_integer == x)
3642  {
3643  return token_type::value_integer;
3644  }
3645  }
3646  }
3647 
3648  // this code is reached if we parse a floating-point number or if an
3649  // integer conversion above failed
3650  strtof(value_float, token_buffer.data(), &endptr);
3651 
3652  // we checked the number format before
3653  assert(endptr == token_buffer.data() + token_buffer.size());
3654 
3655  return token_type::value_float;
3656  }
3657 
3663  token_type scan_literal(const char* literal_text, const std::size_t length,
3664  token_type return_type)
3665  {
3666  assert(current == literal_text[0]);
3667  for (std::size_t i = 1; i < length; ++i)
3668  {
3669  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get() != literal_text[i]))
3670  {
3671  error_message = "invalid literal";
3672  return token_type::parse_error;
3673  }
3674  }
3675  return return_type;
3676  }
3677 
3679  // input management
3681 
3683  void reset() noexcept
3684  {
3685  token_buffer.clear();
3686  token_string.clear();
3687  token_string.push_back(std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(current));
3688  }
3689 
3690  /*
3691  @brief get next character from the input
3692 
3693  This function provides the interface to the used input adapter. It does
3694  not throw in case the input reached EOF, but returns a
3695  `std::char_traits<char>::eof()` in that case. Stores the scanned characters
3696  for use in error messages.
3697 
3698  @return character read from the input
3699  */
3700  std::char_traits<char>::int_type get()
3701  {
3702  ++position.chars_read_total;
3703  ++position.chars_read_current_line;
3704 
3705  if (next_unget)
3706  {
3707  // just reset the next_unget variable and work with current
3708  next_unget = false;
3709  }
3710  else
3711  {
3712  current = ia->get_character();
3713  }
3714 
3715  if (JSON_LIKELY(current != std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
3716  {
3717  token_string.push_back(std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(current));
3718  }
3719 
3720  if (current == '\n')
3721  {
3722  ++position.lines_read;
3723  ++position.chars_read_current_line = 0;
3724  }
3725 
3726  return current;
3727  }
3728 
3737  void unget()
3738  {
3739  next_unget = true;
3740 
3741  --position.chars_read_total;
3742 
3743  // in case we "unget" a newline, we have to also decrement the lines_read
3744  if (position.chars_read_current_line == 0)
3745  {
3746  if (position.lines_read > 0)
3747  {
3748  --position.lines_read;
3749  }
3750  }
3751  else
3752  {
3753  --position.chars_read_current_line;
3754  }
3755 
3756  if (JSON_LIKELY(current != std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
3757  {
3758  assert(token_string.size() != 0);
3759  token_string.pop_back();
3760  }
3761  }
3762 
3764  void add(int c)
3765  {
3766  token_buffer.push_back(std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(c));
3767  }
3768 
3769  public:
3771  // value getters
3773 
3775  constexpr number_integer_t get_number_integer() const noexcept
3776  {
3777  return value_integer;
3778  }
3779 
3781  constexpr number_unsigned_t get_number_unsigned() const noexcept
3782  {
3783  return value_unsigned;
3784  }
3785 
3787  constexpr number_float_t get_number_float() const noexcept
3788  {
3789  return value_float;
3790  }
3791 
3793  string_t& get_string()
3794  {
3795  return token_buffer;
3796  }
3797 
3799  // diagnostics
3801 
3803  constexpr position_t get_position() const noexcept
3804  {
3805  return position;
3806  }
3807 
3811  std::string get_token_string() const
3812  {
3813  // escape control characters
3814  std::string result;
3815  for (const auto c : token_string)
3816  {
3817  if ('\x00' <= c and c <= '\x1F')
3818  {
3819  // escape control characters
3820  char cs[9];
3821  (std::snprintf)(cs, 9, "<U+%.4X>", static_cast<unsigned char>(c));
3822  result += cs;
3823  }
3824  else
3825  {
3826  // add character as is
3827  result.push_back(c);
3828  }
3829  }
3830 
3831  return result;
3832  }
3833 
3835  constexpr const char* get_error_message() const noexcept
3836  {
3837  return error_message;
3838  }
3839 
3841  // actual scanner
3843 
3848  bool skip_bom()
3849  {
3850  if (get() == 0xEF)
3851  {
3852  // check if we completely parse the BOM
3853  return get() == 0xBB and get() == 0xBF;
3854  }
3855 
3856  // the first character is not the beginning of the BOM; unget it to
3857  // process is later
3858  unget();
3859  return true;
3860  }
3861 
3862  token_type scan()
3863  {
3864  // initially, skip the BOM
3865  if (position.chars_read_total == 0 and not skip_bom())
3866  {
3867  error_message = "invalid BOM; must be 0xEF 0xBB 0xBF if given";
3868  return token_type::parse_error;
3869  }
3870 
3871  // read next character and ignore whitespace
3872  do
3873  {
3874  get();
3875  }
3876  while (current == ' ' or current == '\t' or current == '\n' or current == '\r');
3877 
3878  switch (current)
3879  {
3880  // structural characters
3881  case '[':
3882  return token_type::begin_array;
3883  case ']':
3884  return token_type::end_array;
3885  case '{':
3886  return token_type::begin_object;
3887  case '}':
3888  return token_type::end_object;
3889  case ':':
3890  return token_type::name_separator;
3891  case ',':
3892  return token_type::value_separator;
3893 
3894  // literals
3895  case 't':
3896  return scan_literal("true", 4, token_type::literal_true);
3897  case 'f':
3898  return scan_literal("false", 5, token_type::literal_false);
3899  case 'n':
3900  return scan_literal("null", 4, token_type::literal_null);
3901 
3902  // string
3903  case '\"':
3904  return scan_string();
3905 
3906  // number
3907  case '-':
3908  case '0':
3909  case '1':
3910  case '2':
3911  case '3':
3912  case '4':
3913  case '5':
3914  case '6':
3915  case '7':
3916  case '8':
3917  case '9':
3918  return scan_number();
3919 
3920  // end of input (the null byte is needed when parsing from
3921  // string literals)
3922  case '\0':
3923  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
3924  return token_type::end_of_input;
3925 
3926  // error
3927  default:
3928  error_message = "invalid literal";
3929  return token_type::parse_error;
3930  }
3931  }
3932 
3933  private:
3935  detail::input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
3936 
3938  std::char_traits<char>::int_type current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
3939 
3941  bool next_unget = false;
3942 
3944  position_t position;
3945 
3947  std::vector<char> token_string {};
3948 
3950  string_t token_buffer {};
3951 
3953  const char* error_message = "";
3954 
3955  // number values
3956  number_integer_t value_integer = 0;
3957  number_unsigned_t value_unsigned = 0;
3958  number_float_t value_float = 0;
3959 
3961  const char decimal_point_char = '.';
3962 };
3963 } // namespace detail
3964 } // namespace json
3965 
3966 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/parser.hpp>
3967 
3968 
3969 #include <cassert> // assert
3970 #include <cmath> // isfinite
3971 #include <cstdint> // uint8_t
3972 #include <functional> // function
3973 #include <string> // string
3974 #include <utility> // move
3975 
3976 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
3977 
3978 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
3979 
3980 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/is_sax.hpp>
3981 
3982 
3983 #include <cstdint> // size_t
3984 #include <utility> // declval
3985 
3986 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/detected.hpp>
3987 
3988 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
3989 
3990 
3991 namespace json
3992 {
3993 namespace detail
3994 {
3995 template <typename T>
3996 using null_function_t = decltype(std::declval<T&>().null());
3997 
3998 template <typename T>
3999 using boolean_function_t =
4000  decltype(std::declval<T&>().boolean(std::declval<bool>()));
4001 
4002 template <typename T, typename Integer>
4003 using number_integer_function_t =
4004  decltype(std::declval<T&>().number_integer(std::declval<Integer>()));
4005 
4006 template <typename T, typename Unsigned>
4007 using number_unsigned_function_t =
4008  decltype(std::declval<T&>().number_unsigned(std::declval<Unsigned>()));
4009 
4010 template <typename T, typename Float, typename String>
4011 using number_float_function_t = decltype(std::declval<T&>().number_float(
4012  std::declval<Float>(), std::declval<const String&>()));
4013 
4014 template <typename T, typename String>
4015 using string_function_t =
4016  decltype(std::declval<T&>().string(std::declval<String&>()));
4017 
4018 template <typename T>
4019 using start_object_function_t =
4020  decltype(std::declval<T&>().start_object(std::declval<std::size_t>()));
4021 
4022 template <typename T, typename String>
4023 using key_function_t =
4024  decltype(std::declval<T&>().key(std::declval<String&>()));
4025 
4026 template <typename T>
4027 using end_object_function_t = decltype(std::declval<T&>().end_object());
4028 
4029 template <typename T>
4030 using start_array_function_t =
4031  decltype(std::declval<T&>().start_array(std::declval<std::size_t>()));
4032 
4033 template <typename T>
4034 using end_array_function_t = decltype(std::declval<T&>().end_array());
4035 
4036 template <typename T, typename Exception>
4037 using parse_error_function_t = decltype(std::declval<T&>().parse_error(
4038  std::declval<std::size_t>(), std::declval<const std::string&>(),
4039  std::declval<const Exception&>()));
4040 
4041 template <typename SAX, typename BasicJsonType>
4042 struct is_sax
4043 {
4044  private:
4045  static_assert(is_basic_json<BasicJsonType>::value,
4046  "BasicJsonType must be of type basic_json<...>");
4047 
4048  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4049  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4050  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4051  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4052  using exception_t = typename BasicJsonType::exception;
4053 
4054  public:
4055  static constexpr bool value =
4056  is_detected_exact<bool, null_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4057  is_detected_exact<bool, boolean_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4058  is_detected_exact<bool, number_integer_function_t, SAX,
4059  number_integer_t>::value &&
4060  is_detected_exact<bool, number_unsigned_function_t, SAX,
4061  number_unsigned_t>::value &&
4062  is_detected_exact<bool, number_float_function_t, SAX, number_float_t,
4063  string_t>::value &&
4064  is_detected_exact<bool, string_function_t, SAX, string_t>::value &&
4065  is_detected_exact<bool, start_object_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4066  is_detected_exact<bool, key_function_t, SAX, string_t>::value &&
4067  is_detected_exact<bool, end_object_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4068  is_detected_exact<bool, start_array_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4069  is_detected_exact<bool, end_array_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4070  is_detected_exact<bool, parse_error_function_t, SAX, exception_t>::value;
4071 };
4072 
4073 template <typename SAX, typename BasicJsonType>
4074 struct is_sax_static_asserts
4075 {
4076  private:
4077  static_assert(is_basic_json<BasicJsonType>::value,
4078  "BasicJsonType must be of type basic_json<...>");
4079 
4080  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4081  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4082  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4083  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4084  using exception_t = typename BasicJsonType::exception;
4085 
4086  public:
4087  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, null_function_t, SAX>::value,
4088  "Missing/invalid function: bool null()");
4089  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, boolean_function_t, SAX>::value,
4090  "Missing/invalid function: bool boolean(bool)");
4091  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, boolean_function_t, SAX>::value,
4092  "Missing/invalid function: bool boolean(bool)");
4093  static_assert(
4094  is_detected_exact<bool, number_integer_function_t, SAX,
4095  number_integer_t>::value,
4096  "Missing/invalid function: bool number_integer(number_integer_t)");
4097  static_assert(
4098  is_detected_exact<bool, number_unsigned_function_t, SAX,
4099  number_unsigned_t>::value,
4100  "Missing/invalid function: bool number_unsigned(number_unsigned_t)");
4101  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, number_float_function_t, SAX,
4102  number_float_t, string_t>::value,
4103  "Missing/invalid function: bool number_float(number_float_t, const string_t&)");
4104  static_assert(
4105  is_detected_exact<bool, string_function_t, SAX, string_t>::value,
4106  "Missing/invalid function: bool string(string_t&)");
4107  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, start_object_function_t, SAX>::value,
4108  "Missing/invalid function: bool start_object(std::size_t)");
4109  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, key_function_t, SAX, string_t>::value,
4110  "Missing/invalid function: bool key(string_t&)");
4111  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, end_object_function_t, SAX>::value,
4112  "Missing/invalid function: bool end_object()");
4113  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, start_array_function_t, SAX>::value,
4114  "Missing/invalid function: bool start_array(std::size_t)");
4115  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, end_array_function_t, SAX>::value,
4116  "Missing/invalid function: bool end_array()");
4117  static_assert(
4118  is_detected_exact<bool, parse_error_function_t, SAX, exception_t>::value,
4119  "Missing/invalid function: bool parse_error(std::size_t, const "
4120  "std::string&, const exception&)");
4121 };
4122 } // namespace detail
4123 } // namespace json
4124 
4125 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/input_adapters.hpp>
4126 
4127 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/json_sax.hpp>
4128 
4129 
4130 #include <cstddef>
4131 #include <string>
4132 #include <vector>
4133 
4134 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/parser.hpp>
4135 
4136 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
4137 
4138 
4139 namespace json
4140 {
4141 
4150 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4151 struct json_sax
4152 {
4154  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4156  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4158  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4160  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4161 
4166  virtual bool null() = 0;
4167 
4173  virtual bool boolean(bool val) = 0;
4174 
4180  virtual bool number_integer(number_integer_t val) = 0;
4181 
4187  virtual bool number_unsigned(number_unsigned_t val) = 0;
4188 
4195  virtual bool number_float(number_float_t val, const string_t& s) = 0;
4196 
4203  virtual bool string(string_t& val) = 0;
4204 
4211  virtual bool start_object(std::size_t elements) = 0;
4212 
4219  virtual bool key(string_t& val) = 0;
4220 
4225  virtual bool end_object() = 0;
4226 
4233  virtual bool start_array(std::size_t elements) = 0;
4234 
4239  virtual bool end_array() = 0;
4240 
4248  virtual bool parse_error(std::size_t position,
4249  const std::string& last_token,
4250  const detail::exception& ex) = 0;
4251 
4252  virtual ~json_sax() = default;
4253 };
4254 
4255 
4256 namespace detail
4257 {
4271 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4272 class json_sax_dom_parser
4273 {
4274  public:
4275  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4276  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4277  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4278  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4279 
4285  explicit json_sax_dom_parser(BasicJsonType& r, const bool allow_exceptions_ = true)
4286  : root(r), allow_exceptions(allow_exceptions_)
4287  {}
4288 
4289  bool null()
4290  {
4291  handle_value(nullptr);
4292  return true;
4293  }
4294 
4295  bool boolean(bool val)
4296  {
4297  handle_value(val);
4298  return true;
4299  }
4300 
4301  bool number_integer(number_integer_t val)
4302  {
4303  handle_value(val);
4304  return true;
4305  }
4306 
4307  bool number_unsigned(number_unsigned_t val)
4308  {
4309  handle_value(val);
4310  return true;
4311  }
4312 
4313  bool number_float(number_float_t val, const string_t& /*unused*/)
4314  {
4315  handle_value(val);
4316  return true;
4317  }
4318 
4319  bool string(string_t& val)
4320  {
4321  handle_value(val);
4322  return true;
4323  }
4324 
4325  bool start_object(std::size_t len)
4326  {
4327  ref_stack.push_back(handle_value(BasicJsonType::value_t::object));
4328 
4329  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(len != std::size_t(-1) and len > ref_stack.back()->max_size()))
4330  {
4331  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(408,
4332  "excessive object size: " + std::to_string(len)));
4333  }
4334 
4335  return true;
4336  }
4337 
4338  bool key(string_t& val)
4339  {
4340  // add null at given key and store the reference for later
4341  object_element = &(ref_stack.back()->m_value.object->operator[](val));
4342  return true;
4343  }
4344 
4345  bool end_object()
4346  {
4347  ref_stack.pop_back();
4348  return true;
4349  }
4350 
4351  bool start_array(std::size_t len)
4352  {
4353  ref_stack.push_back(handle_value(BasicJsonType::value_t::array));
4354 
4355  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(len != std::size_t(-1) and len > ref_stack.back()->max_size()))
4356  {
4357  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(408,
4358  "excessive array size: " + std::to_string(len)));
4359  }
4360 
4361  return true;
4362  }
4363 
4364  bool end_array()
4365  {
4366  ref_stack.pop_back();
4367  return true;
4368  }
4369 
4370  bool parse_error(std::size_t /*unused*/, const std::string& /*unused*/,
4371  const detail::exception& ex)
4372  {
4373  errored = true;
4374  if (allow_exceptions)
4375  {
4376  // determine the proper exception type from the id
4377  switch ((ex.id / 100) % 100)
4378  {
4379  case 1:
4380  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::parse_error*>(&ex));
4381  case 4:
4382  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::out_of_range*>(&ex));
4383  // LCOV_EXCL_START
4384  case 2:
4385  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::invalid_iterator*>(&ex));
4386  case 3:
4387  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::type_error*>(&ex));
4388  case 5:
4389  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::other_error*>(&ex));
4390  default:
4391  assert(false);
4392  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
4393  }
4394  }
4395  return false;
4396  }
4397 
4398  constexpr bool is_errored() const
4399  {
4400  return errored;
4401  }
4402 
4403  private:
4410  template<typename Value>
4411  BasicJsonType* handle_value(Value&& v)
4412  {
4413  if (ref_stack.empty())
4414  {
4415  root = BasicJsonType(std::forward<Value>(v));
4416  return &root;
4417  }
4418 
4419  assert(ref_stack.back()->is_array() or ref_stack.back()->is_object());
4420 
4421  if (ref_stack.back()->is_array())
4422  {
4423  ref_stack.back()->m_value.array->emplace_back(std::forward<Value>(v));
4424  return &(ref_stack.back()->m_value.array->back());
4425  }
4426  else
4427  {
4428  assert(object_element);
4429  *object_element = BasicJsonType(std::forward<Value>(v));
4430  return object_element;
4431  }
4432  }
4433 
4435  BasicJsonType& root;
4437  std::vector<BasicJsonType*> ref_stack;
4439  BasicJsonType* object_element = nullptr;
4441  bool errored = false;
4443  const bool allow_exceptions = true;
4444 };
4445 
4446 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4447 class json_sax_dom_callback_parser
4448 {
4449  public:
4450  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4451  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4452  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4453  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4454  using parser_callback_t = typename BasicJsonType::parser_callback_t;
4455  using parse_event_t = typename BasicJsonType::parse_event_t;
4456 
4457  json_sax_dom_callback_parser(BasicJsonType& r,
4458  const parser_callback_t cb,
4459  const bool allow_exceptions_ = true)
4460  : root(r), callback(cb), allow_exceptions(allow_exceptions_)
4461  {
4462  keep_stack.push_back(true);
4463  }
4464 
4465  bool null()
4466  {
4467  handle_value(nullptr);
4468  return true;
4469  }
4470 
4471  bool boolean(bool val)
4472  {
4473  handle_value(val);
4474  return true;
4475  }
4476 
4477  bool number_integer(number_integer_t val)
4478  {
4479  handle_value(val);
4480  return true;
4481  }
4482 
4483  bool number_unsigned(number_unsigned_t val)
4484  {
4485  handle_value(val);
4486  return true;
4487  }
4488 
4489  bool number_float(number_float_t val, const string_t& /*unused*/)
4490  {
4491  handle_value(val);
4492  return true;
4493  }
4494 
4495  bool string(string_t& val)
4496  {
4497  handle_value(val);
4498  return true;
4499  }
4500 
4501  bool start_object(std::size_t len)
4502  {
4503  // check callback for object start
4504  const bool keep = callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()), parse_event_t::object_start, discarded);
4505  keep_stack.push_back(keep);
4506 
4507  auto val = handle_value(BasicJsonType::value_t::object, true);
4508  ref_stack.push_back(val.second);
4509 
4510  // check object limit
4511  if (ref_stack.back())
4512  {
4513  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(len != std::size_t(-1) and len > ref_stack.back()->max_size()))
4514  {
4515  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(408,
4516  "excessive object size: " + std::to_string(len)));
4517  }
4518  }
4519 
4520  return true;
4521  }
4522 
4523  bool key(string_t& val)
4524  {
4525  BasicJsonType k = BasicJsonType(val);
4526 
4527  // check callback for key
4528  const bool keep = callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()), parse_event_t::key, k);
4529  key_keep_stack.push_back(keep);
4530 
4531  // add discarded value at given key and store the reference for later
4532  if (keep and ref_stack.back())
4533  {
4534  object_element = &(ref_stack.back()->m_value.object->operator[](val) = discarded);
4535  }
4536 
4537  return true;
4538  }
4539 
4540  bool end_object()
4541  {
4542  if (ref_stack.back())
4543  {
4544  if (not callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()) - 1, parse_event_t::object_end, *ref_stack.back()))
4545  {
4546  // discard object
4547  *ref_stack.back() = discarded;
4548  }
4549  }
4550 
4551  assert(not ref_stack.empty());
4552  assert(not keep_stack.empty());
4553  ref_stack.pop_back();
4554  keep_stack.pop_back();
4555 
4556  if (not ref_stack.empty() and ref_stack.back())
4557  {
4558  // remove discarded value
4559  if (ref_stack.back()->is_object())
4560  {
4561  for (auto it = ref_stack.back()->begin(); it != ref_stack.back()->end(); ++it)
4562  {
4563  if (it->is_discarded())
4564  {
4565  ref_stack.back()->erase(it);
4566  break;
4567  }
4568  }
4569  }
4570  }
4571 
4572  return true;
4573  }
4574 
4575  bool start_array(std::size_t len)
4576  {
4577  const bool keep = callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()), parse_event_t::array_start, discarded);
4578  keep_stack.push_back(keep);
4579 
4580  auto val = handle_value(BasicJsonType::value_t::array, true);
4581  ref_stack.push_back(val.second);
4582 
4583  // check array limit
4584  if (ref_stack.back())
4585  {
4586  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(len != std::size_t(-1) and len > ref_stack.back()->max_size()))
4587  {
4588  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(408,
4589  "excessive array size: " + std::to_string(len)));
4590  }
4591  }
4592 
4593  return true;
4594  }
4595 
4596  bool end_array()
4597  {
4598  bool keep = true;
4599 
4600  if (ref_stack.back())
4601  {
4602  keep = callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()) - 1, parse_event_t::array_end, *ref_stack.back());
4603  if (not keep)
4604  {
4605  // discard array
4606  *ref_stack.back() = discarded;
4607  }
4608  }
4609 
4610  assert(not ref_stack.empty());
4611  assert(not keep_stack.empty());
4612  ref_stack.pop_back();
4613  keep_stack.pop_back();
4614 
4615  // remove discarded value
4616  if (not keep and not ref_stack.empty())
4617  {
4618  if (ref_stack.back()->is_array())
4619  {
4620  ref_stack.back()->m_value.array->pop_back();
4621  }
4622  }
4623 
4624  return true;
4625  }
4626 
4627  bool parse_error(std::size_t /*unused*/, const std::string& /*unused*/,
4628  const detail::exception& ex)
4629  {
4630  errored = true;
4631  if (allow_exceptions)
4632  {
4633  // determine the proper exception type from the id
4634  switch ((ex.id / 100) % 100)
4635  {
4636  case 1:
4637  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::parse_error*>(&ex));
4638  case 4:
4639  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::out_of_range*>(&ex));
4640  // LCOV_EXCL_START
4641  case 2:
4642  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::invalid_iterator*>(&ex));
4643  case 3:
4644  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::type_error*>(&ex));
4645  case 5:
4646  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::other_error*>(&ex));
4647  default:
4648  assert(false);
4649  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
4650  }
4651  }
4652  return false;
4653  }
4654 
4655  constexpr bool is_errored() const
4656  {
4657  return errored;
4658  }
4659 
4660  private:
4676  template<typename Value>
4677  std::pair<bool, BasicJsonType*> handle_value(Value&& v, const bool skip_callback = false)
4678  {
4679  assert(not keep_stack.empty());
4680 
4681  // do not handle this value if we know it would be added to a discarded
4682  // container
4683  if (not keep_stack.back())
4684  {
4685  return {false, nullptr};
4686  }
4687 
4688  // create value
4689  auto value = BasicJsonType(std::forward<Value>(v));
4690 
4691  // check callback
4692  const bool keep = skip_callback or callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()), parse_event_t::value, value);
4693 
4694  // do not handle this value if we just learnt it shall be discarded
4695  if (not keep)
4696  {
4697  return {false, nullptr};
4698  }
4699 
4700  if (ref_stack.empty())
4701  {
4702  root = std::move(value);
4703  return {true, &root};
4704  }
4705 
4706  // skip this value if we already decided to skip the parent
4707  // (https://github.com/nlohmann/json/issues/971#issuecomment-413678360)
4708  if (not ref_stack.back())
4709  {
4710  return {false, nullptr};
4711  }
4712 
4713  // we now only expect arrays and objects
4714  assert(ref_stack.back()->is_array() or ref_stack.back()->is_object());
4715 
4716  if (ref_stack.back()->is_array())
4717  {
4718  ref_stack.back()->m_value.array->push_back(std::move(value));
4719  return {true, &(ref_stack.back()->m_value.array->back())};
4720  }
4721  else
4722  {
4723  // check if we should store an element for the current key
4724  assert(not key_keep_stack.empty());
4725  const bool store_element = key_keep_stack.back();
4726  key_keep_stack.pop_back();
4727 
4728  if (not store_element)
4729  {
4730  return {false, nullptr};
4731  }
4732 
4733  assert(object_element);
4734  *object_element = std::move(value);
4735  return {true, object_element};
4736  }
4737  }
4738 
4740  BasicJsonType& root;
4742  std::vector<BasicJsonType*> ref_stack;
4744  std::vector<bool> keep_stack;
4746  std::vector<bool> key_keep_stack;
4748  BasicJsonType* object_element = nullptr;
4750  bool errored = false;
4752  const parser_callback_t callback = nullptr;
4754  const bool allow_exceptions = true;
4756  BasicJsonType discarded = BasicJsonType::value_t::discarded;
4757 };
4758 
4759 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4760 class json_sax_acceptor
4761 {
4762  public:
4763  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4764  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4765  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4766  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4767 
4768  bool null()
4769  {
4770  return true;
4771  }
4772 
4773  bool boolean(bool /*unused*/)
4774  {
4775  return true;
4776  }
4777 
4778  bool number_integer(number_integer_t /*unused*/)
4779  {
4780  return true;
4781  }
4782 
4783  bool number_unsigned(number_unsigned_t /*unused*/)
4784  {
4785  return true;
4786  }
4787 
4788  bool number_float(number_float_t /*unused*/, const string_t& /*unused*/)
4789  {
4790  return true;
4791  }
4792 
4793  bool string(string_t& /*unused*/)
4794  {
4795  return true;
4796  }
4797 
4798  bool start_object(std::size_t /*unused*/ = std::size_t(-1))
4799  {
4800  return true;
4801  }
4802 
4803  bool key(string_t& /*unused*/)
4804  {
4805  return true;
4806  }
4807 
4808  bool end_object()
4809  {
4810  return true;
4811  }
4812 
4813  bool start_array(std::size_t /*unused*/ = std::size_t(-1))
4814  {
4815  return true;
4816  }
4817 
4818  bool end_array()
4819  {
4820  return true;
4821  }
4822 
4823  bool parse_error(std::size_t /*unused*/, const std::string& /*unused*/, const detail::exception& /*unused*/)
4824  {
4825  return false;
4826  }
4827 };
4828 } // namespace detail
4829 
4830 } // namespace json
4831 
4832 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/lexer.hpp>
4833 
4834 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
4835 
4836 
4837 namespace json
4838 {
4839 namespace detail
4840 {
4842 // parser //
4844 
4850 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4851 class parser
4852 {
4853  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4854  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4855  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4856  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4857  using lexer_t = lexer<BasicJsonType>;
4858  using token_type = typename lexer_t::token_type;
4859 
4860  public:
4861  enum class parse_event_t : uint8_t
4862  {
4864  object_start,
4866  object_end,
4868  array_start,
4870  array_end,
4872  key,
4874  value
4875  };
4876 
4877  using parser_callback_t =
4878  std::function<bool(int depth, parse_event_t event, BasicJsonType& parsed)>;
4879 
4881  explicit parser(detail::input_adapter_t&& adapter,
4882  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
4883  const bool allow_exceptions_ = true)
4884  : callback(cb), m_lexer(std::move(adapter)), allow_exceptions(allow_exceptions_)
4885  {
4886  // read first token
4887  get_token();
4888  }
4889 
4900  void parse(const bool strict, BasicJsonType& result)
4901  {
4902  if (callback)
4903  {
4904  json_sax_dom_callback_parser<BasicJsonType> sdp(result, callback, allow_exceptions);
4905  sax_parse_internal(&sdp);
4906  result.assert_invariant();
4907 
4908  // in strict mode, input must be completely read
4909  if (strict and (get_token() != token_type::end_of_input))
4910  {
4911  sdp.parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
4912  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
4913  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
4914  exception_message(token_type::end_of_input, "value")));
4915  }
4916 
4917  // in case of an error, return discarded value
4918  if (sdp.is_errored())
4919  {
4920  result = value_t::discarded;
4921  return;
4922  }
4923 
4924  // set top-level value to null if it was discarded by the callback
4925  // function
4926  if (result.is_discarded())
4927  {
4928  result = nullptr;
4929  }
4930  }
4931  else
4932  {
4933  json_sax_dom_parser<BasicJsonType> sdp(result, allow_exceptions);
4934  sax_parse_internal(&sdp);
4935  result.assert_invariant();
4936 
4937  // in strict mode, input must be completely read
4938  if (strict and (get_token() != token_type::end_of_input))
4939  {
4940  sdp.parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
4941  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
4942  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
4943  exception_message(token_type::end_of_input, "value")));
4944  }
4945 
4946  // in case of an error, return discarded value
4947  if (sdp.is_errored())
4948  {
4949  result = value_t::discarded;
4950  return;
4951  }
4952  }
4953  }
4954 
4961  bool accept(const bool strict = true)
4962  {
4963  json_sax_acceptor<BasicJsonType> sax_acceptor;
4964  return sax_parse(&sax_acceptor, strict);
4965  }
4966 
4967  template <typename SAX>
4968  bool sax_parse(SAX* sax, const bool strict = true)
4969  {
4970  (void)detail::is_sax_static_asserts<SAX, BasicJsonType> {};
4971  const bool result = sax_parse_internal(sax);
4972 
4973  // strict mode: next byte must be EOF
4974  if (result and strict and (get_token() != token_type::end_of_input))
4975  {
4976  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
4977  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
4978  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
4979  exception_message(token_type::end_of_input, "value")));
4980  }
4981 
4982  return result;
4983  }
4984 
4985  private:
4986  template <typename SAX>
4987  bool sax_parse_internal(SAX* sax)
4988  {
4989  // stack to remember the hierarchy of structured values we are parsing
4990  // true = array; false = object
4991  std::vector<bool> states;
4992  // value to avoid a goto (see comment where set to true)
4993  bool skip_to_state_evaluation = false;
4994 
4995  while (true)
4996  {
4997  if (not skip_to_state_evaluation)
4998  {
4999  // invariant: get_token() was called before each iteration
5000  switch (last_token)
5001  {
5002  case token_type::begin_object:
5003  {
5004  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_object(std::size_t(-1))))
5005  {
5006  return false;
5007  }
5008 
5009  // closing } -> we are done
5010  if (get_token() == token_type::end_object)
5011  {
5012  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->end_object()))
5013  {
5014  return false;
5015  }
5016  break;
5017  }
5018 
5019  // parse key
5020  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(last_token != token_type::value_string))
5021  {
5022  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5023  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5024  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5025  exception_message(token_type::value_string, "object key")));
5026  }
5027  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->key(m_lexer.get_string())))
5028  {
5029  return false;
5030  }
5031 
5032  // parse separator (:)
5033  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get_token() != token_type::name_separator))
5034  {
5035  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5036  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5037  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5038  exception_message(token_type::name_separator, "object separator")));
5039  }
5040 
5041  // remember we are now inside an object
5042  states.push_back(false);
5043 
5044  // parse values
5045  get_token();
5046  continue;
5047  }
5048 
5049  case token_type::begin_array:
5050  {
5051  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(std::size_t(-1))))
5052  {
5053  return false;
5054  }
5055 
5056  // closing ] -> we are done
5057  if (get_token() == token_type::end_array)
5058  {
5059  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->end_array()))
5060  {
5061  return false;
5062  }
5063  break;
5064  }
5065 
5066  // remember we are now inside an array
5067  states.push_back(true);
5068 
5069  // parse values (no need to call get_token)
5070  continue;
5071  }
5072 
5073  case token_type::value_float:
5074  {
5075  const auto res = m_lexer.get_number_float();
5076 
5077  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not std::isfinite(res)))
5078  {
5079  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5080  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5081  out_of_range::create(406, "number overflow parsing '" + m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'"));
5082  }
5083  else
5084  {
5085  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->number_float(res, m_lexer.get_string())))
5086  {
5087  return false;
5088  }
5089  break;
5090  }
5091  }
5092 
5093  case token_type::literal_false:
5094  {
5095  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->boolean(false)))
5096  {
5097  return false;
5098  }
5099  break;
5100  }
5101 
5102  case token_type::literal_null:
5103  {
5104  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->null()))
5105  {
5106  return false;
5107  }
5108  break;
5109  }
5110 
5111  case token_type::literal_true:
5112  {
5113  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->boolean(true)))
5114  {
5115  return false;
5116  }
5117  break;
5118  }
5119 
5120  case token_type::value_integer:
5121  {
5122  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->number_integer(m_lexer.get_number_integer())))
5123  {
5124  return false;
5125  }
5126  break;
5127  }
5128 
5129  case token_type::value_string:
5130  {
5131  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->string(m_lexer.get_string())))
5132  {
5133  return false;
5134  }
5135  break;
5136  }
5137 
5138  case token_type::value_unsigned:
5139  {
5140  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->number_unsigned(m_lexer.get_number_unsigned())))
5141  {
5142  return false;
5143  }
5144  break;
5145  }
5146 
5147  case token_type::parse_error:
5148  {
5149  // using "uninitialized" to avoid "expected" message
5150  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5151  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5152  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5153  exception_message(token_type::uninitialized, "value")));
5154  }
5155 
5156  default: // the last token was unexpected
5157  {
5158  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5159  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5160  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5161  exception_message(token_type::literal_or_value, "value")));
5162  }
5163  }
5164  }
5165  else
5166  {
5167  skip_to_state_evaluation = false;
5168  }
5169 
5170  // we reached this line after we successfully parsed a value
5171  if (states.empty())
5172  {
5173  // empty stack: we reached the end of the hierarchy: done
5174  return true;
5175  }
5176  else
5177  {
5178  if (states.back()) // array
5179  {
5180  // comma -> next value
5181  if (get_token() == token_type::value_separator)
5182  {
5183  // parse a new value
5184  get_token();
5185  continue;
5186  }
5187 
5188  // closing ]
5189  if (JSON_LIKELY(last_token == token_type::end_array))
5190  {
5191  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->end_array()))
5192  {
5193  return false;
5194  }
5195 
5196  // We are done with this array. Before we can parse a
5197  // new value, we need to evaluate the new state first.
5198  // By setting skip_to_state_evaluation to false, we
5199  // are effectively jumping to the beginning of this if.
5200  assert(not states.empty());
5201  states.pop_back();
5202  skip_to_state_evaluation = true;
5203  continue;
5204  }
5205  else
5206  {
5207  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5208  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5209  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5210  exception_message(token_type::end_array, "array")));
5211  }
5212  }
5213  else // object
5214  {
5215  // comma -> next value
5216  if (get_token() == token_type::value_separator)
5217  {
5218  // parse key
5219  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get_token() != token_type::value_string))
5220  {
5221  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5222  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5223  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5224  exception_message(token_type::value_string, "object key")));
5225  }
5226  else
5227  {
5228  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->key(m_lexer.get_string())))
5229  {
5230  return false;
5231  }
5232  }
5233 
5234  // parse separator (:)
5235  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get_token() != token_type::name_separator))
5236  {
5237  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5238  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5239  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5240  exception_message(token_type::name_separator, "object separator")));
5241  }
5242 
5243  // parse values
5244  get_token();
5245  continue;
5246  }
5247 
5248  // closing }
5249  if (JSON_LIKELY(last_token == token_type::end_object))
5250  {
5251  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->end_object()))
5252  {
5253  return false;
5254  }
5255 
5256  // We are done with this object. Before we can parse a
5257  // new value, we need to evaluate the new state first.
5258  // By setting skip_to_state_evaluation to false, we
5259  // are effectively jumping to the beginning of this if.
5260  assert(not states.empty());
5261  states.pop_back();
5262  skip_to_state_evaluation = true;
5263  continue;
5264  }
5265  else
5266  {
5267  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5268  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5269  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5270  exception_message(token_type::end_object, "object")));
5271  }
5272  }
5273  }
5274  }
5275  }
5276 
5278  token_type get_token()
5279  {
5280  return (last_token = m_lexer.scan());
5281  }
5282 
5283  std::string exception_message(const token_type expected, const std::string& context)
5284  {
5285  std::string error_msg = "syntax error ";
5286 
5287  if (not context.empty())
5288  {
5289  error_msg += "while parsing " + context + " ";
5290  }
5291 
5292  error_msg += "- ";
5293 
5294  if (last_token == token_type::parse_error)
5295  {
5296  error_msg += std::string(m_lexer.get_error_message()) + "; last read: '" +
5297  m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'";
5298  }
5299  else
5300  {
5301  error_msg += "unexpected " + std::string(lexer_t::token_type_name(last_token));
5302  }
5303 
5304  if (expected != token_type::uninitialized)
5305  {
5306  error_msg += "; expected " + std::string(lexer_t::token_type_name(expected));
5307  }
5308 
5309  return error_msg;
5310  }
5311 
5312  private:
5314  const parser_callback_t callback = nullptr;
5316  token_type last_token = token_type::uninitialized;
5318  lexer_t m_lexer;
5320  const bool allow_exceptions = true;
5321 };
5322 } // namespace detail
5323 } // namespace json
5324 
5325 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/primitive_iterator.hpp>
5326 
5327 
5328 #include <cstddef> // ptrdiff_t
5329 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
5330 
5331 namespace json
5332 {
5333 namespace detail
5334 {
5335 /*
5336 @brief an iterator for primitive JSON types
5337 
5338 This class models an iterator for primitive JSON types (boolean, number,
5339 string). It's only purpose is to allow the iterator/const_iterator classes
5340 to "iterate" over primitive values. Internally, the iterator is modeled by
5341 a `difference_type` variable. Value begin_value (`0`) models the begin,
5342 end_value (`1`) models past the end.
5343 */
5344 class primitive_iterator_t
5345 {
5346  private:
5347  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
5348  static constexpr difference_type begin_value = 0;
5349  static constexpr difference_type end_value = begin_value + 1;
5350 
5352  difference_type m_it = (std::numeric_limits<std::ptrdiff_t>::min)();
5353 
5354  public:
5355  constexpr difference_type get_value() const noexcept
5356  {
5357  return m_it;
5358  }
5359 
5361  void set_begin() noexcept
5362  {
5363  m_it = begin_value;
5364  }
5365 
5367  void set_end() noexcept
5368  {
5369  m_it = end_value;
5370  }
5371 
5373  constexpr bool is_begin() const noexcept
5374  {
5375  return m_it == begin_value;
5376  }
5377 
5379  constexpr bool is_end() const noexcept
5380  {
5381  return m_it == end_value;
5382  }
5383 
5384  friend constexpr bool operator==(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
5385  {
5386  return lhs.m_it == rhs.m_it;
5387  }
5388 
5389  friend constexpr bool operator<(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
5390  {
5391  return lhs.m_it < rhs.m_it;
5392  }
5393 
5394  primitive_iterator_t operator+(difference_type n) noexcept
5395  {
5396  auto result = *this;
5397  result += n;
5398  return result;
5399  }
5400 
5401  friend constexpr difference_type operator-(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
5402  {
5403  return lhs.m_it - rhs.m_it;
5404  }
5405 
5406  primitive_iterator_t& operator++() noexcept
5407  {
5408  ++m_it;
5409  return *this;
5410  }
5411 
5412  primitive_iterator_t const operator++(int) noexcept
5413  {
5414  auto result = *this;
5415  ++m_it;
5416  return result;
5417  }
5418 
5419  primitive_iterator_t& operator--() noexcept
5420  {
5421  --m_it;
5422  return *this;
5423  }
5424 
5425  primitive_iterator_t const operator--(int) noexcept
5426  {
5427  auto result = *this;
5428  --m_it;
5429  return result;
5430  }
5431 
5432  primitive_iterator_t& operator+=(difference_type n) noexcept
5433  {
5434  m_it += n;
5435  return *this;
5436  }
5437 
5438  primitive_iterator_t& operator-=(difference_type n) noexcept
5439  {
5440  m_it -= n;
5441  return *this;
5442  }
5443 };
5444 } // namespace detail
5445 } // namespace json
5446 
5447 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/internal_iterator.hpp>
5448 
5449 
5450 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/primitive_iterator.hpp>
5451 
5452 
5453 namespace json
5454 {
5455 namespace detail
5456 {
5463 template<typename BasicJsonType> struct internal_iterator
5464 {
5466  typename BasicJsonType::object_t::iterator object_iterator {};
5468  typename BasicJsonType::array_t::iterator array_iterator {};
5470  primitive_iterator_t primitive_iterator {};
5471 };
5472 } // namespace detail
5473 } // namespace json
5474 
5475 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/iter_impl.hpp>
5476 
5477 
5478 #include <ciso646> // not
5479 #include <iterator> // iterator, random_access_iterator_tag, bidirectional_iterator_tag, advance, next
5480 #include <type_traits> // conditional, is_const, remove_const
5481 
5482 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
5483 
5484 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/internal_iterator.hpp>
5485 
5486 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/primitive_iterator.hpp>
5487 
5488 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
5489 
5490 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/cpp_future.hpp>
5491 
5492 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
5493 
5494 
5495 namespace json
5496 {
5497 namespace detail
5498 {
5499 // forward declare, to be able to friend it later on
5500 template<typename IteratorType> class iteration_proxy;
5501 
5522 template<typename BasicJsonType>
5523 class iter_impl
5524 {
5526  friend iter_impl<typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value, typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type, const BasicJsonType>::type>;
5527  friend BasicJsonType;
5528  friend iteration_proxy<iter_impl>;
5529 
5530  using object_t = typename BasicJsonType::object_t;
5531  using array_t = typename BasicJsonType::array_t;
5532  // make sure BasicJsonType is basic_json or const basic_json
5533  static_assert(is_basic_json<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>::value,
5534  "iter_impl only accepts (const) basic_json");
5535 
5536  public:
5537 
5543  using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
5544 
5546  using value_type = typename BasicJsonType::value_type;
5548  using difference_type = typename BasicJsonType::difference_type;
5550  using pointer = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value,
5551  typename BasicJsonType::const_pointer,
5552  typename BasicJsonType::pointer>::type;
5554  using reference =
5555  typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value,
5556  typename BasicJsonType::const_reference,
5557  typename BasicJsonType::reference>::type;
5558 
5560  iter_impl() = default;
5561 
5568  explicit iter_impl(pointer object) noexcept : m_object(object)
5569  {
5570  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5571 
5572  switch (m_object->m_type)
5573  {
5574  case value_t::object:
5575  {
5576  m_it.object_iterator = typename object_t::iterator();
5577  break;
5578  }
5579 
5580  case value_t::array:
5581  {
5582  m_it.array_iterator = typename array_t::iterator();
5583  break;
5584  }
5585 
5586  default:
5587  {
5588  m_it.primitive_iterator = primitive_iterator_t();
5589  break;
5590  }
5591  }
5592  }
5593 
5608  iter_impl(const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>& other) noexcept
5609  : m_object(other.m_object), m_it(other.m_it) {}
5610 
5617  iter_impl& operator=(const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>& other) noexcept
5618  {
5619  m_object = other.m_object;
5620  m_it = other.m_it;
5621  return *this;
5622  }
5623 
5624  private:
5629  void set_begin() noexcept
5630  {
5631  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5632 
5633  switch (m_object->m_type)
5634  {
5635  case value_t::object:
5636  {
5637  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->begin();
5638  break;
5639  }
5640 
5641  case value_t::array:
5642  {
5643  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->begin();
5644  break;
5645  }
5646 
5647  case value_t::null:
5648  {
5649  // set to end so begin()==end() is true: null is empty
5650  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
5651  break;
5652  }
5653 
5654  default:
5655  {
5656  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_begin();
5657  break;
5658  }
5659  }
5660  }
5661 
5666  void set_end() noexcept
5667  {
5668  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5669 
5670  switch (m_object->m_type)
5671  {
5672  case value_t::object:
5673  {
5674  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->end();
5675  break;
5676  }
5677 
5678  case value_t::array:
5679  {
5680  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->end();
5681  break;
5682  }
5683 
5684  default:
5685  {
5686  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
5687  break;
5688  }
5689  }
5690  }
5691 
5692  public:
5697  reference operator*() const
5698  {
5699  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5700 
5701  switch (m_object->m_type)
5702  {
5703  case value_t::object:
5704  {
5705  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
5706  return m_it.object_iterator->second;
5707  }
5708 
5709  case value_t::array:
5710  {
5711  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
5712  return *m_it.array_iterator;
5713  }
5714 
5715  case value_t::null:
5716  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
5717 
5718  default:
5719  {
5720  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
5721  {
5722  return *m_object;
5723  }
5724 
5725  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
5726  }
5727  }
5728  }
5729 
5734  pointer operator->() const
5735  {
5736  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5737 
5738  switch (m_object->m_type)
5739  {
5740  case value_t::object:
5741  {
5742  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
5743  return &(m_it.object_iterator->second);
5744  }
5745 
5746  case value_t::array:
5747  {
5748  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
5749  return &*m_it.array_iterator;
5750  }
5751 
5752  default:
5753  {
5754  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
5755  {
5756  return m_object;
5757  }
5758 
5759  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
5760  }
5761  }
5762  }
5763 
5768  iter_impl const operator++(int)
5769  {
5770  auto result = *this;
5771  ++(*this);
5772  return result;
5773  }
5774 
5779  iter_impl& operator++()
5780  {
5781  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5782 
5783  switch (m_object->m_type)
5784  {
5785  case value_t::object:
5786  {
5787  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, 1);
5788  break;
5789  }
5790 
5791  case value_t::array:
5792  {
5793  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, 1);
5794  break;
5795  }
5796 
5797  default:
5798  {
5799  ++m_it.primitive_iterator;
5800  break;
5801  }
5802  }
5803 
5804  return *this;
5805  }
5806 
5811  iter_impl const operator--(int)
5812  {
5813  auto result = *this;
5814  --(*this);
5815  return result;
5816  }
5817 
5822  iter_impl& operator--()
5823  {
5824  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5825 
5826  switch (m_object->m_type)
5827  {
5828  case value_t::object:
5829  {
5830  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, -1);
5831  break;
5832  }
5833 
5834  case value_t::array:
5835  {
5836  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, -1);
5837  break;
5838  }
5839 
5840  default:
5841  {
5842  --m_it.primitive_iterator;
5843  break;
5844  }
5845  }
5846 
5847  return *this;
5848  }
5849 
5854  bool operator==(const iter_impl& other) const
5855  {
5856  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
5857  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(m_object != other.m_object))
5858  {
5859  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
5860  }
5861 
5862  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5863 
5864  switch (m_object->m_type)
5865  {
5866  case value_t::object:
5867  return (m_it.object_iterator == other.m_it.object_iterator);
5868 
5869  case value_t::array:
5870  return (m_it.array_iterator == other.m_it.array_iterator);
5871 
5872  default:
5873  return (m_it.primitive_iterator == other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
5874  }
5875  }
5876 
5881  bool operator!=(const iter_impl& other) const
5882  {
5883  return not operator==(other);
5884  }
5885 
5890  bool operator<(const iter_impl& other) const
5891  {
5892  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
5893  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(m_object != other.m_object))
5894  {
5895  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
5896  }
5897 
5898  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5899 
5900  switch (m_object->m_type)
5901  {
5902  case value_t::object:
5903  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(213, "cannot compare order of object iterators"));
5904 
5905  case value_t::array:
5906  return (m_it.array_iterator < other.m_it.array_iterator);
5907 
5908  default:
5909  return (m_it.primitive_iterator < other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
5910  }
5911  }
5912 
5917  bool operator<=(const iter_impl& other) const
5918  {
5919  return not other.operator < (*this);
5920  }
5921 
5926  bool operator>(const iter_impl& other) const
5927  {
5928  return not operator<=(other);
5929  }
5930 
5935  bool operator>=(const iter_impl& other) const
5936  {
5937  return not operator<(other);
5938  }
5939 
5944  iter_impl& operator+=(difference_type i)
5945  {
5946  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5947 
5948  switch (m_object->m_type)
5949  {
5950  case value_t::object:
5951  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
5952 
5953  case value_t::array:
5954  {
5955  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, i);
5956  break;
5957  }
5958 
5959  default:
5960  {
5961  m_it.primitive_iterator += i;
5962  break;
5963  }
5964  }
5965 
5966  return *this;
5967  }
5968 
5973  iter_impl& operator-=(difference_type i)
5974  {
5975  return operator+=(-i);
5976  }
5977 
5982  iter_impl operator+(difference_type i) const
5983  {
5984  auto result = *this;
5985  result += i;
5986  return result;
5987  }
5988 
5993  friend iter_impl operator+(difference_type i, const iter_impl& it)
5994  {
5995  auto result = it;
5996  result += i;
5997  return result;
5998  }
5999 
6004  iter_impl operator-(difference_type i) const
6005  {
6006  auto result = *this;
6007  result -= i;
6008  return result;
6009  }
6010 
6015  difference_type operator-(const iter_impl& other) const
6016  {
6017  assert(m_object != nullptr);
6018 
6019  switch (m_object->m_type)
6020  {
6021  case value_t::object:
6022  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
6023 
6024  case value_t::array:
6025  return m_it.array_iterator - other.m_it.array_iterator;
6026 
6027  default:
6028  return m_it.primitive_iterator - other.m_it.primitive_iterator;
6029  }
6030  }
6031 
6036  reference operator[](difference_type n) const
6037  {
6038  assert(m_object != nullptr);
6039 
6040  switch (m_object->m_type)
6041  {
6042  case value_t::object:
6043  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(208, "cannot use operator[] for object iterators"));
6044 
6045  case value_t::array:
6046  return *std::next(m_it.array_iterator, n);
6047 
6048  case value_t::null:
6049  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
6050 
6051  default:
6052  {
6053  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.get_value() == -n))
6054  {
6055  return *m_object;
6056  }
6057 
6058  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
6059  }
6060  }
6061  }
6062 
6067  const typename object_t::key_type& key() const
6068  {
6069  assert(m_object != nullptr);
6070 
6071  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_object->is_object()))
6072  {
6073  return m_it.object_iterator->first;
6074  }
6075 
6076  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(207, "cannot use key() for non-object iterators"));
6077  }
6078 
6083  reference value() const
6084  {
6085  return operator*();
6086  }
6087 
6088  private:
6090  pointer m_object = nullptr;
6092  internal_iterator<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type> m_it;
6093 };
6094 } // namespace detail
6095 } // namespace json
6096 
6097 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/iteration_proxy.hpp>
6098 
6099 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/json_reverse_iterator.hpp>
6100 
6101 
6102 #include <cstddef> // ptrdiff_t
6103 #include <iterator> // reverse_iterator
6104 #include <utility> // declval
6105 
6106 namespace json
6107 {
6108 namespace detail
6109 {
6111 // reverse_iterator //
6113 
6132 template<typename Base>
6133 class json_reverse_iterator : public std::reverse_iterator<Base>
6134 {
6135  public:
6136  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
6138  using base_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<Base>;
6140  using reference = typename Base::reference;
6141 
6143  explicit json_reverse_iterator(const typename base_iterator::iterator_type& it) noexcept
6144  : base_iterator(it) {}
6145 
6147  explicit json_reverse_iterator(const base_iterator& it) noexcept : base_iterator(it) {}
6148 
6150  json_reverse_iterator const operator++(int)
6151  {
6152  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator++(1));
6153  }
6154 
6156  json_reverse_iterator& operator++()
6157  {
6158  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator++());
6159  }
6160 
6162  json_reverse_iterator const operator--(int)
6163  {
6164  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator--(1));
6165  }
6166 
6168  json_reverse_iterator& operator--()
6169  {
6170  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator--());
6171  }
6172 
6174  json_reverse_iterator& operator+=(difference_type i)
6175  {
6176  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator+=(i));
6177  }
6178 
6180  json_reverse_iterator operator+(difference_type i) const
6181  {
6182  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator+(i));
6183  }
6184 
6186  json_reverse_iterator operator-(difference_type i) const
6187  {
6188  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator-(i));
6189  }
6190 
6192  difference_type operator-(const json_reverse_iterator& other) const
6193  {
6194  return base_iterator(*this) - base_iterator(other);
6195  }
6196 
6198  reference operator[](difference_type n) const
6199  {
6200  return *(this->operator+(n));
6201  }
6202 
6204  auto key() const -> decltype(std::declval<Base>().key())
6205  {
6206  auto it = --this->base();
6207  return it.key();
6208  }
6209 
6211  reference value() const
6212  {
6213  auto it = --this->base();
6214  return it.operator * ();
6215  }
6216 };
6217 } // namespace detail
6218 } // namespace json
6219 
6220 // #include <nlohmann/detail/output/output_adapters.hpp>
6221 
6222 
6223 #include <algorithm> // copy
6224 #include <cstddef> // size_t
6225 #include <ios> // streamsize
6226 #include <iterator> // back_inserter
6227 #include <memory> // shared_ptr, make_shared
6228 #include <ostream> // basic_ostream
6229 #include <string> // basic_string
6230 #include <vector> // vector
6231 
6232 namespace json
6233 {
6234 namespace detail
6235 {
6237 template<typename CharType> struct output_adapter_protocol
6238 {
6239  virtual void write_character(CharType c) = 0;
6240  virtual void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) = 0;
6241  virtual ~output_adapter_protocol() = default;
6242 };
6243 
6245 template<typename CharType>
6246 using output_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<output_adapter_protocol<CharType>>;
6247 
6249 template<typename CharType>
6250 class output_vector_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
6251 {
6252  public:
6253  explicit output_vector_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec) noexcept
6254  : v(vec)
6255  {}
6256 
6257  void write_character(CharType c) override
6258  {
6259  v.push_back(c);
6260  }
6261 
6262  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
6263  {
6264  std::copy(s, s + length, std::back_inserter(v));
6265  }
6266 
6267  private:
6268  std::vector<CharType>& v;
6269 };
6270 
6272 template<typename CharType>
6273 class output_stream_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
6274 {
6275  public:
6276  explicit output_stream_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s) noexcept
6277  : stream(s)
6278  {}
6279 
6280  void write_character(CharType c) override
6281  {
6282  stream.put(c);
6283  }
6284 
6285  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
6286  {
6287  stream.write(s, static_cast<std::streamsize>(length));
6288  }
6289 
6290  private:
6291  std::basic_ostream<CharType>& stream;
6292 };
6293 
6295 template<typename CharType, typename StringType = std::basic_string<CharType>>
6296 class output_string_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
6297 {
6298  public:
6299  explicit output_string_adapter(StringType& s) noexcept
6300  : str(s)
6301  {}
6302 
6303  void write_character(CharType c) override
6304  {
6305  str.push_back(c);
6306  }
6307 
6308  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
6309  {
6310  str.append(s, length);
6311  }
6312 
6313  private:
6314  StringType& str;
6315 };
6316 
6317 template<typename CharType, typename StringType = std::basic_string<CharType>>
6318 class output_adapter
6319 {
6320  public:
6321  output_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec)
6322  : oa(std::make_shared<output_vector_adapter<CharType>>(vec)) {}
6323 
6324  output_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s)
6325  : oa(std::make_shared<output_stream_adapter<CharType>>(s)) {}
6326 
6327  output_adapter(StringType& s)
6328  : oa(std::make_shared<output_string_adapter<CharType, StringType>>(s)) {}
6329 
6330  operator output_adapter_t<CharType>()
6331  {
6332  return oa;
6333  }
6334 
6335  private:
6336  output_adapter_t<CharType> oa = nullptr;
6337 };
6338 } // namespace detail
6339 } // namespace json
6340 
6341 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/binary_reader.hpp>
6342 
6343 
6344 #include <algorithm> // generate_n
6345 #include <array> // array
6346 #include <cassert> // assert
6347 #include <cmath> // ldexp
6348 #include <cstddef> // size_t
6349 #include <cstdint> // uint8_t, uint16_t, uint32_t, uint64_t
6350 #include <cstdio> // snprintf
6351 //#include <cstring> // memcpy
6352 #include <iterator> // back_inserter
6353 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
6354 #include <string> // char_traits, string
6355 #include <utility> // make_pair, move
6356 
6357 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/input_adapters.hpp>
6358 
6359 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/json_sax.hpp>
6360 
6361 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
6362 
6363 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
6364 
6365 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/is_sax.hpp>
6366 
6367 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
6368 
6369 
6370 namespace json
6371 {
6372 namespace detail
6373 {
6375 // binary reader //
6377 
6381 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename SAX = json_sax_dom_parser<BasicJsonType>>
6382 class binary_reader
6383 {
6384  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
6385  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
6386  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
6387  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
6388  using json_sax_t = SAX;
6389 
6390  public:
6396  explicit binary_reader(input_adapter_t adapter) : ia(std::move(adapter))
6397  {
6398  (void)detail::is_sax_static_asserts<SAX, BasicJsonType> {};
6399  assert(ia);
6400  }
6401 
6409  bool sax_parse(const input_format_t format,
6410  json_sax_t* sax_,
6411  const bool strict = true)
6412  {
6413  sax = sax_;
6414  bool result = false;
6415 
6416  switch (format)
6417  {
6418  case input_format_t::bson:
6419  result = parse_bson_internal();
6420  break;
6421 
6422  case input_format_t::cbor:
6423  result = parse_cbor_internal();
6424  break;
6425 
6426  case input_format_t::msgpack:
6427  result = parse_msgpack_internal();
6428  break;
6429 
6430  case input_format_t::ubjson:
6431  result = parse_ubjson_internal();
6432  break;
6433 
6434  // LCOV_EXCL_START
6435  default:
6436  assert(false);
6437  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
6438  }
6439 
6440  // strict mode: next byte must be EOF
6441  if (result and strict)
6442  {
6443  if (format == input_format_t::ubjson)
6444  {
6445  get_ignore_noop();
6446  }
6447  else
6448  {
6449  get();
6450  }
6451 
6452  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current != std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
6453  {
6454  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, get_token_string(),
6455  parse_error::create(110, chars_read, exception_message(format, "expected end of input; last byte: 0x" + get_token_string(), "value")));
6456  }
6457  }
6458 
6459  return result;
6460  }
6461 
6469  static constexpr bool little_endianess(int num = 1) noexcept
6470  {
6471  return (*reinterpret_cast<char*>(&num) == 1);
6472  }
6473 
6474  private:
6476  // BSON //
6478 
6483  bool parse_bson_internal()
6484  {
6485  std::int32_t document_size;
6486  get_number<std::int32_t, true>(input_format_t::bson, document_size);
6487 
6488  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_object(std::size_t(-1))))
6489  {
6490  return false;
6491  }
6492 
6493  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_bson_element_list(/*is_array*/false)))
6494  {
6495  return false;
6496  }
6497 
6498  return sax->end_object();
6499  }
6500 
6508  bool get_bson_cstr(string_t& result)
6509  {
6510  auto out = std::back_inserter(result);
6511  while (true)
6512  {
6513  get();
6514  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::bson, "cstring")))
6515  {
6516  return false;
6517  }
6518  if (current == 0x00)
6519  {
6520  return true;
6521  }
