6522  *out++ = static_cast<char>(current);
6523  }
6524 
6525  return true;
6526  }
6527 
6539  template<typename NumberType>
6540  bool get_bson_string(const NumberType len, string_t& result)
6541  {
6542  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(len < 1))
6543  {
6544  auto last_token = get_token_string();
6545  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(112, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::bson, "string length must be at least 1, is " + std::to_string(len), "string")));
6546  }
6547 
6548  return get_string(input_format_t::bson, len - static_cast<NumberType>(1), result) and get() != std::char_traits<char>::eof();
6549  }
6550 
6561  bool parse_bson_element_internal(const int element_type,
6562  const std::size_t element_type_parse_position)
6563  {
6564  switch (element_type)
6565  {
6566  case 0x01: // double
6567  {
6568  double number;
6569  return get_number<double, true>(input_format_t::bson, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
6570  }
6571 
6572  case 0x02: // string
6573  {
6574  std::int32_t len;
6575  string_t value;
6576  return get_number<std::int32_t, true>(input_format_t::bson, len) and get_bson_string(len, value) and sax->string(value);
6577  }
6578 
6579  case 0x03: // object
6580  {
6581  return parse_bson_internal();
6582  }
6583 
6584  case 0x04: // array
6585  {
6586  return parse_bson_array();
6587  }
6588 
6589  case 0x08: // boolean
6590  {
6591  return sax->boolean(get() != 0);
6592  }
6593 
6594  case 0x0A: // null
6595  {
6596  return sax->null();
6597  }
6598 
6599  case 0x10: // int32
6600  {
6601  std::int32_t value;
6602  return get_number<std::int32_t, true>(input_format_t::bson, value) and sax->number_integer(value);
6603  }
6604 
6605  case 0x12: // int64
6606  {
6607  std::int64_t value;
6608  return get_number<std::int64_t, true>(input_format_t::bson, value) and sax->number_integer(value);
6609  }
6610 
6611  default: // anything else not supported (yet)
6612  {
6613  char cr[3];
6614  (std::snprintf)(cr, sizeof(cr), "%.2hhX", static_cast<unsigned char>(element_type));
6615  return sax->parse_error(element_type_parse_position, std::string(cr), parse_error::create(114, element_type_parse_position, "Unsupported BSON record type 0x" + std::string(cr)));
6616  }
6617  }
6618  }
6619 
6632  bool parse_bson_element_list(const bool is_array)
6633  {
6634  string_t key;
6635  while (int element_type = get())
6636  {
6637  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::bson, "element list")))
6638  {
6639  return false;
6640  }
6641 
6642  const std::size_t element_type_parse_position = chars_read;
6643  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_bson_cstr(key)))
6644  {
6645  return false;
6646  }
6647 
6648  if (not is_array)
6649  {
6650  if (not sax->key(key))
6651  {
6652  return false;
6653  }
6654  }
6655 
6656  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_bson_element_internal(element_type, element_type_parse_position)))
6657  {
6658  return false;
6659  }
6660 
6661  // get_bson_cstr only appends
6662  key.clear();
6663  }
6664 
6665  return true;
6666  }
6667 
6672  bool parse_bson_array()
6673  {
6674  std::int32_t document_size;
6675  get_number<std::int32_t, true>(input_format_t::bson, document_size);
6676 
6677  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(std::size_t(-1))))
6678  {
6679  return false;
6680  }
6681 
6682  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_bson_element_list(/*is_array*/true)))
6683  {
6684  return false;
6685  }
6686 
6687  return sax->end_array();
6688  }
6689 
6691  // CBOR //
6693 
6701  bool parse_cbor_internal(const bool get_char = true)
6702  {
6703  switch (get_char ? get() : current)
6704  {
6705  // EOF
6706  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
6707  return unexpect_eof(input_format_t::cbor, "value");
6708 
6709  // Integer 0x00..0x17 (0..23)
6710  case 0x00:
6711  case 0x01:
6712  case 0x02:
6713  case 0x03:
6714  case 0x04:
6715  case 0x05:
6716  case 0x06:
6717  case 0x07:
6718  case 0x08:
6719  case 0x09:
6720  case 0x0A:
6721  case 0x0B:
6722  case 0x0C:
6723  case 0x0D:
6724  case 0x0E:
6725  case 0x0F:
6726  case 0x10:
6727  case 0x11:
6728  case 0x12:
6729  case 0x13:
6730  case 0x14:
6731  case 0x15:
6732  case 0x16:
6733  case 0x17:
6734  return sax->number_unsigned(static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current));
6735 
6736  case 0x18: // Unsigned integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
6737  {
6738  uint8_t number;
6739  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
6740  }
6741 
6742  case 0x19: // Unsigned integer (two-byte uint16_t follows)
6743  {
6744  uint16_t number;
6745  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
6746  }
6747 
6748  case 0x1A: // Unsigned integer (four-byte uint32_t follows)
6749  {
6750  uint32_t number;
6751  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
6752  }
6753 
6754  case 0x1B: // Unsigned integer (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
6755  {
6756  uint64_t number;
6757  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
6758  }
6759 
6760  // Negative integer -1-0x00..-1-0x17 (-1..-24)
6761  case 0x20:
6762  case 0x21:
6763  case 0x22:
6764  case 0x23:
6765  case 0x24:
6766  case 0x25:
6767  case 0x26:
6768  case 0x27:
6769  case 0x28:
6770  case 0x29:
6771  case 0x2A:
6772  case 0x2B:
6773  case 0x2C:
6774  case 0x2D:
6775  case 0x2E:
6776  case 0x2F:
6777  case 0x30:
6778  case 0x31:
6779  case 0x32:
6780  case 0x33:
6781  case 0x34:
6782  case 0x35:
6783  case 0x36:
6784  case 0x37:
6785  return sax->number_integer(static_cast<int8_t>(0x20 - 1 - current));
6786 
6787  case 0x38: // Negative integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
6788  {
6789  uint8_t number;
6790  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_integer(static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - number);
6791  }
6792 
6793  case 0x39: // Negative integer -1-n (two-byte uint16_t follows)
6794  {
6795  uint16_t number;
6796  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_integer(static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - number);
6797  }
6798 
6799  case 0x3A: // Negative integer -1-n (four-byte uint32_t follows)
6800  {
6801  uint32_t number;
6802  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_integer(static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - number);
6803  }
6804 
6805  case 0x3B: // Negative integer -1-n (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
6806  {
6807  uint64_t number;
6808  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_integer(static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1)
6809  - static_cast<number_integer_t>(number));
6810  }
6811 
6812  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
6813  case 0x60:
6814  case 0x61:
6815  case 0x62:
6816  case 0x63:
6817  case 0x64:
6818  case 0x65:
6819  case 0x66:
6820  case 0x67:
6821  case 0x68:
6822  case 0x69:
6823  case 0x6A:
6824  case 0x6B:
6825  case 0x6C:
6826  case 0x6D:
6827  case 0x6E:
6828  case 0x6F:
6829  case 0x70:
6830  case 0x71:
6831  case 0x72:
6832  case 0x73:
6833  case 0x74:
6834  case 0x75:
6835  case 0x76:
6836  case 0x77:
6837  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
6838  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
6839  case 0x7A: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
6840  case 0x7B: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
6841  case 0x7F: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
6842  {
6843  string_t s;
6844  return get_cbor_string(s) and sax->string(s);
6845  }
6846 
6847  // array (0x00..0x17 data items follow)
6848  case 0x80:
6849  case 0x81:
6850  case 0x82:
6851  case 0x83:
6852  case 0x84:
6853  case 0x85:
6854  case 0x86:
6855  case 0x87:
6856  case 0x88:
6857  case 0x89:
6858  case 0x8A:
6859  case 0x8B:
6860  case 0x8C:
6861  case 0x8D:
6862  case 0x8E:
6863  case 0x8F:
6864  case 0x90:
6865  case 0x91:
6866  case 0x92:
6867  case 0x93:
6868  case 0x94:
6869  case 0x95:
6870  case 0x96:
6871  case 0x97:
6872  return get_cbor_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(current & 0x1F));
6873 
6874  case 0x98: // array (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
6875  {
6876  uint8_t len;
6877  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
6878  }
6879 
6880  case 0x99: // array (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
6881  {
6882  uint16_t len;
6883  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
6884  }
6885 
6886  case 0x9A: // array (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
6887  {
6888  uint32_t len;
6889  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
6890  }
6891 
6892  case 0x9B: // array (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
6893  {
6894  uint64_t len;
6895  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
6896  }
6897 
6898  case 0x9F: // array (indefinite length)
6899  return get_cbor_array(std::size_t(-1));
6900 
6901  // map (0x00..0x17 pairs of data items follow)
6902  case 0xA0:
6903  case 0xA1:
6904  case 0xA2:
6905  case 0xA3:
6906  case 0xA4:
6907  case 0xA5:
6908  case 0xA6:
6909  case 0xA7:
6910  case 0xA8:
6911  case 0xA9:
6912  case 0xAA:
6913  case 0xAB:
6914  case 0xAC:
6915  case 0xAD:
6916  case 0xAE:
6917  case 0xAF:
6918  case 0xB0:
6919  case 0xB1:
6920  case 0xB2:
6921  case 0xB3:
6922  case 0xB4:
6923  case 0xB5:
6924  case 0xB6:
6925  case 0xB7:
6926  return get_cbor_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(current & 0x1F));
6927 
6928  case 0xB8: // map (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
6929  {
6930  uint8_t len;
6931  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
6932  }
6933 
6934  case 0xB9: // map (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
6935  {
6936  uint16_t len;
6937  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
6938  }
6939 
6940  case 0xBA: // map (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
6941  {
6942  uint32_t len;
6943  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
6944  }
6945 
6946  case 0xBB: // map (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
6947  {
6948  uint64_t len;
6949  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
6950  }
6951 
6952  case 0xBF: // map (indefinite length)
6953  return get_cbor_object(std::size_t(-1));
6954 
6955  case 0xF4: // false
6956  return sax->boolean(false);
6957 
6958  case 0xF5: // true
6959  return sax->boolean(true);
6960 
6961  case 0xF6: // null
6962  return sax->null();
6963 
6964  case 0xF9: // Half-Precision Float (two-byte IEEE 754)
6965  {
6966  const int byte1_raw = get();
6967  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::cbor, "number")))
6968  {
6969  return false;
6970  }
6971  const int byte2_raw = get();
6972  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::cbor, "number")))
6973  {
6974  return false;
6975  }
6976 
6977  const auto byte1 = static_cast<unsigned char>(byte1_raw);
6978  const auto byte2 = static_cast<unsigned char>(byte2_raw);
6979 
6980  // code from RFC 7049, Appendix D, Figure 3:
6981  // As half-precision floating-point numbers were only added
6982  // to IEEE 754 in 2008, today's programming platforms often
6983  // still only have limited support for them. It is very
6984  // easy to include at least decoding support for them even
6985  // without such support. An example of a small decoder for
6986  // half-precision floating-point numbers in the C language
6987  // is shown in Fig. 3.
6988  const int half = (byte1 << 8) + byte2;
6989  const double val = [&half]
6990  {
6991  const int exp = (half >> 10) & 0x1F;
6992  const int mant = half & 0x3FF;
6993  assert(0 <= exp and exp <= 32);
6994  assert(0 <= mant and mant <= 1024);
6995  switch (exp)
6996  {
6997  case 0:
6998  return std::ldexp(mant, -24);
6999  case 31:
7000  return (mant == 0)
7001  ? std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity()
7002  : std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
7003  default:
7004  return std::ldexp(mant + 1024, exp - 25);
7005  }
7006  }();
7007  return sax->number_float((half & 0x8000) != 0
7008  ? static_cast<number_float_t>(-val)
7009  : static_cast<number_float_t>(val), "");
7010  }
7011 
7012  case 0xFA: // Single-Precision Float (four-byte IEEE 754)
7013  {
7014  float number;
7015  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
7016  }
7017 
7018  case 0xFB: // Double-Precision Float (eight-byte IEEE 754)
7019  {
7020  double number;
7021  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
7022  }
7023 
7024  default: // anything else (0xFF is handled inside the other types)
7025  {
7026  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7027  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(112, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::cbor, "invalid byte: 0x" + last_token, "value")));
7028  }
7029  }
7030  }
7031 
7043  bool get_cbor_string(string_t& result)
7044  {
7045  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::cbor, "string")))
7046  {
7047  return false;
7048  }
7049 
7050  switch (current)
7051  {
7052  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
7053  case 0x60:
7054  case 0x61:
7055  case 0x62:
7056  case 0x63:
7057  case 0x64:
7058  case 0x65:
7059  case 0x66:
7060  case 0x67:
7061  case 0x68:
7062  case 0x69:
7063  case 0x6A:
7064  case 0x6B:
7065  case 0x6C:
7066  case 0x6D:
7067  case 0x6E:
7068  case 0x6F:
7069  case 0x70:
7070  case 0x71:
7071  case 0x72:
7072  case 0x73:
7073  case 0x74:
7074  case 0x75:
7075  case 0x76:
7076  case 0x77:
7077  {
7078  return get_string(input_format_t::cbor, current & 0x1F, result);
7079  }
7080 
7081  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
7082  {
7083  uint8_t len;
7084  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_string(input_format_t::cbor, len, result);
7085  }
7086 
7087  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
7088  {
7089  uint16_t len;
7090  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_string(input_format_t::cbor, len, result);
7091  }
7092 
7093  case 0x7A: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
7094  {
7095  uint32_t len;
7096  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_string(input_format_t::cbor, len, result);
7097  }
7098 
7099  case 0x7B: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
7100  {
7101  uint64_t len;
7102  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_string(input_format_t::cbor, len, result);
7103  }
7104 
7105  case 0x7F: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
7106  {
7107  while (get() != 0xFF)
7108  {
7109  string_t chunk;
7110  if (not get_cbor_string(chunk))
7111  {
7112  return false;
7113  }
7114  result.append(chunk);
7115  }
7116  return true;
7117  }
7118 
7119  default:
7120  {
7121  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7122  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(113, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::cbor, "expected length specification (0x60-0x7B) or indefinite string type (0x7F); last byte: 0x" + last_token, "string")));
7123  }
7124  }
7125  }
7126 
7132  bool get_cbor_array(const std::size_t len)
7133  {
7134  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(len)))
7135  {
7136  return false;
7137  }
7138 
7139  if (len != std::size_t(-1))
7140  {
7141  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7142  {
7143  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_cbor_internal()))
7144  {
7145  return false;
7146  }
7147  }
7148  }
7149  else
7150  {
7151  while (get() != 0xFF)
7152  {
7153  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_cbor_internal(false)))
7154  {
7155  return false;
7156  }
7157  }
7158  }
7159 
7160  return sax->end_array();
7161  }
7162 
7168  bool get_cbor_object(const std::size_t len)
7169  {
7170  if (not JSON_UNLIKELY(sax->start_object(len)))
7171  {
7172  return false;
7173  }
7174 
7175  string_t key;
7176  if (len != std::size_t(-1))
7177  {
7178  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7179  {
7180  get();
7181  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_cbor_string(key) or not sax->key(key)))
7182  {
7183  return false;
7184  }
7185 
7186  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_cbor_internal()))
7187  {
7188  return false;
7189  }
7190  key.clear();
7191  }
7192  }
7193  else
7194  {
7195  while (get() != 0xFF)
7196  {
7197  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_cbor_string(key) or not sax->key(key)))
7198  {
7199  return false;
7200  }
7201 
7202  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_cbor_internal()))
7203  {
7204  return false;
7205  }
7206  key.clear();
7207  }
7208  }
7209 
7210  return sax->end_object();
7211  }
7212 
7214  // MsgPack //
7216 
7220  bool parse_msgpack_internal()
7221  {
7222  switch (get())
7223  {
7224  // EOF
7225  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
7226  return unexpect_eof(input_format_t::msgpack, "value");
7227 
7228  // positive fixint
7229  case 0x00:
7230  case 0x01:
7231  case 0x02:
7232  case 0x03:
7233  case 0x04:
7234  case 0x05:
7235  case 0x06:
7236  case 0x07:
7237  case 0x08:
7238  case 0x09:
7239  case 0x0A:
7240  case 0x0B:
7241  case 0x0C:
7242  case 0x0D:
7243  case 0x0E:
7244  case 0x0F:
7245  case 0x10:
7246  case 0x11:
7247  case 0x12:
7248  case 0x13:
7249  case 0x14:
7250  case 0x15:
7251  case 0x16:
7252  case 0x17:
7253  case 0x18:
7254  case 0x19:
7255  case 0x1A:
7256  case 0x1B:
7257  case 0x1C:
7258  case 0x1D:
7259  case 0x1E:
7260  case 0x1F:
7261  case 0x20:
7262  case 0x21:
7263  case 0x22:
7264  case 0x23:
7265  case 0x24:
7266  case 0x25:
7267  case 0x26:
7268  case 0x27:
7269  case 0x28:
7270  case 0x29:
7271  case 0x2A:
7272  case 0x2B:
7273  case 0x2C:
7274  case 0x2D:
7275  case 0x2E:
7276  case 0x2F:
7277  case 0x30:
7278  case 0x31:
7279  case 0x32:
7280  case 0x33:
7281  case 0x34:
7282  case 0x35:
7283  case 0x36:
7284  case 0x37:
7285  case 0x38:
7286  case 0x39:
7287  case 0x3A:
7288  case 0x3B:
7289  case 0x3C:
7290  case 0x3D:
7291  case 0x3E:
7292  case 0x3F:
7293  case 0x40:
7294  case 0x41:
7295  case 0x42:
7296  case 0x43:
7297  case 0x44:
7298  case 0x45:
7299  case 0x46:
7300  case 0x47:
7301  case 0x48:
7302  case 0x49:
7303  case 0x4A:
7304  case 0x4B:
7305  case 0x4C:
7306  case 0x4D:
7307  case 0x4E:
7308  case 0x4F:
7309  case 0x50:
7310  case 0x51:
7311  case 0x52:
7312  case 0x53:
7313  case 0x54:
7314  case 0x55:
7315  case 0x56:
7316  case 0x57:
7317  case 0x58:
7318  case 0x59:
7319  case 0x5A:
7320  case 0x5B:
7321  case 0x5C:
7322  case 0x5D:
7323  case 0x5E:
7324  case 0x5F:
7325  case 0x60:
7326  case 0x61:
7327  case 0x62:
7328  case 0x63:
7329  case 0x64:
7330  case 0x65:
7331  case 0x66:
7332  case 0x67:
7333  case 0x68:
7334  case 0x69:
7335  case 0x6A:
7336  case 0x6B:
7337  case 0x6C:
7338  case 0x6D:
7339  case 0x6E:
7340  case 0x6F:
7341  case 0x70:
7342  case 0x71:
7343  case 0x72:
7344  case 0x73:
7345  case 0x74:
7346  case 0x75:
7347  case 0x76:
7348  case 0x77:
7349  case 0x78:
7350  case 0x79:
7351  case 0x7A:
7352  case 0x7B:
7353  case 0x7C:
7354  case 0x7D:
7355  case 0x7E:
7356  case 0x7F:
7357  return sax->number_unsigned(static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current));
7358 
7359  // fixmap
7360  case 0x80:
7361  case 0x81:
7362  case 0x82:
7363  case 0x83:
7364  case 0x84:
7365  case 0x85:
7366  case 0x86:
7367  case 0x87:
7368  case 0x88:
7369  case 0x89:
7370  case 0x8A:
7371  case 0x8B:
7372  case 0x8C:
7373  case 0x8D:
7374  case 0x8E:
7375  case 0x8F:
7376  return get_msgpack_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(current & 0x0F));
7377 
7378  // fixarray
7379  case 0x90:
7380  case 0x91:
7381  case 0x92:
7382  case 0x93:
7383  case 0x94:
7384  case 0x95:
7385  case 0x96:
7386  case 0x97:
7387  case 0x98:
7388  case 0x99:
7389  case 0x9A:
7390  case 0x9B:
7391  case 0x9C:
7392  case 0x9D:
7393  case 0x9E:
7394  case 0x9F:
7395  return get_msgpack_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(current & 0x0F));
7396 
7397  // fixstr
7398  case 0xA0:
7399  case 0xA1:
7400  case 0xA2:
7401  case 0xA3:
7402  case 0xA4:
7403  case 0xA5:
7404  case 0xA6:
7405  case 0xA7:
7406  case 0xA8:
7407  case 0xA9:
7408  case 0xAA:
7409  case 0xAB:
7410  case 0xAC:
7411  case 0xAD:
7412  case 0xAE:
7413  case 0xAF:
7414  case 0xB0:
7415  case 0xB1:
7416  case 0xB2:
7417  case 0xB3:
7418  case 0xB4:
7419  case 0xB5:
7420  case 0xB6:
7421  case 0xB7:
7422  case 0xB8:
7423  case 0xB9:
7424  case 0xBA:
7425  case 0xBB:
7426  case 0xBC:
7427  case 0xBD:
7428  case 0xBE:
7429  case 0xBF:
7430  {
7431  string_t s;
7432  return get_msgpack_string(s) and sax->string(s);
7433  }
7434 
7435  case 0xC0: // nil
7436  return sax->null();
7437 
7438  case 0xC2: // false
7439  return sax->boolean(false);
7440 
7441  case 0xC3: // true
7442  return sax->boolean(true);
7443 
7444  case 0xCA: // float 32
7445  {
7446  float number;
7447  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
7448  }
7449 
7450  case 0xCB: // float 64
7451  {
7452  double number;
7453  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
7454  }
7455 
7456  case 0xCC: // uint 8
7457  {
7458  uint8_t number;
7459  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
7460  }
7461 
7462  case 0xCD: // uint 16
7463  {
7464  uint16_t number;
7465  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
7466  }
7467 
7468  case 0xCE: // uint 32
7469  {
7470  uint32_t number;
7471  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
7472  }
7473 
7474  case 0xCF: // uint 64
7475  {
7476  uint64_t number;
7477  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
7478  }
7479 
7480  case 0xD0: // int 8
7481  {
7482  int8_t number;
7483  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7484  }
7485 
7486  case 0xD1: // int 16
7487  {
7488  int16_t number;
7489  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7490  }
7491 
7492  case 0xD2: // int 32
7493  {
7494  int32_t number;
7495  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7496  }
7497 
7498  case 0xD3: // int 64
7499  {
7500  int64_t number;
7501  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7502  }
7503 
7504  case 0xD9: // str 8
7505  case 0xDA: // str 16
7506  case 0xDB: // str 32
7507  {
7508  string_t s;
7509  return get_msgpack_string(s) and sax->string(s);
7510  }
7511 
7512  case 0xDC: // array 16
7513  {
7514  uint16_t len;
7515  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_msgpack_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7516  }
7517 
7518  case 0xDD: // array 32
7519  {
7520  uint32_t len;
7521  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_msgpack_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7522  }
7523 
7524  case 0xDE: // map 16
7525  {
7526  uint16_t len;
7527  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_msgpack_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7528  }
7529 
7530  case 0xDF: // map 32
7531  {
7532  uint32_t len;
7533  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_msgpack_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7534  }
7535 
7536  // negative fixint
7537  case 0xE0:
7538  case 0xE1:
7539  case 0xE2:
7540  case 0xE3:
7541  case 0xE4:
7542  case 0xE5:
7543  case 0xE6:
7544  case 0xE7:
7545  case 0xE8:
7546  case 0xE9:
7547  case 0xEA:
7548  case 0xEB:
7549  case 0xEC:
7550  case 0xED:
7551  case 0xEE:
7552  case 0xEF:
7553  case 0xF0:
7554  case 0xF1:
7555  case 0xF2:
7556  case 0xF3:
7557  case 0xF4:
7558  case 0xF5:
7559  case 0xF6:
7560  case 0xF7:
7561  case 0xF8:
7562  case 0xF9:
7563  case 0xFA:
7564  case 0xFB:
7565  case 0xFC:
7566  case 0xFD:
7567  case 0xFE:
7568  case 0xFF:
7569  return sax->number_integer(static_cast<int8_t>(current));
7570 
7571  default: // anything else
7572  {
7573  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7574  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(112, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::msgpack, "invalid byte: 0x" + last_token, "value")));
7575  }
7576  }
7577  }
7578 
7589  bool get_msgpack_string(string_t& result)
7590  {
7591  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::msgpack, "string")))
7592  {
7593  return false;
7594  }
7595 
7596  switch (current)
7597  {
7598  // fixstr
7599  case 0xA0:
7600  case 0xA1:
7601  case 0xA2:
7602  case 0xA3:
7603  case 0xA4:
7604  case 0xA5:
7605  case 0xA6:
7606  case 0xA7:
7607  case 0xA8:
7608  case 0xA9:
7609  case 0xAA:
7610  case 0xAB:
7611  case 0xAC:
7612  case 0xAD:
7613  case 0xAE:
7614  case 0xAF:
7615  case 0xB0:
7616  case 0xB1:
7617  case 0xB2:
7618  case 0xB3:
7619  case 0xB4:
7620  case 0xB5:
7621  case 0xB6:
7622  case 0xB7:
7623  case 0xB8:
7624  case 0xB9:
7625  case 0xBA:
7626  case 0xBB:
7627  case 0xBC:
7628  case 0xBD:
7629  case 0xBE:
7630  case 0xBF:
7631  {
7632  return get_string(input_format_t::msgpack, current & 0x1F, result);
7633  }
7634 
7635  case 0xD9: // str 8
7636  {
7637  uint8_t len;
7638  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_string(input_format_t::msgpack, len, result);
7639  }
7640 
7641  case 0xDA: // str 16
7642  {
7643  uint16_t len;
7644  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_string(input_format_t::msgpack, len, result);
7645  }
7646 
7647  case 0xDB: // str 32
7648  {
7649  uint32_t len;
7650  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_string(input_format_t::msgpack, len, result);
7651  }
7652 
7653  default:
7654  {
7655  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7656  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(113, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::msgpack, "expected length specification (0xA0-0xBF, 0xD9-0xDB); last byte: 0x" + last_token, "string")));
7657  }
7658  }
7659  }
7660 
7665  bool get_msgpack_array(const std::size_t len)
7666  {
7667  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(len)))
7668  {
7669  return false;
7670  }
7671 
7672  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7673  {
7674  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_msgpack_internal()))
7675  {
7676  return false;
7677  }
7678  }
7679 
7680  return sax->end_array();
7681  }
7682 
7687  bool get_msgpack_object(const std::size_t len)
7688  {
7689  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_object(len)))
7690  {
7691  return false;
7692  }
7693 
7694  string_t key;
7695  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7696  {
7697  get();
7698  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_msgpack_string(key) or not sax->key(key)))
7699  {
7700  return false;
7701  }
7702 
7703  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_msgpack_internal()))
7704  {
7705  return false;
7706  }
7707  key.clear();
7708  }
7709 
7710  return sax->end_object();
7711  }
7712 
7714  // UBJSON //
7716 
7724  bool parse_ubjson_internal(const bool get_char = true)
7725  {
7726  return get_ubjson_value(get_char ? get_ignore_noop() : current);
7727  }
7728 
7743  bool get_ubjson_string(string_t& result, const bool get_char = true)
7744  {
7745  if (get_char)
7746  {
7747  get(); // TODO: may we ignore N here?
7748  }
7749 
7750  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::ubjson, "value")))
7751  {
7752  return false;
7753  }
7754 
7755  switch (current)
7756  {
7757  case 'U':
7758  {
7759  uint8_t len;
7760  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, len) and get_string(input_format_t::ubjson, len, result);
7761  }
7762 
7763  case 'i':
7764  {
7765  int8_t len;
7766  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, len) and get_string(input_format_t::ubjson, len, result);
7767  }
7768 
7769  case 'I':
7770  {
7771  int16_t len;
7772  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, len) and get_string(input_format_t::ubjson, len, result);
7773  }
7774 
7775  case 'l':
7776  {
7777  int32_t len;
7778  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, len) and get_string(input_format_t::ubjson, len, result);
7779  }
7780 
7781  case 'L':
7782  {
7783  int64_t len;
7784  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, len) and get_string(input_format_t::ubjson, len, result);
7785  }
7786 
7787  default:
7788  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7789  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(113, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::ubjson, "expected length type specification (U, i, I, l, L); last byte: 0x" + last_token, "string")));
7790  }
7791  }
7792 
7797  bool get_ubjson_size_value(std::size_t& result)
7798  {
7799  switch (get_ignore_noop())
7800  {
7801  case 'U':
7802  {
7803  uint8_t number;
7804  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number)))
7805  {
7806  return false;
7807  }
7808  result = static_cast<std::size_t>(number);
7809  return true;
7810  }
7811 
7812  case 'i':
7813  {
7814  int8_t number;
7815  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number)))
7816  {
7817  return false;
7818  }
7819  result = static_cast<std::size_t>(number);
7820  return true;
7821  }
7822 
7823  case 'I':
7824  {
7825  int16_t number;
7826  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number)))
7827  {
7828  return false;
7829  }
7830  result = static_cast<std::size_t>(number);
7831  return true;
7832  }
7833 
7834  case 'l':
7835  {
7836  int32_t number;
7837  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number)))
7838  {
7839  return false;
7840  }
7841  result = static_cast<std::size_t>(number);
7842  return true;
7843  }
7844 
7845  case 'L':
7846  {
7847  int64_t number;
7848  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number)))
7849  {
7850  return false;
7851  }
7852  result = static_cast<std::size_t>(number);
7853  return true;
7854  }
7855 
7856  default:
7857  {
7858  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7859  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(113, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::ubjson, "expected length type specification (U, i, I, l, L) after '#'; last byte: 0x" + last_token, "size")));
7860  }
7861  }
7862  }
7863 
7874  bool get_ubjson_size_type(std::pair<std::size_t, int>& result)
7875  {
7876  result.first = string_t::npos; // size
7877  result.second = 0; // type
7878 
7879  get_ignore_noop();
7880 
7881  if (current == '$')
7882  {
7883  result.second = get(); // must not ignore 'N', because 'N' maybe the type
7884  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::ubjson, "type")))
7885  {
7886  return false;
7887  }
7888 
7889  get_ignore_noop();
7890  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current != '#'))
7891  {
7892  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::ubjson, "value")))
7893  {
7894  return false;
7895  }
7896  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7897  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(112, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::ubjson, "expected '#' after type information; last byte: 0x" + last_token, "size")));
7898  }
7899 
7900  return get_ubjson_size_value(result.first);
7901  }
7902  else if (current == '#')
7903  {
7904  return get_ubjson_size_value(result.first);
7905  }
7906  return true;
7907  }
7908 
7913  bool get_ubjson_value(const int prefix)
7914  {
7915  switch (prefix)
7916  {
7917  case std::char_traits<char>::eof(): // EOF
7918  return unexpect_eof(input_format_t::ubjson, "value");
7919 
7920  case 'T': // true
7921  return sax->boolean(true);
7922  case 'F': // false
7923  return sax->boolean(false);
7924 
7925  case 'Z': // null
7926  return sax->null();
7927 
7928  case 'U':
7929  {
7930  uint8_t number;
7931  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
7932  }
7933 
7934  case 'i':
7935  {
7936  int8_t number;
7937  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7938  }
7939 
7940  case 'I':
7941  {
7942  int16_t number;
7943  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7944  }
7945 
7946  case 'l':
7947  {
7948  int32_t number;
7949  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7950  }
7951 
7952  case 'L':
7953  {
7954  int64_t number;
7955  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7956  }
7957 
7958  case 'd':
7959  {
7960  float number;
7961  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
7962  }
7963 
7964  case 'D':
7965  {
7966  double number;
7967  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
7968  }
7969 
7970  case 'C': // char
7971  {
7972  get();
7973  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::ubjson, "char")))
7974  {
7975  return false;
7976  }
7977  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current > 127))
7978  {
7979  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7980  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(113, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::ubjson, "byte after 'C' must be in range 0x00..0x7F; last byte: 0x" + last_token, "char")));
7981  }
7982  string_t s(1, static_cast<char>(current));
7983  return sax->string(s);
7984  }
7985 
7986  case 'S': // string
7987  {
7988  string_t s;
7989  return get_ubjson_string(s) and sax->string(s);
7990  }
7991 
7992  case '[': // array
7993  return get_ubjson_array();
7994 
7995  case '{': // object
7996  return get_ubjson_object();
7997 
7998  default: // anything else
7999  {
8000  auto last_token = get_token_string();
8001  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(112, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::ubjson, "invalid byte: 0x" + last_token, "value")));
8002  }
8003  }
8004  }
8005 
8009  bool get_ubjson_array()
8010  {
8011  std::pair<std::size_t, int> size_and_type;
8012  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_size_type(size_and_type)))
8013  {
8014  return false;
8015  }
8016 
8017  if (size_and_type.first != string_t::npos)
8018  {
8019  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(size_and_type.first)))
8020  {
8021  return false;
8022  }
8023 
8024  if (size_and_type.second != 0)
8025  {
8026  if (size_and_type.second != 'N')
8027  {
8028  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < size_and_type.first; ++i)
8029  {
8030  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_value(size_and_type.second)))
8031  {
8032  return false;
8033  }
8034  }
8035  }
8036  }
8037  else
8038  {
8039  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < size_and_type.first; ++i)
8040  {
8041  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_ubjson_internal()))
8042  {
8043  return false;
8044  }
8045  }
8046  }
8047  }
8048  else
8049  {
8050  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(std::size_t(-1))))
8051  {
8052  return false;
8053  }
8054 
8055  while (current != ']')
8056  {
8057  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_ubjson_internal(false)))
8058  {
8059  return false;
8060  }
8061  get_ignore_noop();
8062  }
8063  }
8064 
8065  return sax->end_array();
8066  }
8067 
8071  bool get_ubjson_object()
8072  {
8073  std::pair<std::size_t, int> size_and_type;
8074  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_size_type(size_and_type)))
8075  {
8076  return false;
8077  }
8078 
8079  string_t key;
8080  if (size_and_type.first != string_t::npos)
8081  {
8082  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_object(size_and_type.first)))
8083  {
8084  return false;
8085  }
8086 
8087  if (size_and_type.second != 0)
8088  {
8089  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < size_and_type.first; ++i)
8090  {
8091  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_string(key) or not sax->key(key)))
8092  {
8093  return false;
8094  }
8095  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_value(size_and_type.second)))
8096  {
8097  return false;
8098  }
8099  key.clear();
8100  }
8101  }
8102  else
8103  {
8104  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < size_and_type.first; ++i)
8105  {
8106  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_string(key) or not sax->key(key)))
8107  {
8108  return false;
8109  }
8110  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_ubjson_internal()))
8111  {
8112  return false;
8113  }
8114  key.clear();
8115  }
8116  }
8117  }
8118  else
8119  {
8120  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_object(std::size_t(-1))))
8121  {
8122  return false;
8123  }
8124 
8125  while (current != '}')
8126  {
8127  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_string(key, false) or not sax->key(key)))
8128  {
8129  return false;
8130  }
8131  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_ubjson_internal()))
8132  {
8133  return false;
8134  }
8135  get_ignore_noop();
8136  key.clear();
8137  }
8138  }
8139 
8140  return sax->end_object();
8141  }
8142 
8144  // Utility functions //
8146 
8156  int get()
8157  {
8158  ++chars_read;
8159  return (current = ia->get_character());
8160  }
8161 
8165  int get_ignore_noop()
8166  {
8167  do
8168  {
8169  get();
8170  }
8171  while (current == 'N');
8172 
8173  return current;
8174  }
8175 
8176  /*
8177  @brief read a number from the input
8178 
8179  @tparam NumberType the type of the number
8180  @param[in] format the current format (for diagnostics)
8181  @param[out] result number of type @a NumberType
8182 
8183  @return whether conversion completed
8184 
8185  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because
8186  bytes in CBOR, MessagePack, and UBJSON are stored in network order
8187  (big endian) and therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
8188  */
8189  template<typename NumberType, bool InputIsLittleEndian = false>
8190  bool get_number(const input_format_t format, NumberType& result)
8191  {
8192  // step 1: read input into array with system's byte order
8193  std::array<uint8_t, sizeof(NumberType)> vec;
8194  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(NumberType); ++i)
8195  {
8196  get();
8197  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(format, "number")))
8198  {
8199  return false;
8200  }
8201 
8202  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
8203  if (is_little_endian && !InputIsLittleEndian)
8204  {
8205  vec[sizeof(NumberType) - i - 1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current);
8206  }
8207  else
8208  {
8209  vec[i] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8210  }
8211  }
8212 
8213  // step 2: convert array into number of type T and return
8214  //std::memcpy(&result, vec.data(), sizeof(NumberType));
8215  std::copy((uint8_t *)&vec[0], (uint8_t *)&vec[0] + sizeof(NumberType), (uint8_t *)&result);
8216  return true;
8217  }
8218 
8233  template<typename NumberType>
8234  bool get_string(const input_format_t format,
8235  const NumberType len,
8236  string_t& result)
8237  {
8238  bool success = true;
8239  std::generate_n(std::back_inserter(result), len, [this, &success, &format]()
8240  {
8241  get();
8242  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(format, "string")))
8243  {
8244  success = false;
8245  }
8246  return static_cast<char>(current);
8247  });
8248  return success;
8249  }
8250 
8256  bool unexpect_eof(const input_format_t format, const char* context) const
8257  {
8258  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current == std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
8259  {
8260  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, "<end of file>",
8261  parse_error::create(110, chars_read, exception_message(format, "unexpected end of input", context)));
8262  }
8263  return true;
8264  }
8265 
8269  std::string get_token_string() const
8270  {
8271  char cr[3];
8272  (std::snprintf)(cr, 3, "%.2hhX", static_cast<unsigned char>(current));
8273  return std::string{cr};
8274  }
8275 
8282  std::string exception_message(const input_format_t format,
8283  const std::string& detail,
8284  const std::string& context) const
8285  {
8286  std::string error_msg = "syntax error while parsing ";
8287 
8288  switch (format)
8289  {
8290  case input_format_t::cbor:
8291  error_msg += "CBOR";
8292  break;
8293 
8294  case input_format_t::msgpack:
8295  error_msg += "MessagePack";
8296  break;
8297 
8298  case input_format_t::ubjson:
8299  error_msg += "UBJSON";
8300  break;
8301 
8302  case input_format_t::bson:
8303  error_msg += "BSON";
8304  break;
8305 
8306  // LCOV_EXCL_START
8307  default:
8308  assert(false);
8309  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
8310  }
8311 
8312  return error_msg + " " + context + ": " + detail;
8313  }
8314 
8315  private:
8317  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
8318 
8320  int current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
8321 
8323  std::size_t chars_read = 0;
8324 
8326  const bool is_little_endian = little_endianess();
8327 
8329  json_sax_t* sax = nullptr;
8330 };
8331 } // namespace detail
8332 } // namespace json
8333 
8334 // #include <nlohmann/detail/output/binary_writer.hpp>
8335 
8336 
8337 #include <algorithm> // reverse
8338 #include <array> // array
8339 #include <cstdint> // uint8_t, uint16_t, uint32_t, uint64_t
8340 //#include <cstring> // memcpy
8341 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
8342 
8343 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/binary_reader.hpp>
8344 
8345 // #include <nlohmann/detail/output/output_adapters.hpp>
8346 
8347 
8348 namespace json
8349 {
8350 namespace detail
8351 {
8353 // binary writer //
8355 
8359 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CharType>
8360 class binary_writer
8361 {
8362  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
8363 
8364  public:
8370  explicit binary_writer(output_adapter_t<CharType> adapter) : oa(adapter)
8371  {
8372  assert(oa);
8373  }
8374 
8379  void write_bson(const BasicJsonType& j)
8380  {
8381  switch (j.type())
8382  {
8383  case value_t::object:
8384  {
8385  write_bson_object(*j.m_value.object);
8386  break;
8387  }
8388 
8389  default:
8390  {
8391  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(317, "to serialize to BSON, top-level type must be object, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
8392  }
8393  }
8394  }
8395 
8399  void write_cbor(const BasicJsonType& j)
8400  {
8401  switch (j.type())
8402  {
8403  case value_t::null:
8404  {
8405  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xF6));
8406  break;
8407  }
8408 
8409  case value_t::boolean:
8410  {
8411  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean
8412  ? to_char_type(0xF5)
8413  : to_char_type(0xF4));
8414  break;
8415  }
8416 
8417  case value_t::number_integer:
8418  {
8419  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
8420  {
8421  // CBOR does not differentiate between positive signed
8422  // integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we used the
8423  // code from the value_t::number_unsigned case here.
8424  if (j.m_value.number_integer <= 0x17)
8425  {
8426  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8427  }
8428  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8429  {
8430  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x18));
8431  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8432  }
8433  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8434  {
8435  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x19));
8436  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8437  }
8438  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8439  {
8440  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x1A));
8441  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8442  }
8443  else
8444  {
8445  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x1B));
8446  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8447  }
8448  }
8449  else
8450  {
8451  // The conversions below encode the sign in the first
8452  // byte, and the value is converted to a positive number.
8453  const auto positive_number = -1 - j.m_value.number_integer;
8454  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -24)
8455  {
8456  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x20 + positive_number));
8457  }
8458  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8459  {
8460  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x38));
8461  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(positive_number));
8462  }
8463  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8464  {
8465  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x39));
8466  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(positive_number));
8467  }
8468  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8469  {
8470  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x3A));
8471  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(positive_number));
8472  }
8473  else
8474  {
8475  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x3B));
8476  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(positive_number));
8477  }
8478  }
8479  break;
8480  }
8481 
8482  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8483  {
8484  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= 0x17)
8485  {
8486  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
8487  }
8488  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8489  {
8490  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x18));
8491  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
8492  }
8493  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8494  {
8495  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x19));
8496  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
8497  }
8498  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8499  {
8500  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x1A));
8501  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
8502  }
8503  else
8504  {
8505  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x1B));
8506  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
8507  }
8508  break;
8509  }
8510 
8511  case value_t::number_float:
8512  {
8513  oa->write_character(get_cbor_float_prefix(j.m_value.number_float));
8514  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
8515  break;
8516  }
8517 
8518  case value_t::string:
8519  {
8520  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
8521  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
8522  if (N <= 0x17)
8523  {
8524  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x60 + N));
8525  }
8526  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8527  {
8528  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x78));
8529  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
8530  }
8531  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8532  {
8533  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x79));
8534  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8535  }
8536  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8537  {
8538  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x7A));
8539  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8540  }
8541  // LCOV_EXCL_START
8542  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
8543  {
8544  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x7B));
8545  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
8546  }
8547  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
8548 
8549  // step 2: write the string
8550  oa->write_characters(
8551  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
8552  j.m_value.string->size());
8553  break;
8554  }
8555 
8556  case value_t::array:
8557  {
8558  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
8559  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
8560  if (N <= 0x17)
8561  {
8562  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 + N));
8563  }
8564  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8565  {
8566  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x98));
8567  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
8568  }
8569  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8570  {
8571  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x99));
8572  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8573  }
8574  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8575  {
8576  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x9A));
8577  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8578  }
8579  // LCOV_EXCL_START
8580  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
8581  {
8582  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x9B));
8583  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
8584  }
8585  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
8586 
8587  // step 2: write each element
8588  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
8589  {
8590  write_cbor(el);
8591  }
8592  break;
8593  }
8594 
8595  case value_t::object:
8596  {
8597  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
8598  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
8599  if (N <= 0x17)
8600  {
8601  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xA0 + N));
8602  }
8603  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8604  {
8605  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xB8));
8606  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
8607  }
8608  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8609  {
8610  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xB9));
8611  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8612  }
8613  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8614  {
8615  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xBA));
8616  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8617  }
8618  // LCOV_EXCL_START
8619  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
8620  {
8621  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xBB));
8622  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
8623  }
8624  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
8625 
8626  // step 2: write each element
8627  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
8628  {
8629  write_cbor(el.first);
8630  write_cbor(el.second);
8631  }
8632  break;
8633  }
8634 
8635  default:
8636  break;
8637  }
8638  }
8639 
8643  void write_msgpack(const BasicJsonType& j)
8644  {
8645  switch (j.type())
8646  {
8647  case value_t::null: // nil
8648  {
8649  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xC0));
8650  break;
8651  }
8652 
8653  case value_t::boolean: // true and false
8654  {
8655  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean
8656  ? to_char_type(0xC3)
8657  : to_char_type(0xC2));
8658  break;
8659  }
8660 
8661  case value_t::number_integer:
8662  {
8663  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
8664  {
8665  // MessagePack does not differentiate between positive
8666  // signed integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we used
8667  // the code from the value_t::number_unsigned case here.
8668  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
8669  {
8670  // positive fixnum
8671  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8672  }
8673  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8674  {
8675  // uint 8
8676  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCC));
8677  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8678  }
8679  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8680  {
8681  // uint 16
8682  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCD));
8683  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8684  }
8685  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8686  {
8687  // uint 32
8688  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCE));
8689  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8690  }
8691  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
8692  {
8693  // uint 64
8694  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCF));
8695  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8696  }
8697  }
8698  else
8699  {
8700  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -32)
8701  {
8702  // negative fixnum
8703  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8704  }
8705  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::min)() and
8706  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)())
8707  {
8708  // int 8
8709  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xD0));
8710  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8711  }
8712  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::min)() and
8713  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)())
8714  {
8715  // int 16
8716  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xD1));
8717  write_number(static_cast<int16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8718  }
8719  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min)() and
8720  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)())
8721  {
8722  // int 32
8723  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xD2));
8724  write_number(static_cast<int32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8725  }
8726  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min)() and
8727  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max)())
8728  {
8729  // int 64
8730  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xD3));
8731  write_number(static_cast<int64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8732  }
8733  }
8734  break;
8735  }
8736 
8737  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8738  {
8739  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
8740  {
8741  // positive fixnum
8742  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8743  }
8744  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8745  {
8746  // uint 8
8747  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCC));
8748  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8749  }
8750  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8751  {
8752  // uint 16
8753  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCD));
8754  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8755  }
8756  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8757  {
8758  // uint 32
8759  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCE));
8760  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8761  }
8762  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
8763  {
8764  // uint 64
8765  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCF));
8766  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8767  }
8768  break;
8769  }
8770 
8771  case value_t::number_float:
8772  {
8773  oa->write_character(get_msgpack_float_prefix(j.m_value.number_float));
8774  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
8775  break;
8776  }
8777 
8778  case value_t::string:
8779  {
8780  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
8781  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
8782  if (N <= 31)
8783  {
8784  // fixstr
8785  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xA0 | N));
8786  }
8787  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8788  {
8789  // str 8
8790  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xD9));
8791  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
8792  }
8793  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8794  {
8795  // str 16
8796  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDA));
8797  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8798  }
8799  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8800  {
8801  // str 32
8802  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDB));
8803  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8804  }
8805 
8806  // step 2: write the string
8807  oa->write_characters(
8808  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
8809  j.m_value.string->size());
8810  break;
8811  }
8812 
8813  case value_t::array:
8814  {
8815  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
8816  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
8817  if (N <= 15)
8818  {
8819  // fixarray
8820  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x90 | N));
8821  }
8822  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8823  {
8824  // array 16
8825  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDC));
8826  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8827  }
8828  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8829  {
8830  // array 32
8831  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDD));
8832  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8833  }
8834 
8835  // step 2: write each element
8836  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
8837  {
8838  write_msgpack(el);
8839  }
8840  break;
8841  }
8842 
8843  case value_t::object:
8844  {
8845  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
8846  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
8847  if (N <= 15)
8848  {
8849  // fixmap
8850  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | (N & 0xF)));
8851  }
8852  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8853  {
8854  // map 16
8855  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDE));
8856  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8857  }
8858  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8859  {
8860  // map 32
8861  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDF));
8862  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8863  }
8864 
8865  // step 2: write each element
8866  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
8867  {
8868  write_msgpack(el.first);
8869  write_msgpack(el.second);
8870  }
8871  break;
8872  }
8873 
8874  default:
8875  break;
8876  }
8877  }
8878 
8885  void write_ubjson(const BasicJsonType& j, const bool use_count,
8886  const bool use_type, const bool add_prefix = true)
8887  {
8888  switch (j.type())
8889  {
8890  case value_t::null:
8891  {
8892  if (add_prefix)
8893  {
8894  oa->write_character(to_char_type('Z'));
8895  }
8896  break;
8897  }
8898 
8899  case value_t::boolean:
8900  {
8901  if (add_prefix)
8902  {
8903  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean
8904  ? to_char_type('T')
8905  : to_char_type('F'));
8906  }
8907  break;
8908  }
8909 
8910  case value_t::number_integer:
8911  {
8912  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.number_integer, add_prefix);
8913  break;
8914  }
8915 
8916  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8917  {
8918  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.number_unsigned, add_prefix);
8919  break;
8920  }
8921 
8922  case value_t::number_float:
8923  {
8924  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.number_float, add_prefix);
8925  break;
8926  }
8927 
8928  case value_t::string:
8929  {
8930  if (add_prefix)
8931  {
8932  oa->write_character(to_char_type('S'));
8933  }
8934  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.string->size(), true);
8935  oa->write_characters(
8936  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
8937  j.m_value.string->size());
8938  break;
8939  }
8940 
8941  case value_t::array:
8942  {
8943  if (add_prefix)
8944  {
8945  oa->write_character(to_char_type('['));
8946  }
8947 
8948  bool prefix_required = true;
8949  if (use_type and not j.m_value.array->empty())
8950  {
8951  assert(use_count);
8952  const CharType first_prefix = ubjson_prefix(j.front());
8953  const bool same_prefix = std::all_of(j.begin() + 1, j.end(),
8954  [this, first_prefix](const BasicJsonType & v)
8955  {
8956  return ubjson_prefix(v) == first_prefix;
8957  });
8958 
8959  if (same_prefix)
8960  {
8961  prefix_required = false;
8962  oa->write_character(to_char_type('$'));
8963  oa->write_character(first_prefix);
8964  }
8965  }
8966 
8967  if (use_count)
8968  {
8969  oa->write_character(to_char_type('#'));
8970  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.array->size(), true);
8971  }
8972 
8973  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
8974  {
8975  write_ubjson(el, use_count, use_type, prefix_required);
8976  }
8977 
8978  if (not use_count)
8979  {
8980  oa->write_character(to_char_type(']'));
8981  }
8982 
8983  break;
8984  }
8985 
8986  case value_t::object:
8987  {
8988  if (add_prefix)
8989  {
8990  oa->write_character(to_char_type('{'));
8991  }
8992 
8993  bool prefix_required = true;
8994  if (use_type and not j.m_value.object->empty())
8995  {
8996  assert(use_count);
8997  const CharType first_prefix = ubjson_prefix(j.front());
8998  const bool same_prefix = std::all_of(j.begin(), j.end(),
8999  [this, first_prefix](const BasicJsonType & v)
9000  {
9001  return ubjson_prefix(v) == first_prefix;
9002  });
9003 
9004  if (same_prefix)
9005  {
9006  prefix_required = false;
9007  oa->write_character(to_char_type('$'));
9008  oa->write_character(first_prefix);
9009  }
9010  }
9011 
9012  if (use_count)
9013  {
9014  oa->write_character(to_char_type('#'));
9015  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.object->size(), true);
9016  }
9017 
9018  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
9019  {
9020  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(el.first.size(), true);
9021  oa->write_characters(
9022  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(el.first.c_str()),
9023  el.first.size());
9024  write_ubjson(el.second, use_count, use_type, prefix_required);
9025  }
9026 
9027  if (not use_count)
9028  {
9029  oa->write_character(to_char_type('}'));
9030  }
9031 
9032  break;
9033  }
9034 
9035  default:
9036  break;
9037  }
9038  }
9039 
9040  private:
9042  // BSON //
9044 
9049  static std::size_t calc_bson_entry_header_size(const string_t& name)
9050  {
9051  const auto it = name.find(static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0));
9052  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(it != BasicJsonType::string_t::npos))
9053  {
9054  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(409,
9055  "BSON key cannot contain code point U+0000 (at byte " + std::to_string(it) + ")"));
9056  }
9057 
9058  return /*id*/ 1ul + name.size() + /*zero-terminator*/1u;
9059  }
9060 
9064  void write_bson_entry_header(const string_t& name,
9065  const std::uint8_t element_type)
9066  {
9067  oa->write_character(to_char_type(element_type)); // boolean
9068  oa->write_characters(
9069  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(name.c_str()),
9070  name.size() + 1u);
9071  }
9072 
9076  void write_bson_boolean(const string_t& name,
9077  const bool value)
9078  {
9079  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x08);
9080  oa->write_character(value ? to_char_type(0x01) : to_char_type(0x00));
9081  }
9082 
9086  void write_bson_double(const string_t& name,
9087  const double value)
9088  {
9089  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x01);
9090  write_number<double, true>(value);
9091  }
9092 
9096  static std::size_t calc_bson_string_size(const string_t& value)
9097  {
9098  return sizeof(std::int32_t) + value.size() + 1ul;
9099  }
9100 
9104  void write_bson_string(const string_t& name,
9105  const string_t& value)
9106  {
9107  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x02);
9108 
9109  write_number<std::int32_t, true>(static_cast<std::int32_t>(value.size() + 1ul));
9110  oa->write_characters(
9111  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(value.c_str()),
9112  value.size() + 1);
9113  }
9114 
9118  void write_bson_null(const string_t& name)
9119  {
9120  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x0A);
9121  }
9122 
9126  static std::size_t calc_bson_integer_size(const std::int64_t value)
9127  {
9128  if ((std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::min)() <= value and value <= (std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::max)())
9129  {
9130  return sizeof(std::int32_t);
9131  }
9132  else
9133  {
9134  return sizeof(std::int64_t);
9135  }
9136  }
9137 
9141  void write_bson_integer(const string_t& name,
9142  const std::int64_t value)
9143  {
9144  if ((std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::min)() <= value and value <= (std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::max)())
9145  {
9146  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x10); // int32
9147  write_number<std::int32_t, true>(static_cast<std::int32_t>(value));
9148  }
9149  else
9150  {
9151  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x12); // int64
9152  write_number<std::int64_t, true>(static_cast<std::int64_t>(value));
9153  }
9154  }
9155 
9159  static constexpr std::size_t calc_bson_unsigned_size(const std::uint64_t value) noexcept
9160  {
9161  return (value <= static_cast<std::uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::max)()))
9162  ? sizeof(std::int32_t)
9163  : sizeof(std::int64_t);
9164  }
9165 
9169  void write_bson_unsigned(const string_t& name,
9170  const std::uint64_t value)
9171  {
9172  if (value <= static_cast<std::uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::max)()))
9173  {
9174  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x10 /* int32 */);
9175  write_number<std::int32_t, true>(static_cast<std::int32_t>(value));
9176  }
9177  else if (value <= static_cast<std::uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<std::int64_t>::max)()))
9178  {
9179  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x12 /* int64 */);
9180  write_number<std::int64_t, true>(static_cast<std::int64_t>(value));
9181  }
9182  else
9183  {
9184  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(407, "integer number " + std::to_string(value) + " cannot be represented by BSON as it does not fit int64"));
9185  }
9186  }
9187 
9191  void write_bson_object_entry(const string_t& name,
9192  const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& value)
9193  {
9194  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x03); // object
9195  write_bson_object(value);
9196  }
9197 
9201  static std::size_t calc_bson_array_size(const typename BasicJsonType::array_t& value)
9202  {
9203  std::size_t embedded_document_size = 0ul;
9204  std::size_t array_index = 0ul;
9205 
9206  for (const auto& el : value)
9207  {
9208  embedded_document_size += calc_bson_element_size(std::to_string(array_index++), el);
9209  }
9210 
9211  return sizeof(std::int32_t) + embedded_document_size + 1ul;
9212  }
9213 
9217  void write_bson_array(const string_t& name,
9218  const typename BasicJsonType::array_t& value)
9219  {
9220  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x04); // array
9221  write_number<std::int32_t, true>(static_cast<std::int32_t>(calc_bson_array_size(value)));
9222 
9223  std::size_t array_index = 0ul;
9224 
9225  for (const auto& el : value)
9226  {
9227  write_bson_element(std::to_string(array_index++), el);
9228  }
9229 
9230  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x00));
9231  }
9232 
9237  static std::size_t calc_bson_element_size(const string_t& name,
9238  const BasicJsonType& j)
9239  {
9240  const auto header_size = calc_bson_entry_header_size(name);
9241  switch (j.type())
9242  {
9243  case value_t::object:
9244  return header_size + calc_bson_object_size(*j.m_value.object);
9245 
9246  case value_t::array:
9247  return header_size + calc_bson_array_size(*j.m_value.array);
9248 
9249  case value_t::boolean:
9250  return header_size + 1ul;
9251 
9252  case value_t::number_float:
9253  return header_size + 8ul;
9254 
9255  case value_t::number_integer:
9256  return header_size + calc_bson_integer_size(j.m_value.number_integer);
9257 
9258  case value_t::number_unsigned:
9259  return header_size + calc_bson_unsigned_size(j.m_value.number_unsigned);
9260 
9261  case value_t::string:
9262  return header_size + calc_bson_string_size(*j.m_value.string);
9263 
9264  case value_t::null:
9265  return header_size + 0ul;
9266 
9267  // LCOV_EXCL_START
9268  default:
9269  assert(false);
9270  return 0ul;
9271  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
9272  };
9273  }
9274 
9282  void write_bson_element(const string_t& name,
9283  const BasicJsonType& j)
9284  {
9285  switch (j.type())
9286  {
9287  case value_t::object:
9288  return write_bson_object_entry(name, *j.m_value.object);
9289 
9290  case value_t::array:
9291  return write_bson_array(name, *j.m_value.array);
9292 
9293  case value_t::boolean:
9294  return write_bson_boolean(name, j.m_value.boolean);
9295 
9296  case value_t::number_float:
9297  return write_bson_double(name, j.m_value.number_float);
9298 
9299  case value_t::number_integer:
9300  return write_bson_integer(name, j.m_value.number_integer);
9301 
9302  case value_t::number_unsigned:
9303  return write_bson_unsigned(name, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
9304 
9305  case value_t::string:
9306  return write_bson_string(name, *j.m_value.string);
9307 
9308  case value_t::null:
9309  return write_bson_null(name);
9310 
9311  // LCOV_EXCL_START
9312  default:
9313  assert(false);
9314  return;
9315  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
9316  };
9317  }
9318 
9325  static std::size_t calc_bson_object_size(const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& value)
9326  {
9327  std::size_t document_size = std::accumulate(value.begin(), value.end(), 0ul,
9328  [](size_t result, const typename BasicJsonType::object_t::value_type & el)
9329  {
9330  return result += calc_bson_element_size(el.first, el.second);
9331  });
9332 
9333  return sizeof(std::int32_t) + document_size + 1ul;
9334  }
9335 
9340  void write_bson_object(const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& value)
9341  {
9342  write_number<std::int32_t, true>(static_cast<std::int32_t>(calc_bson_object_size(value)));
9343 
9344  for (const auto& el : value)
9345  {
9346  write_bson_element(el.first, el.second);
9347  }
9348 
9349  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x00));
9350  }
9351 
9353  // CBOR //
9355 
9356  static constexpr CharType get_cbor_float_prefix(float /*unused*/)
9357  {
9358  return to_char_type(0xFA); // Single-Precision Float
9359  }
9360 
9361  static constexpr CharType get_cbor_float_prefix(double /*unused*/)
9362  {
9363  return to_char_type(0xFB); // Double-Precision Float
9364  }
9365 
9367  // MsgPack //
9369 
9370  static constexpr CharType get_msgpack_float_prefix(float /*unused*/)
9371  {
9372  return to_char_type(0xCA); // float 32
9373  }
9374 
9375  static constexpr CharType get_msgpack_float_prefix(double /*unused*/)
9376  {
9377  return to_char_type(0xCB); // float 64
9378  }
9379 
9381  // UBJSON //
9383 
9384  // UBJSON: write number (floating point)
9385  template<typename NumberType, typename std::enable_if<
9386  std::is_floating_point<NumberType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9387  void write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(const NumberType n,
9388  const bool add_prefix)
9389  {
9390  if (add_prefix)
9391  {
9392  oa->write_character(get_ubjson_float_prefix(n));
9393  }
9394  write_number(n);
9395  }
9396 
9397  // UBJSON: write number (unsigned integer)
9398  template<typename NumberType, typename std::enable_if<
9399  std::is_unsigned<NumberType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9400  void write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(const NumberType n,
9401  const bool add_prefix)
9402  {
9403  if (n <= static_cast<uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)()))
9404  {
9405  if (add_prefix)
9406  {
9407  oa->write_character(to_char_type('i')); // int8
9408  }
9409  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(n));
9410  }
9411  else if (n <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
9412  {
9413  if (add_prefix)
9414  {
9415  oa->write_character(to_char_type('U')); // uint8
9416  }
9417  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(n));
9418  }
9419  else if (n <= static_cast<uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)()))
9420  {
9421  if (add_prefix)
9422  {
9423  oa->write_character(to_char_type('I')); // int16
9424  }
9425  write_number(static_cast<int16_t>(n));
9426  }
9427  else if (n <= static_cast<uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)()))
9428  {
9429  if (add_prefix)
9430  {
9431  oa->write_character(to_char_type('l')); // int32
9432  }
9433  write_number(static_cast<int32_t>(n));
9434  }
9435  else if (n <= static_cast<uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max)()))
9436  {
9437  if (add_prefix)
9438  {
9439  oa->write_character(to_char_type('L')); // int64
9440  }
9441  write_number(static_cast<int64_t>(n));
9442  }
9443  else
9444  {
9445  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(407, "integer number " + std::to_string(n) + " cannot be represented by UBJSON as it does not fit int64"));
9446  }
9447  }
9448 
9449  // UBJSON: write number (signed integer)
9450  template<typename NumberType, typename std::enable_if<
9451  std::is_signed<NumberType>::value and
9452  not std::is_floating_point<NumberType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9453  void write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(const NumberType n,
9454  const bool add_prefix)
9455  {
9456  if ((std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::min)() <= n and n <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)())
9457  {
9458  if (add_prefix)
9459  {
9460  oa->write_character(to_char_type('i')); // int8
9461  }
9462  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(n));
9463  }
9464  else if (static_cast<int64_t>((std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::min)()) <= n and n <= static_cast<int64_t>((std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)()))
9465  {
9466  if (add_prefix)
9467  {
9468  oa->write_character(to_char_type('U')); // uint8
9469  }
9470  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(n));
9471  }
9472  else if ((std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::min)() <= n and n <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)())
9473  {
9474  if (add_prefix)
9475  {
9476  oa->write_character(to_char_type('I')); // int16
9477  }
9478  write_number(static_cast<int16_t>(n));
9479  }
9480  else if ((std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min)() <= n and n <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)())
9481  {
9482  if (add_prefix)
9483  {
9484  oa->write_character(to_char_type('l')); // int32
9485  }
9486  write_number(static_cast<int32_t>(n));
9487  }
9488  else if ((std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min)() <= n and n <= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max)())
9489  {
9490  if (add_prefix)
9491  {
9492  oa->write_character(to_char_type('L')); // int64
9493  }
9494  write_number(static_cast<int64_t>(n));
9495  }
9496  // LCOV_EXCL_START
9497  else
9498  {
9499  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(407, "integer number " + std::to_string(n) + " cannot be represented by UBJSON as it does not fit int64"));
9500  }
9501  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
9502  }
9503 
9513  CharType ubjson_prefix(const BasicJsonType& j) const noexcept
9514  {
9515  switch (j.type())
9516  {
9517  case value_t::null:
9518  return 'Z';
9519 
9520  case value_t::boolean:
9521  return j.m_value.boolean ? 'T' : 'F';
9522 
9523  case value_t::number_integer:
9524  {
9525  if ((std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::min)() <= j.m_value.number_integer and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)())
9526  {
9527  return 'i';
9528  }
9529  if ((std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::min)() <= j.m_value.number_integer and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
9530  {
9531  return 'U';
9532  }
9533  if ((std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::min)() <= j.m_value.number_integer and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)())
9534  {
9535  return 'I';
9536  }
9537  if ((std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min)() <= j.m_value.number_integer and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)())
9538  {
9539  return 'l';
9540  }
9541  // no check and assume int64_t (see note above)
9542  return 'L';
9543  }
9544 
9545  case value_t::number_unsigned:
9546  {
9547  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)())
9548  {
9549  return 'i';
9550  }
9551  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
9552  {
9553  return 'U';
9554  }
9555  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)())
9556  {
9557  return 'I';
9558  }
9559  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)())
9560  {
9561  return 'l';
9562  }
9563  // no check and assume int64_t (see note above)
9564  return 'L';
9565  }
9566 
9567  case value_t::number_float:
9568  return get_ubjson_float_prefix(j.m_value.number_float);
9569 
9570  case value_t::string:
9571  return 'S';
9572 
9573  case value_t::array:
9574  return '[';
9575 
9576  case value_t::object:
9577  return '{';
9578 
9579  default: // discarded values
9580  return 'N';
9581  }
9582  }
9583 
9584  static constexpr CharType get_ubjson_float_prefix(float /*unused*/)
9585  {
9586  return 'd'; // float 32
9587  }
9588 
9589  static constexpr CharType get_ubjson_float_prefix(double /*unused*/)
9590  {
9591  return 'D'; // float 64
9592  }
9593 
9595  // Utility functions //
9597 
9598  /*
9599  @brief write a number to output input
9600  @param[in] n number of type @a NumberType
9601  @tparam NumberType the type of the number
9602  @tparam OutputIsLittleEndian Set to true if output data is
9603  required to be little endian
9604 
9605  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because bytes
9606  in CBOR, MessagePack, and UBJSON are stored in network order (big
9607  endian) and therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
9608  */
9609  template<typename NumberType, bool OutputIsLittleEndian = false>
9610  void write_number(const NumberType n)
9611  {
9612  // step 1: write number to array of length NumberType
9613  std::array<CharType, sizeof(NumberType)> vec;
9614  //std::memcpy(vec.data(), &n, sizeof(NumberType));
9615  std::copy((uint8_t *)&n, (uint8_t *)&n + sizeof(NumberType), (uint8_t *)vec.data());
9616 
9617  // step 2: write array to output (with possible reordering)
9618  if (is_little_endian and not OutputIsLittleEndian)
9619  {
9620  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
9621  std::reverse(vec.begin(), vec.end());
9622  }
9623 
9624  oa->write_characters(vec.data(), sizeof(NumberType));
9625  }
9626 
9627  public:
9628  // The following to_char_type functions are implement the conversion
9629  // between uint8_t and CharType. In case CharType is not unsigned,
9630  // such a conversion is required to allow values greater than 128.
9631  // See <https://github.com/nlohmann/json/issues/1286> for a discussion.
9632  template < typename C = CharType,
9633  enable_if_t < std::is_signed<C>::value and std::is_signed<char>::value > * = nullptr >
9634  static constexpr CharType to_char_type(std::uint8_t x) noexcept
9635  {
9636  return *reinterpret_cast<char*>(&x);
9637  }
9638 
9639  template < typename C = CharType,
9640  enable_if_t < std::is_signed<C>::value and std::is_unsigned<char>::value > * = nullptr >
9641  static CharType to_char_type(std::uint8_t x) noexcept
9642  {
9643  static_assert(sizeof(std::uint8_t) == sizeof(CharType), "size of CharType must be equal to std::uint8_t");
9644  static_assert(std::is_pod<CharType>::value, "CharType must be POD");
9645  CharType result;
9646  //std::memcpy(&result, &x, sizeof(x));
9647  std::copy(&x, &x + sizeof(x), (uint8_t *)&result);
9648  return result;
9649  }
9650 
9651  template<typename C = CharType,
9652  enable_if_t<std::is_unsigned<C>::value>* = nullptr>
9653  static constexpr CharType to_char_type(std::uint8_t x) noexcept
9654  {
9655  return x;
9656  }
9657 
9658  template < typename InputCharType, typename C = CharType,
9659  enable_if_t <
9660  std::is_signed<C>::value and
9661  std::is_signed<char>::value and
9662  std::is_same<char, typename std::remove_cv<InputCharType>::type>::value
9663  > * = nullptr >
9664  static constexpr CharType to_char_type(InputCharType x) noexcept
9665  {
9666  return x;
9667  }
9668 
9669  private:
9671  const bool is_little_endian = binary_reader<BasicJsonType>::little_endianess();
9672 
9674  output_adapter_t<CharType> oa = nullptr;
9675 };
9676 } // namespace detail
9677 } // namespace json
9678 
9679 // #include <nlohmann/detail/output/serializer.hpp>
9680 
9681 
9682 #include <algorithm> // reverse, remove, fill, find, none_of
9683 #include <array> // array
9684 #include <cassert> // assert
9685 #include <ciso646> // and, or
9686 #include <clocale> // localeconv, lconv
9687 #include <cmath> // labs, isfinite, isnan, signbit
9688 #include <cstddef> // size_t, ptrdiff_t
9689 #include <cstdint> // uint8_t
9690 #include <cstdio> // snprintf
9691 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
9692 #include <string> // string
9693 #include <type_traits> // is_same
9694 
9695 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
9696 
9697 // #include <nlohmann/detail/conversions/to_chars.hpp>
9698 
9699 
9700 #include <cassert> // assert
9701 #include <ciso646> // or, and, not
9702 #include <cmath> // signbit, isfinite
9703 #include <cstdint> // intN_t, uintN_t
9704 #include <cstring> // memcpy, memmove
9705 
9706 namespace json
9707 {
9708 namespace detail
9709 {
9710 
9730 namespace dtoa_impl
9731 {
9732 
9733 template <typename Target, typename Source>
9734 Target reinterpret_bits(const Source source)
9735 {
9736  static_assert(sizeof(Target) == sizeof(Source), "size mismatch");
9737 
9738  Target target;
9739  //std::memcpy(&target, &source, sizeof(Source));
9740  std::copy((uint8_t *)&source, (uint8_t *)&source + sizeof(Source), (uint8_t *)&target);
9741  return target;
9742 }
9743 
9744 struct diyfp // f * 2^e
9745 {
9746  static constexpr int kPrecision = 64; // = q
9747 
9748  uint64_t f = 0;
9749  int e = 0;
9750 
9751  constexpr diyfp(uint64_t f_, int e_) noexcept : f(f_), e(e_) {}
9752 
9757  static diyfp sub(const diyfp& x, const diyfp& y) noexcept
9758  {
9759  assert(x.e == y.e);
9760  assert(x.f >= y.f);
9761 
9762  return {x.f - y.f, x.e};
9763  }
9764 
9769  static diyfp mul(const diyfp& x, const diyfp& y) noexcept
9770  {
9771  static_assert(kPrecision == 64, "internal error");
9772 
9773  // Computes:
9774  // f = round((x.f * y.f) / 2^q)
9775  // e = x.e + y.e + q
9776 
9777  // Emulate the 64-bit * 64-bit multiplication:
9778  //
9779  // p = u * v
9780  // = (u_lo + 2^32 u_hi) (v_lo + 2^32 v_hi)
9781  // = (u_lo v_lo ) + 2^32 ((u_lo v_hi ) + (u_hi v_lo )) + 2^64 (u_hi v_hi )
9782  // = (p0 ) + 2^32 ((p1 ) + (p2 )) + 2^64 (p3 )
9783  // = (p0_lo + 2^32 p0_hi) + 2^32 ((p1_lo + 2^32 p1_hi) + (p2_lo + 2^32 p2_hi)) + 2^64 (p3 )
9784  // = (p0_lo ) + 2^32 (p0_hi + p1_lo + p2_lo ) + 2^64 (p1_hi + p2_hi + p3)
9785  // = (p0_lo ) + 2^32 (Q ) + 2^64 (H )
9786  // = (p0_lo ) + 2^32 (Q_lo + 2^32 Q_hi ) + 2^64 (H )
9787  //
9788  // (Since Q might be larger than 2^32 - 1)
9789  //
9790  // = (p0_lo + 2^32 Q_lo) + 2^64 (Q_hi + H)
9791  //
