12567  static allocator_type get_allocator()
12568  {
12569  return allocator_type();
12570  }
12571 
12598  static basic_json meta()
12599  {
12600  basic_json result;
12601 
12602  result["copyright"] = "(C) 2013-2017 Niels Lohmann";
12603  result["name"] = "JSON for Modern C++";
12604  result["url"] = "https://github.com/nlohmann/json";
12605  result["version"]["string"] =
12606  std::to_string(NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_MAJOR) + "." +
12607  std::to_string(NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_MINOR) + "." +
12608  std::to_string(NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_PATCH);
12609  result["version"]["major"] = NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_MAJOR;
12610  result["version"]["minor"] = NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_MINOR;
12611  result["version"]["patch"] = NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_PATCH;
12612 
12613 #ifdef _WIN32
12614  result["platform"] = "win32";
12615 #elif defined __linux__
12616  result["platform"] = "linux";
12617 #elif defined __APPLE__
12618  result["platform"] = "apple";
12619 #elif defined __unix__
12620  result["platform"] = "unix";
12621 #else
12622  result["platform"] = "unknown";
12623 #endif
12624 
12625 #if defined(__ICC) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
12626  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "icc"}, {"version", __INTEL_COMPILER}};
12627 #elif defined(__clang__)
12628  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "clang"}, {"version", __clang_version__}};
12629 #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
12630  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "gcc"}, {"version", std::to_string(__GNUC__) + "." + std::to_string(__GNUC_MINOR__) + "." + std::to_string(__GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)}};
12631 #elif defined(__HP_cc) || defined(__HP_aCC)
12632  result["compiler"] = "hp"
12633 #elif defined(__IBMCPP__)
12634  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "ilecpp"}, {"version", __IBMCPP__}};
12635 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
12636  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "msvc"}, {"version", _MSC_VER}};
12637 #elif defined(__PGI)
12638  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "pgcpp"}, {"version", __PGI}};
12639 #elif defined(__SUNPRO_CC)
12640  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "sunpro"}, {"version", __SUNPRO_CC}};
12641 #else
12642  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "unknown"}, {"version", "unknown"}};
12643 #endif
12644 
12645 #ifdef __cplusplus
12646  result["compiler"]["c++"] = std::to_string(__cplusplus);
12647 #else
12648  result["compiler"]["c++"] = "unknown";
12649 #endif
12650  return result;
12651  }
12652 
12653 
12655  // JSON value data types //
12657 
12662 
12663 #if defined(JSON_HAS_CPP_14)
12664  // Use transparent comparator if possible, combined with perfect forwarding
12665  // on find() and count() calls prevents unnecessary string construction.
12666  using object_comparator_t = std::less<>;
12667 #else
12668  using object_comparator_t = std::less<StringType>;
12669 #endif
12670 
12754  using object_t = ObjectType<StringType,
12755  basic_json,
12756  object_comparator_t,
12757  AllocatorType<std::pair<const StringType,
12758  basic_json>>>;
12759 
12804  using array_t = ArrayType<basic_json, AllocatorType<basic_json>>;
12805 
12857  using string_t = StringType;
12858 
12883  using boolean_t = BooleanType;
12884 
12955  using number_integer_t = NumberIntegerType;
12956 
13026  using number_unsigned_t = NumberUnsignedType;
13027 
13094  using number_float_t = NumberFloatType;
13095 
13097 
13098  private:
13099 
13101  template<typename T, typename... Args>
13102  static T* create(Args&& ... args)
13103  {
13104  AllocatorType<T> alloc;
13105  using AllocatorTraits = std::allocator_traits<AllocatorType<T>>;
13106 
13107  auto deleter = [&](T * object)
13108  {
13109  AllocatorTraits::deallocate(alloc, object, 1);
13110  };
13111  std::unique_ptr<T, decltype(deleter)> object(AllocatorTraits::allocate(alloc, 1), deleter);
13112  AllocatorTraits::construct(alloc, object.get(), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
13113  assert(object != nullptr);
13114  return object.release();
13115  }
13116 
13118  // JSON value storage //
13120 
13145  union json_value
13146  {
13148  object_t* object;
13150  array_t* array;
13152  string_t* string;
13154  boolean_t boolean;
13156  number_integer_t number_integer;
13158  number_unsigned_t number_unsigned;
13160  number_float_t number_float;
13161 
13163  json_value() = default;
13165  json_value(boolean_t v) noexcept : boolean(v) {}
13167  json_value(number_integer_t v) noexcept : number_integer(v) {}
13169  json_value(number_unsigned_t v) noexcept : number_unsigned(v) {}
13171  json_value(number_float_t v) noexcept : number_float(v) {}
13173  json_value(value_t t)
13174  {
13175  switch (t)
13176  {
13177  case value_t::object:
13178  {
13179  object = create<object_t>();
13180  break;
13181  }
13182 
13183  case value_t::array:
13184  {
13185  array = create<array_t>();
13186  break;
13187  }
13188 
13189  case value_t::string:
13190  {
13191  string = create<string_t>("");
13192  break;
13193  }
13194 
13195  case value_t::boolean:
13196  {
13197  boolean = boolean_t(false);
13198  break;
13199  }
13200 
13201  case value_t::number_integer:
13202  {
13203  number_integer = number_integer_t(0);
13204  break;
13205  }
13206 
13207  case value_t::number_unsigned:
13208  {
13209  number_unsigned = number_unsigned_t(0);
13210  break;
13211  }
13212 
13213  case value_t::number_float:
13214  {
13215  number_float = number_float_t(0.0);
13216  break;
13217  }
13218 
13219  case value_t::null:
13220  {
13221  object = nullptr; // silence warning, see #821
13222  break;
13223  }
13224 
13225  default:
13226  {
13227  object = nullptr; // silence warning, see #821
13228  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(t == value_t::null))
13229  {
13230  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(500, "961c151d2e87f2686a955a9be24d316f1362bf21 3.4.0")); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
13231  }
13232  break;
13233  }
13234  }
13235  }
13236 
13238  json_value(const string_t& value)
13239  {
13240  string = create<string_t>(value);
13241  }
13242 
13244  json_value(string_t&& value)
13245  {
13246  string = create<string_t>(std::move(value));
13247  }
13248 
13250  json_value(const object_t& value)
13251  {
13252  object = create<object_t>(value);
13253  }
13254 
13256  json_value(object_t&& value)
13257  {
13258  object = create<object_t>(std::move(value));
13259  }
13260 
13262  json_value(const array_t& value)
13263  {
13264  array = create<array_t>(value);
13265  }
13266 
13268  json_value(array_t&& value)
13269  {
13270  array = create<array_t>(std::move(value));
13271  }
13272 
13273  void destroy(value_t t) noexcept
13274  {
13275  switch (t)
13276  {
13277  case value_t::object:
13278  {
13279  AllocatorType<object_t> alloc;
13280  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::destroy(alloc, object);
13281  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::deallocate(alloc, object, 1);
13282  break;
13283  }
13284 
13285  case value_t::array:
13286  {
13287  AllocatorType<array_t> alloc;
13288  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::destroy(alloc, array);
13289  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::deallocate(alloc, array, 1);
13290  break;
13291  }
13292 
13293  case value_t::string:
13294  {
13295  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
13296  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::destroy(alloc, string);
13297  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::deallocate(alloc, string, 1);
13298  break;
13299  }
13300 
13301  default:
13302  {
13303  break;
13304  }
13305  }
13306  }
13307  };
13308 
13318  void assert_invariant() const noexcept
13319  {
13320  assert(m_type != value_t::object or m_value.object != nullptr);
13321  assert(m_type != value_t::array or m_value.array != nullptr);
13322  assert(m_type != value_t::string or m_value.string != nullptr);
13323  }
13324 
13325  public:
13327  // JSON parser callback //
13329 
13345  using parse_event_t = typename parser::parse_event_t;
13346 
13396  using parser_callback_t = typename parser::parser_callback_t;
13397 
13399  // constructors //
13401 
13406 
13436  basic_json(const value_t v)
13437  : m_type(v), m_value(v)
13438  {
13439  assert_invariant();
13440  }
13441 
13460  basic_json(std::nullptr_t = nullptr) noexcept
13461  : basic_json(value_t::null)
13462  {
13463  assert_invariant();
13464  }
13465 
13523  template <typename CompatibleType,
13524  typename U = detail::uncvref_t<CompatibleType>,
13525  detail::enable_if_t<
13526  not detail::is_basic_json<U>::value and detail::is_compatible_type<basic_json_t, U>::value, int> = 0>
13527  basic_json(CompatibleType && val) noexcept(noexcept(
13528  JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(std::declval<basic_json_t&>(),
13529  std::forward<CompatibleType>(val))))
13530  {
13531  JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(*this, std::forward<CompatibleType>(val));
13532  assert_invariant();
13533  }
13534 
13561  template <typename BasicJsonType,
13562  detail::enable_if_t<
13563  detail::is_basic_json<BasicJsonType>::value and not std::is_same<basic_json, BasicJsonType>::value, int> = 0>
13564  basic_json(const BasicJsonType& val)
13565  {
13566  using other_boolean_t = typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t;
13567  using other_number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
13568  using other_number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
13569  using other_number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
13570  using other_string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
13571  using other_object_t = typename BasicJsonType::object_t;
13572  using other_array_t = typename BasicJsonType::array_t;
13573 
13574  switch (val.type())
13575  {
13576  case value_t::boolean:
13577  JSONSerializer<other_boolean_t>::to_json(*this, val.template get<other_boolean_t>());
13578  break;
13579  case value_t::number_float:
13580  JSONSerializer<other_number_float_t>::to_json(*this, val.template get<other_number_float_t>());
13581  break;
13582  case value_t::number_integer:
13583  JSONSerializer<other_number_integer_t>::to_json(*this, val.template get<other_number_integer_t>());
13584  break;
13585  case value_t::number_unsigned:
13586  JSONSerializer<other_number_unsigned_t>::to_json(*this, val.template get<other_number_unsigned_t>());
13587  break;
13588  case value_t::string:
13589  JSONSerializer<other_string_t>::to_json(*this, val.template get_ref<const other_string_t&>());
13590  break;
13591  case value_t::object:
13592  JSONSerializer<other_object_t>::to_json(*this, val.template get_ref<const other_object_t&>());
13593  break;
13594  case value_t::array:
13595  JSONSerializer<other_array_t>::to_json(*this, val.template get_ref<const other_array_t&>());
13596  break;
13597  case value_t::null:
13598  *this = nullptr;
13599  break;
13600  case value_t::discarded:
13601  m_type = value_t::discarded;
13602  break;
13603  }
13604  assert_invariant();
13605  }
13606 
13681  basic_json(initializer_list_t init,
13682  bool type_deduction = true,
13683  value_t manual_type = value_t::array)
13684  {
13685  // check if each element is an array with two elements whose first
13686  // element is a string
13687  bool is_an_object = std::all_of(init.begin(), init.end(),
13688  [](const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& element_ref)
13689  {
13690  return (element_ref->is_array() and element_ref->size() == 2 and (*element_ref)[0].is_string());
13691  });
13692 
13693  // adjust type if type deduction is not wanted
13694  if (not type_deduction)
13695  {
13696  // if array is wanted, do not create an object though possible
13697  if (manual_type == value_t::array)
13698  {
13699  is_an_object = false;
13700  }
13701 
13702  // if object is wanted but impossible, throw an exception
13703  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(manual_type == value_t::object and not is_an_object))
13704  {
13705  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(301, "cannot create object from initializer list"));
13706  }
13707  }
13708 
13709  if (is_an_object)
13710  {
13711  // the initializer list is a list of pairs -> create object
13712  m_type = value_t::object;
13713  m_value = value_t::object;
13714 
13715  std::for_each(init.begin(), init.end(), [this](const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& element_ref)
13716  {
13717  auto element = element_ref.moved_or_copied();
13718  m_value.object->emplace(
13719  std::move(*((*element.m_value.array)[0].m_value.string)),
13720  std::move((*element.m_value.array)[1]));
13721  });
13722  }
13723  else
13724  {
13725  // the initializer list describes an array -> create array
13726  m_type = value_t::array;
13727  m_value.array = create<array_t>(init.begin(), init.end());
13728  }
13729 
13730  assert_invariant();
13731  }
13732 
13770  static basic_json array(initializer_list_t init = {})
13771  {
13772  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::array);
13773  }
13774 
13813  static basic_json object(initializer_list_t init = {})
13814  {
13815  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::object);
13816  }
13817 
13840  basic_json(size_type cnt, const basic_json& val)
13841  : m_type(value_t::array)
13842  {
13843  m_value.array = create<array_t>(cnt, val);
13844  assert_invariant();
13845  }
13846 
13902  template<class InputIT, typename std::enable_if<
13903  std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
13904  std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type = 0>
13905  basic_json(InputIT first, InputIT last)
13906  {
13907  assert(first.m_object != nullptr);
13908  assert(last.m_object != nullptr);
13909 
13910  // make sure iterator fits the current value
13911  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
13912  {
13913  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(201, "iterators are not compatible"));
13914  }
13915 
13916  // copy type from first iterator
13917  m_type = first.m_object->m_type;
13918 
13919  // check if iterator range is complete for primitive values
13920  switch (m_type)
13921  {
13922  case value_t::boolean:
13923  case value_t::number_float:
13924  case value_t::number_integer:
13925  case value_t::number_unsigned:
13926  case value_t::string:
13927  {
13928  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()
13929  or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end()))
13930  {
13931  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
13932  }
13933  break;
13934  }
13935 
13936  default:
13937  break;
13938  }
13939 
13940  switch (m_type)
13941  {
13942  case value_t::number_integer:
13943  {
13944  m_value.number_integer = first.m_object->m_value.number_integer;
13945  break;
13946  }
13947 
13948  case value_t::number_unsigned:
13949  {
13950  m_value.number_unsigned = first.m_object->m_value.number_unsigned;
13951  break;
13952  }
13953 
13954  case value_t::number_float:
13955  {
13956  m_value.number_float = first.m_object->m_value.number_float;
13957  break;
13958  }
13959 
13960  case value_t::boolean:
13961  {
13962  m_value.boolean = first.m_object->m_value.boolean;
13963  break;
13964  }
13965 
13966  case value_t::string:
13967  {
13968  m_value = *first.m_object->m_value.string;
13969  break;
13970  }
13971 
13972  case value_t::object:
13973  {
13974  m_value.object = create<object_t>(first.m_it.object_iterator,
13975  last.m_it.object_iterator);
13976  break;
13977  }
13978 
13979  case value_t::array:
13980  {
13981  m_value.array = create<array_t>(first.m_it.array_iterator,
13982  last.m_it.array_iterator);
13983  break;
13984  }
13985 
13986  default:
13987  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(206, "cannot construct with iterators from " +
13988  std::string(first.m_object->type_name())));
13989  }
13990 
13991  assert_invariant();
13992  }
13993 
13994 
13996  // other constructors and destructor //
13998 
14000  basic_json(const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& ref)
14001  : basic_json(ref.moved_or_copied())
14002  {}
14003 
14029  basic_json(const basic_json& other)
14030  : m_type(other.m_type)
14031  {
14032  // check of passed value is valid
14033  other.assert_invariant();
14034 
14035  switch (m_type)
14036  {
14037  case value_t::object:
14038  {
14039  m_value = *other.m_value.object;
14040  break;
14041  }
14042 
14043  case value_t::array:
14044  {
14045  m_value = *other.m_value.array;
14046  break;
14047  }
14048 
14049  case value_t::string:
14050  {
14051  m_value = *other.m_value.string;
14052  break;
14053  }
14054 
14055  case value_t::boolean:
14056  {
14057  m_value = other.m_value.boolean;
14058  break;
14059  }
14060 
14061  case value_t::number_integer:
14062  {
14063  m_value = other.m_value.number_integer;
14064  break;
14065  }
14066 
14067  case value_t::number_unsigned:
14068  {
14069  m_value = other.m_value.number_unsigned;
14070  break;
14071  }
14072 
14073  case value_t::number_float:
14074  {
14075  m_value = other.m_value.number_float;
14076  break;
14077  }
14078 
14079  default:
14080  break;
14081  }
14082 
14083  assert_invariant();
14084  }
14085 
14112  basic_json(basic_json&& other) noexcept
14113  : m_type(std::move(other.m_type)),
14114  m_value(std::move(other.m_value))
14115  {
14116  // check that passed value is valid
14117  other.assert_invariant();
14118 
14119  // invalidate payload
14120  other.m_type = value_t::null;
14121  other.m_value = {};
14122 
14123  assert_invariant();
14124  }
14125 
14149  basic_json& operator=(basic_json other) noexcept (
14150  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and
14151  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
14152  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
14153  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value
14154  )
14155  {
14156  // check that passed value is valid
14157  other.assert_invariant();
14158 
14159  using std::swap;
14160  swap(m_type, other.m_type);
14161  swap(m_value, other.m_value);
14162 
14163  assert_invariant();
14164  return *this;
14165  }
14166 
14182  ~basic_json() noexcept
14183  {
14184  assert_invariant();
14185  m_value.destroy(m_type);
14186  }
14187 
14189 
14190  public:
14192  // object inspection //
14194 
14198 
14240  string_t dump(const int indent = -1,
14241  const char indent_char = ' ',
14242  const bool ensure_ascii = false,
14243  const error_handler_t error_handler = error_handler_t::strict) const
14244  {
14245  string_t result;
14246  serializer s(detail::output_adapter<char, string_t>(result), indent_char, error_handler);
14247 
14248  if (indent >= 0)
14249  {
14250  s.dump(*this, true, ensure_ascii, static_cast<unsigned int>(indent));
14251  }
14252  else
14253  {
14254  s.dump(*this, false, ensure_ascii, 0);
14255  }
14256 
14257  return result;
14258  }
14259 
14292  constexpr value_t type() const noexcept
14293  {
14294  return m_type;
14295  }
14296 
14322  constexpr bool is_primitive() const noexcept
14323  {
14324  return is_null() or is_string() or is_boolean() or is_number();
14325  }
14326 
14349  constexpr bool is_structured() const noexcept
14350  {
14351  return is_array() or is_object();
14352  }
14353 
14371  constexpr bool is_null() const noexcept
14372  {
14373  return (m_type == value_t::null);
14374  }
14375 
14393  constexpr bool is_boolean() const noexcept
14394  {
14395  return (m_type == value_t::boolean);
14396  }
14397 
14423  constexpr bool is_number() const noexcept
14424  {
14425  return is_number_integer() or is_number_float();
14426  }
14427 
14452  constexpr bool is_number_integer() const noexcept
14453  {
14454  return (m_type == value_t::number_integer or m_type == value_t::number_unsigned);
14455  }
14456 
14480  constexpr bool is_number_unsigned() const noexcept
14481  {
14482  return (m_type == value_t::number_unsigned);
14483  }
14484 
14508  constexpr bool is_number_float() const noexcept
14509  {
14510  return (m_type == value_t::number_float);
14511  }
14512 
14530  constexpr bool is_object() const noexcept
14531  {
14532  return (m_type == value_t::object);
14533  }
14534 
14552  constexpr bool is_array() const noexcept
14553  {
14554  return (m_type == value_t::array);
14555  }
14556 
14574  constexpr bool is_string() const noexcept
14575  {
14576  return (m_type == value_t::string);
14577  }
14578 
14601  constexpr bool is_discarded() const noexcept
14602  {
14603  return (m_type == value_t::discarded);
14604  }
14605 
14627  constexpr operator value_t() const noexcept
14628  {
14629  return m_type;
14630  }
14631 
14633 
14634  private:
14636  // value access //
14638 
14640  boolean_t get_impl(boolean_t* /*unused*/) const
14641  {
14642  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_boolean()))
14643  {
14644  return m_value.boolean;
14645  }
14646 
14647  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + std::string(type_name())));
14648  }
14649 
14651  object_t* get_impl_ptr(object_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
14652  {
14653  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
14654  }
14655 
14657  constexpr const object_t* get_impl_ptr(const object_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
14658  {
14659  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
14660  }
14661 
14663  array_t* get_impl_ptr(array_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
14664  {
14665  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
14666  }
14667 
14669  constexpr const array_t* get_impl_ptr(const array_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
14670  {
14671  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
14672  }
14673 
14675  string_t* get_impl_ptr(string_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
14676  {
14677  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
14678  }
14679 
14681  constexpr const string_t* get_impl_ptr(const string_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
14682  {
14683  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
14684  }
14685 
14687  boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(boolean_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
14688  {
14689  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
14690  }
14691 
14693  constexpr const boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(const boolean_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
14694  {
14695  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
14696  }
14697 
14699  number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(number_integer_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
14700  {
14701  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
14702  }
14703 
14705  constexpr const number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_integer_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
14706  {
14707  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
14708  }
14709 
14711  number_unsigned_t* get_impl_ptr(number_unsigned_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
14712  {
14713  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
14714  }
14715 
14717  constexpr const number_unsigned_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_unsigned_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
14718  {
14719  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
14720  }
14721 
14723  number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(number_float_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
14724  {
14725  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
14726  }
14727 
14729  constexpr const number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_float_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
14730  {
14731  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
14732  }
14733 
14745  template<typename ReferenceType, typename ThisType>
14746  static ReferenceType get_ref_impl(ThisType& obj)
14747  {
14748  // delegate the call to get_ptr<>()
14749  auto ptr = obj.template get_ptr<typename std::add_pointer<ReferenceType>::type>();
14750 
14751  if (JSON_LIKELY(ptr != nullptr))
14752  {
14753  return *ptr;
14754  }
14755 
14756  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(303, "incompatible ReferenceType for get_ref, actual type is " + std::string(obj.type_name())));
14757  }
14758 
14759  public:
14763 
14778  template<typename BasicJsonType, detail::enable_if_t<
14779  std::is_same<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type, basic_json_t>::value,
14780  int> = 0>
14781  basic_json get() const
14782  {
14783  return *this;
14784  }
14785 
14801  template<typename BasicJsonType, detail::enable_if_t<
14802  not std::is_same<BasicJsonType, basic_json>::value and
14803  detail::is_basic_json<BasicJsonType>::value, int> = 0>
14804  BasicJsonType get() const
14805  {
14806  return *this;
14807  }
14808 
14848  template<typename ValueTypeCV, typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
14849  detail::enable_if_t <
14850  not detail::is_basic_json<ValueType>::value and
14851  detail::has_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
14852  not detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value,
14853  int> = 0>
14854  ValueType get() const noexcept(noexcept(
14855  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>(), std::declval<ValueType&>())))
14856  {
14857  // we cannot static_assert on ValueTypeCV being non-const, because
14858  // there is support for get<const basic_json_t>(), which is why we
14859  // still need the uncvref
14860  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
14861  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
14862  static_assert(std::is_default_constructible<ValueType>::value,
14863  "types must be DefaultConstructible when used with get()");
14864 
14865  ValueType ret;
14866  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(*this, ret);
14867  return ret;
14868  }
14869 
14901  template<typename ValueTypeCV, typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
14902  detail::enable_if_t<not std::is_same<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
14903  detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value,
14904  int> = 0>
14905  ValueType get() const noexcept(noexcept(
14906  JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>())))
14907  {
14908  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
14909  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
14910  return JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(*this);
14911  }
14912 
14946  template<typename ValueType,
14947  detail::enable_if_t <
14948  not detail::is_basic_json<ValueType>::value and
14949  detail::has_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value,
14950  int> = 0>
14951  ValueType & get_to(ValueType& v) const noexcept(noexcept(
14952  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>(), v)))
14953  {
14954  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(*this, v);
14955  return v;
14956  }
14957 
14958 
14985  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
14986  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
14987  auto get_ptr() noexcept -> decltype(std::declval<basic_json_t&>().get_impl_ptr(std::declval<PointerType>()))
14988  {
14989  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>()
14990  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<PointerType>(nullptr));
14991  }
14992 
14997  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
14998  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value and
14999  std::is_const<typename std::remove_pointer<PointerType>::type>::value, int>::type = 0>
15000  constexpr auto get_ptr() const noexcept -> decltype(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>().get_impl_ptr(std::declval<PointerType>()))
15001  {
15002  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>() const
15003  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<PointerType>(nullptr));
15004  }
15005 
15033  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
15034  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15035  auto get() noexcept -> decltype(std::declval<basic_json_t&>().template get_ptr<PointerType>())
15036  {
15037  // delegate the call to get_ptr
15038  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
15039  }
15040 
15045  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
15046  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15047  constexpr auto get() const noexcept -> decltype(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>().template get_ptr<PointerType>())
15048  {
15049  // delegate the call to get_ptr
15050  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
15051  }
15052 
15079  template<typename ReferenceType, typename std::enable_if<
15080  std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15081  ReferenceType get_ref()
15082  {
15083  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
15084  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
15085  }
15086 
15091  template<typename ReferenceType, typename std::enable_if<
15092  std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value and
15093  std::is_const<typename std::remove_reference<ReferenceType>::type>::value, int>::type = 0>
15094  ReferenceType get_ref() const
15095  {
15096  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
15097  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
15098  }
15099 
15129  template < typename ValueType, typename std::enable_if <
15130  not std::is_pointer<ValueType>::value and
15131  not std::is_same<ValueType, detail::json_ref<basic_json>>::value and
15132  not std::is_same<ValueType, typename string_t::value_type>::value and
15133  not detail::is_basic_json<ValueType>::value
15134 
15135 #ifndef _MSC_VER // fix for issue #167 operator<< ambiguity under VS2015
15136  and not std::is_same<ValueType, std::initializer_list<typename string_t::value_type>>::value
15137 #if defined(JSON_HAS_CPP_17) && defined(_MSC_VER) and _MSC_VER <= 1914
15138  and not std::is_same<ValueType, typename std::string_view>::value
15139 #endif
15140 #endif
15141  and detail::is_detected<detail::get_template_function, const basic_json_t&, ValueType>::value
15142  , int >::type = 0 >
15143  operator ValueType() const
15144  {
15145  // delegate the call to get<>() const
15146  return get<ValueType>();
15147  }
15148 
15150 
15151 
15153  // element access //
15155 
15159 
15186  reference at(size_type idx)
15187  {
15188  // at only works for arrays
15189  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
15190  {
15191  JSON_TRY
15192  {
15193  return m_value.array->at(idx);
15194  }
15195  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
15196  {
15197  // create better exception explanation
15198  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
15199  }
15200  }
15201  else
15202  {
15203  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
15204  }
15205  }
15206 
15233  const_reference at(size_type idx) const
15234  {
15235  // at only works for arrays
15236  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
15237  {
15238  JSON_TRY
15239  {
15240  return m_value.array->at(idx);
15241  }
15242  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
15243  {
15244  // create better exception explanation
15245  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
15246  }
15247  }
15248  else
15249  {
15250  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
15251  }
15252  }
15253 
15284  reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key)
15285  {
15286  // at only works for objects
15287  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
15288  {
15289  JSON_TRY
15290  {
15291  return m_value.object->at(key);
15292  }
15293  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
15294  {
15295  // create better exception explanation
15296  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
15297  }
15298  }
15299  else
15300  {
15301  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
15302  }
15303  }
15304 
15335  const_reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key) const
15336  {
15337  // at only works for objects
15338  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
15339  {
15340  JSON_TRY
15341  {
15342  return m_value.object->at(key);
15343  }
15344  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
15345  {
15346  // create better exception explanation
15347  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
15348  }
15349  }
15350  else
15351  {
15352  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
15353  }
15354  }
15355 
15381  reference operator[](size_type idx)
15382  {
15383  // implicitly convert null value to an empty array
15384  if (is_null())
15385  {
15386  m_type = value_t::array;
15387  m_value.array = create<array_t>();
15388  assert_invariant();
15389  }
15390 
15391  // operator[] only works for arrays
15392  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
15393  {
15394  // fill up array with null values if given idx is outside range
15395  if (idx >= m_value.array->size())
15396  {
15397  m_value.array->insert(m_value.array->end(),
15398  idx - m_value.array->size() + 1,
15399  basic_json());
15400  }
15401 
15402  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
15403  }
15404 
15405  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with a numeric argument with " + std::string(type_name())));
15406  }
15407 
15427  const_reference operator[](size_type idx) const
15428  {
15429  // const operator[] only works for arrays
15430  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
15431  {
15432  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
15433  }
15434 
15435  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with a numeric argument with " + std::string(type_name())));
15436  }
15437 
15465  reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key)
15466  {
15467  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
15468  if (is_null())
15469  {
15470  m_type = value_t::object;
15471  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
15472  assert_invariant();
15473  }
15474 
15475  // operator[] only works for objects
15476  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
15477  {
15478  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
15479  }
15480 
15481  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with a string argument with " + std::string(type_name())));
15482  }
15483 
15514  const_reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key) const
15515  {
15516  // const operator[] only works for objects
15517  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
15518  {
15519  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
15520  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
15521  }
15522 
15523  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with a string argument with " + std::string(type_name())));
15524  }
15525 
15553  template<typename T>
15554  reference operator[](T* key)
15555  {
15556  // implicitly convert null to object
15557  if (is_null())
15558  {
15559  m_type = value_t::object;
15560  m_value = value_t::object;
15561  assert_invariant();
15562  }
15563 
15564  // at only works for objects
15565  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
15566  {
15567  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
15568  }
15569 
15570  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with a string argument with " + std::string(type_name())));
15571  }
15572 
15603  template<typename T>
15604  const_reference operator[](T* key) const
15605  {
15606  // at only works for objects
15607  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
15608  {
15609  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
15610  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
15611  }
15612 
15613  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with a string argument with " + std::string(type_name())));
15614  }
15615 
15664  template<class ValueType, typename std::enable_if<
15665  std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15666  ValueType value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, const ValueType& default_value) const
15667  {
15668  // at only works for objects
15669  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
15670  {
15671  // if key is found, return value and given default value otherwise
15672  const auto it = find(key);
15673  if (it != end())
15674  {
15675  return *it;
15676  }
15677 
15678  return default_value;
15679  }
15680 
15681  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + std::string(type_name())));
15682  }
15683 
15688  string_t value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, const char* default_value) const
15689  {
15690  return value(key, string_t(default_value));
15691  }
15692 
15734  template<class ValueType, typename std::enable_if<
15735  std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
15736  ValueType value(const json_pointer& ptr, const ValueType& default_value) const
15737  {
15738  // at only works for objects
15739  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
15740  {
15741  // if pointer resolves a value, return it or use default value
15742  JSON_TRY
15743  {
15744  return ptr.get_checked(this);
15745  }
15746  JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH (out_of_range&)
15747  {
15748  return default_value;
15749  }
15750  }
15751 
15752  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + std::string(type_name())));
15753  }
15754 
15759  string_t value(const json_pointer& ptr, const char* default_value) const
15760  {
15761  return value(ptr, string_t(default_value));
15762  }
15763 
15789  reference front()
15790  {
15791  return *begin();
15792  }
15793 
15797  const_reference front() const
15798  {
15799  return *cbegin();
15800  }
15801 
15833  reference back()
15834  {
15835  auto tmp = end();
15836  --tmp;
15837  return *tmp;
15838  }
15839 
15843  const_reference back() const
15844  {
15845  auto tmp = cend();
15846  --tmp;
15847  return *tmp;
15848  }
15849 
15896  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
15897  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
15898  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type
15899  = 0>
15900  IteratorType erase(IteratorType pos)
15901  {
15902  // make sure iterator fits the current value
15903  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(this != pos.m_object))
15904  {
15905  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
15906  }
15907 
15908  IteratorType result = end();
15909 
15910  switch (m_type)
15911  {
15912  case value_t::boolean:
15913  case value_t::number_float:
15914  case value_t::number_integer:
15915  case value_t::number_unsigned:
15916  case value_t::string:
15917  {
15918  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not pos.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
15919  {
15920  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(205, "iterator out of range"));
15921  }
15922 
15923  if (is_string())
15924  {
15925  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
15926  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::destroy(alloc, m_value.string);
15927  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::deallocate(alloc, m_value.string, 1);
15928  m_value.string = nullptr;
15929  }
15930 
15931  m_type = value_t::null;
15932  assert_invariant();
15933  break;
15934  }
15935 
15936  case value_t::object:
15937  {
15938  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->erase(pos.m_it.object_iterator);
15939  break;
15940  }
15941 
15942  case value_t::array:
15943  {
15944  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(pos.m_it.array_iterator);
15945  break;
15946  }
15947 
15948  default:
15949  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
15950  }
15951 
15952  return result;
15953  }
15954 
16001  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
16002  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
16003  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type
16004  = 0>
16005  IteratorType erase(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
16006  {
16007  // make sure iterator fits the current value
16008  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(this != first.m_object or this != last.m_object))
16009  {
16010  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(203, "iterators do not fit current value"));
16011  }
16012 
16013  IteratorType result = end();
16014 
16015  switch (m_type)
16016  {
16017  case value_t::boolean:
16018  case value_t::number_float:
16019  case value_t::number_integer:
16020  case value_t::number_unsigned:
16021  case value_t::string:
16022  {
16023  if (JSON_LIKELY(not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()
16024  or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end()))
16025  {
16026  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
16027  }
16028 
16029  if (is_string())
16030  {
16031  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
16032  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::destroy(alloc, m_value.string);
16033  std::allocator_traits<decltype(alloc)>::deallocate(alloc, m_value.string, 1);
16034  m_value.string = nullptr;
16035  }
16036 
16037  m_type = value_t::null;
16038  assert_invariant();
16039  break;
16040  }
16041 
16042  case value_t::object:
16043  {
16044  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->erase(first.m_it.object_iterator,
16045  last.m_it.object_iterator);
16046  break;
16047  }
16048 
16049  case value_t::array:
16050  {
16051  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(first.m_it.array_iterator,
16052  last.m_it.array_iterator);
16053  break;
16054  }
16055 
16056  default:
16057  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
16058  }
16059 
16060  return result;
16061  }
16062 
16092  size_type erase(const typename object_t::key_type& key)
16093  {
16094  // this erase only works for objects
16095  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
16096  {
16097  return m_value.object->erase(key);
16098  }
16099 
16100  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
16101  }
16102 
16127  void erase(const size_type idx)
16128  {
16129  // this erase only works for arrays
16130  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
16131  {
16132  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(idx >= size()))
16133  {
16134  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
16135  }
16136 
16137  m_value.array->erase(m_value.array->begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx));
16138  }
16139  else
16140  {
16141  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
16142  }
16143  }
16144 
16146 
16147 
16149  // lookup //
16151 
16154 
16177  template<typename KeyT>
16178  iterator find(KeyT&& key)
16179  {
16180  auto result = end();
16181 
16182  if (is_object())
16183  {
16184  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(std::forward<KeyT>(key));
16185  }
16186 
16187  return result;
16188  }
16189 
16194  template<typename KeyT>
16195  const_iterator find(KeyT&& key) const
16196  {
16197  auto result = cend();
16198 
16199  if (is_object())
16200  {
16201  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(std::forward<KeyT>(key));
16202  }
16203 
16204  return result;
16205  }
16206 
16228  template<typename KeyT>
16229  size_type count(KeyT&& key) const
16230  {
16231  // return 0 for all nonobject types
16232  return is_object() ? m_value.object->count(std::forward<KeyT>(key)) : 0;
16233  }
16234

16239  // iterators //
16241 
16244 
16269  iterator begin() noexcept
16270  {
16271  iterator result(this);
16272  result.set_begin();
16273  return result;
16274  }
16275 
16279  const_iterator begin() const noexcept
16280  {
16281  return cbegin();
16282  }
16283 
16309  const_iterator cbegin() const noexcept
16310  {
16311  const_iterator result(this);
16312  result.set_begin();
16313  return result;
16314  }
16315 
16340  iterator end() noexcept
16341  {
16342  iterator result(this);
16343  result.set_end();
16344  return result;
16345  }
16346 
16350  const_iterator end() const noexcept
16351  {
16352  return cend();
16353  }
16354 
16380  const_iterator cend() const noexcept
16381  {
16382  const_iterator result(this);
16383  result.set_end();
16384  return result;
16385  }
16386 
16410  reverse_iterator rbegin() noexcept
16411  {
16412  return reverse_iterator(end());
16413  }
16414 
16418  const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const noexcept
16419  {
16420  return crbegin();
16421  }
16422 
16447  reverse_iterator rend() noexcept
16448  {
16449  return reverse_iterator(begin());
16450  }
16451 
16455  const_reverse_iterator rend() const noexcept
16456  {
16457  return crend();
16458  }
16459 
16484  const_reverse_iterator crbegin() const noexcept
16485  {
16486  return const_reverse_iterator(cend());
16487  }
16488 
16513  const_reverse_iterator crend() const noexcept
16514  {
16515  return const_reverse_iterator(cbegin());
16516  }
16517 
16518  public:
16576  JSON_DEPRECATED
16577  static iteration_proxy<iterator> iterator_wrapper(reference ref) noexcept
16578  {
16579  return ref.items();
16580  }
16581 
16585  JSON_DEPRECATED
16586  static iteration_proxy<const_iterator> iterator_wrapper(const_reference ref) noexcept
16587  {
16588  return ref.items();
16589  }
16590 
16643  iteration_proxy<iterator> items() noexcept
16644  {
16645  return iteration_proxy<iterator>(*this);
16646  }
16647 
16651  iteration_proxy<const_iterator> items() const noexcept
16652  {
16653  return iteration_proxy<const_iterator>(*this);
16654  }
16655 
16657 
16658 
16660  // capacity //
16662 
16665 
16707  bool empty() const noexcept
16708  {
16709  switch (m_type)
16710  {
16711  case value_t::null:
16712  {
16713  // null values are empty
16714  return true;
16715  }
16716 
16717  case value_t::array:
16718  {
16719  // delegate call to array_t::empty()
16720  return m_value.array->empty();
16721  }
16722 
16723  case value_t::object:
16724  {
16725  // delegate call to object_t::empty()
16726  return m_value.object->empty();
16727  }
16728 
16729  default:
16730  {
16731  // all other types are nonempty
16732  return false;
16733  }
16734  }
16735  }
16736 
16779  size_type size() const noexcept
16780  {
16781  switch (m_type)
16782  {
16783  case value_t::null:
16784  {
16785  // null values are empty
16786  return 0;
16787  }
16788 
16789  case value_t::array:
16790  {
16791  // delegate call to array_t::size()
16792  return m_value.array->size();
16793  }
16794 
16795  case value_t::object:
16796  {
16797  // delegate call to object_t::size()
16798  return m_value.object->size();
16799  }
16800 
16801  default:
16802  {
16803  // all other types have size 1
16804  return 1;
16805  }
16806  }
16807  }
16808 
16849  size_type max_size() const noexcept
16850  {
16851  switch (m_type)
16852  {
16853  case value_t::array:
16854  {
16855  // delegate call to array_t::max_size()
16856  return m_value.array->max_size();
16857  }
16858 
16859  case value_t::object:
16860  {
16861  // delegate call to object_t::max_size()
16862  return m_value.object->max_size();
16863  }
16864 
16865  default:
16866  {
16867  // all other types have max_size() == size()
16868  return size();
16869  }
16870  }
16871  }
16872 
16874 
16875 
16877  // modifiers //
16879 
16882 
16919  void clear() noexcept
16920  {
16921  switch (m_type)
16922  {
16923  case value_t::number_integer:
16924  {
16925  m_value.number_integer = 0;
16926  break;
16927  }
16928 
16929  case value_t::number_unsigned:
16930  {
16931  m_value.number_unsigned = 0;
16932  break;
16933  }
16934 
16935  case value_t::number_float:
16936  {
16937  m_value.number_float = 0.0;
16938  break;
16939  }
16940 
16941  case value_t::boolean:
16942  {
16943  m_value.boolean = false;
16944  break;
16945  }
16946 
16947  case value_t::string:
16948  {
16949  m_value.string->clear();
16950  break;
16951  }
16952 
16953  case value_t::array:
16954  {
16955  m_value.array->clear();
16956  break;
16957  }
16958 
16959  case value_t::object:
16960  {
16961  m_value.object->clear();
16962  break;
16963  }
16964 
16965  default:
16966  break;
16967  }
16968  }
16969 
16990  void push_back(basic_json&& val)
16991  {
16992  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
16993  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
16994  {
16995  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
16996  }
16997 
16998  // transform null object into an array
16999  if (is_null())
17000  {
17001  m_type = value_t::array;
17002  m_value = value_t::array;
17003  assert_invariant();
17004  }
17005 
17006  // add element to array (move semantics)
17007  m_value.array->push_back(std::move(val));
17008  // invalidate object
17009  val.m_type = value_t::null;
17010  }
17011 
17016  reference operator+=(basic_json&& val)
17017  {
17018  push_back(std::move(val));
17019  return *this;
17020  }
17021 
17026  void push_back(const basic_json& val)
17027  {
17028  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
17029  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
17030  {
17031  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17032  }
17033 
17034  // transform null object into an array
17035  if (is_null())
17036  {
17037  m_type = value_t::array;
17038  m_value = value_t::array;
17039  assert_invariant();
17040  }
17041 
17042  // add element to array
17043  m_value.array->push_back(val);
17044  }
17045 
17050  reference operator+=(const basic_json& val)
17051  {
17052  push_back(val);
17053  return *this;
17054  }
17055 
17076  void push_back(const typename object_t::value_type& val)
17077  {
17078  // push_back only works for null objects or objects
17079  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_object())))
17080  {
17081  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17082  }
17083 
17084  // transform null object into an object
17085  if (is_null())
17086  {
17087  m_type = value_t::object;
17088  m_value = value_t::object;
17089  assert_invariant();
17090  }
17091 
17092  // add element to array
17093  m_value.object->insert(val);
17094  }
17095 
17100  reference operator+=(const typename object_t::value_type& val)
17101  {
17102  push_back(val);
17103  return *this;
17104  }
17105 
17131  void push_back(initializer_list_t init)
17132  {
17133  if (is_object() and init.size() == 2 and (*init.begin())->is_string())
17134  {
17135  basic_json&& key = init.begin()->moved_or_copied();
17136  push_back(typename object_t::value_type(
17137  std::move(key.get_ref<string_t&>()), (init.begin() + 1)->moved_or_copied()));
17138  }
17139  else
17140  {
17141  push_back(basic_json(init));
17142  }
17143  }
17144 
17149  reference operator+=(initializer_list_t init)
17150  {
17151  push_back(init);
17152  return *this;
17153  }
17154 
17176  template<class... Args>
17177  void emplace_back(Args&& ... args)
17178  {
17179  // emplace_back only works for null objects or arrays
17180  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
17181  {
17182  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17183  }
17184 
17185  // transform null object into an array
17186  if (is_null())
17187  {
17188  m_type = value_t::array;
17189  m_value = value_t::array;
17190  assert_invariant();
17191  }
17192 
17193  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
17194  m_value.array->emplace_back(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
17195  }
17196 
17224  template<class... Args>
17225  std::pair<iterator, bool> emplace(Args&& ... args)
17226  {
17227  // emplace only works for null objects or arrays
17228  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_object())))
17229  {
17230  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17231  }
17232 
17233  // transform null object into an object
17234  if (is_null())
17235  {
17236  m_type = value_t::object;
17237  m_value = value_t::object;
17238  assert_invariant();
17239  }
17240 
17241  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
17242  auto res = m_value.object->emplace(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
17243  // create result iterator and set iterator to the result of emplace
17244  auto it = begin();
17245  it.m_it.object_iterator = res.first;
17246 
17247  // return pair of iterator and boolean
17248  return {it, res.second};
17249  }
17250 
17254  template<typename... Args>
17255  iterator insert_iterator(const_iterator pos, Args&& ... args)
17256  {
17257  iterator result(this);
17258  assert(m_value.array != nullptr);
17259 
17260  auto insert_pos = std::distance(m_value.array->begin(), pos.m_it.array_iterator);
17261  m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
17262  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->begin() + insert_pos;
17263 
17264  // This could have been written as:
17265  // result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, cnt, val);
17266  // but the return value of insert is missing in GCC 4.8, so it is written this way instead.
17267 
17268  return result;
17269  }
17270 
17293  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const basic_json& val)
17294  {
17295  // insert only works for arrays
17296  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
17297  {
17298  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
17299  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
17300  {
17301  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
17302  }
17303 
17304  // insert to array and return iterator
17305  return insert_iterator(pos, val);
17306  }
17307 
17308  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17309  }
17310 
17315  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, basic_json&& val)
17316  {
17317  return insert(pos, val);
17318  }
17319 
17344  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, size_type cnt, const basic_json& val)
17345  {
17346  // insert only works for arrays
17347  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
17348  {
17349  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
17350  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
17351  {
17352  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
17353  }
17354 
17355  // insert to array and return iterator
17356  return insert_iterator(pos, cnt, val);
17357  }
17358 
17359  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17360  }
17361 
17392  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
17393  {
17394  // insert only works for arrays
17395  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_array()))
17396  {
17397  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17398  }
17399 
17400  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
17401  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
17402  {
17403  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
17404  }
17405 
17406  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
17407  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
17408  {
17409  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
17410  }
17411 
17412  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object == this))
17413  {
17414  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(211, "passed iterators may not belong to container"));
17415  }
17416 
17417  // insert to array and return iterator
17418  return insert_iterator(pos, first.m_it.array_iterator, last.m_it.array_iterator);
17419  }
17420 
17445  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, initializer_list_t ilist)
17446  {
17447  // insert only works for arrays
17448  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_array()))
17449  {
17450  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17451  }
17452 
17453  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
17454  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
17455  {
17456  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
17457  }
17458 
17459  // insert to array and return iterator
17460  return insert_iterator(pos, ilist.begin(), ilist.end());
17461  }
17462 
17486  void insert(const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
17487  {
17488  // insert only works for objects
17489  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_object()))
17490  {
17491  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17492  }
17493 
17494  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
17495  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
17496  {
17497  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
17498  }
17499 
17500  // passed iterators must belong to objects
17501  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not first.m_object->is_object()))
17502  {
17503  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterators first and last must point to objects"));
17504  }
17505 
17506  m_value.object->insert(first.m_it.object_iterator, last.m_it.object_iterator);
17507  }
17508 
17528  void update(const_reference j)
17529  {
17530  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
17531  if (is_null())
17532  {
17533  m_type = value_t::object;
17534  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
17535  assert_invariant();
17536  }
17537 
17538  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_object()))
17539  {
17540  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(312, "cannot use update() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17541  }
17542  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_object()))
17543  {
17544  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(312, "cannot use update() with " + std::string(j.type_name())));
17545  }
17546 
17547  for (auto it = j.cbegin(); it != j.cend(); ++it)
17548  {
17549  m_value.object->operator[](it.key()) = it.value();
17550  }
17551  }
17552 
17579  void update(const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
17580  {
17581  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
17582  if (is_null())
17583  {
17584  m_type = value_t::object;
17585  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
17586  assert_invariant();
17587  }
17588 
17589  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_object()))
17590  {
17591  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(312, "cannot use update() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17592  }
17593 
17594  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
17595  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
17596  {
17597  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
17598  }
17599 
17600  // passed iterators must belong to objects
17601  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not first.m_object->is_object()
17602  or not last.m_object->is_object()))
17603  {
17604  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterators first and last must point to objects"));
17605  }
17606 
17607  for (auto it = first; it != last; ++it)
17608  {
17609  m_value.object->operator[](it.key()) = it.value();
17610  }
17611  }
17612 
17630  void swap(reference other) noexcept (
17631  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and
17632  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
17633  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
17634  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value
17635  )
17636  {
17637  std::swap(m_type, other.m_type);
17638  std::swap(m_value, other.m_value);
17639  assert_invariant();
17640  }
17641 
17662  void swap(array_t& other)
17663  {
17664  // swap only works for arrays
17665  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
17666  {
17667  std::swap(*(m_value.array), other);
17668  }
17669  else
17670  {
17671  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17672  }
17673  }
17674 
17695  void swap(object_t& other)
17696  {
17697  // swap only works for objects
17698  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
17699  {
17700  std::swap(*(m_value.object), other);
17701  }
17702  else
17703  {
17704  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17705  }
17706  }
17707 
17728  void swap(string_t& other)
17729  {
17730  // swap only works for strings
17731  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_string()))
17732  {
17733  std::swap(*(m_value.string), other);
17734  }
17735  else
17736  {
17737  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
17738  }
17739  }
17740 
17742 
17743  public:
17745  // lexicographical comparison operators //
17747 
17750 
17790  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
17791  {
17792  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
17793  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
17794 
17795  if (lhs_type == rhs_type)
17796  {
17797  switch (lhs_type)
17798  {
17799  case value_t::array:
17800  return (*lhs.m_value.array == *rhs.m_value.array);
17801 
17802  case value_t::object:
17803  return (*lhs.m_value.object == *rhs.m_value.object);
17804 
17805  case value_t::null:
17806  return true;
17807 
17808  case value_t::string:
17809  return (*lhs.m_value.string == *rhs.m_value.string);
17810 
17811  case value_t::boolean:
17812  return (lhs.m_value.boolean == rhs.m_value.boolean);
17813 
17814  case value_t::number_integer:
17815  return (lhs.m_value.number_integer == rhs.m_value.number_integer);
17816 
17817  case value_t::number_unsigned:
17818  return (lhs.m_value.number_unsigned == rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
17819 
17820  case value_t::number_float:
17821  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == rhs.m_value.number_float);
17822 
17823  default:
17824  return false;
17825  }
17826  }
17827  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
17828  {
17829  return (static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) == rhs.m_value.number_float);
17830  }
17831  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
17832  {
17833  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer));
17834  }
17835  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
17836  {
17837  return (static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_float);
17838  }
17839  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
17840  {
17841  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned));
17842  }
17843  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
17844  {
17845  return (static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_integer);
17846  }
17847  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
17848  {
17849  return (lhs.m_value.number_integer == static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned));
17850  }
17851 
17852  return false;
17853  }
17854 
17859  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
17860  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
17861  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
17862  {
17863  return (lhs == basic_json(rhs));
17864  }
17865 
17870  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
17871  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
17872  friend bool operator==(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
17873  {
17874  return (basic_json(lhs) == rhs);
17875  }
17876 
17895  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
17896  {
17897  return not (lhs == rhs);
17898  }
17899 
17904  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
17905  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
17906  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
17907  {
17908  return (lhs != basic_json(rhs));
17909  }
17910 
17915  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
17916  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
17917  friend bool operator!=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
17918  {
17919  return (basic_json(lhs) != rhs);
17920  }
17921 
17948  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
17949  {
17950  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
17951  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
17952 
17953  if (lhs_type == rhs_type)
17954  {
17955  switch (lhs_type)
17956  {
17957  case value_t::array:
17958  return (*lhs.m_value.array) < (*rhs.m_value.array);
17959 
17960  case value_t::object:
17961  return *lhs.m_value.object < *rhs.m_value.object;
17962 
17963  case value_t::null:
17964  return false;
17965 
17966  case value_t::string:
17967  return *lhs.m_value.string < *rhs.m_value.string;
17968 
17969  case value_t::boolean:
17970  return lhs.m_value.boolean < rhs.m_value.boolean;
17971 
17972  case value_t::number_integer:
17973  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
17974 
17975  case value_t::number_unsigned:
17976  return lhs.m_value.number_unsigned < rhs.m_value.number_unsigned;
17977 
17978  case value_t::number_float:
17979  return lhs.m_value.number_float < rhs.m_value.number_float;
17980 
17981  default:
17982  return false;
17983  }
17984  }
17985  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
17986  {
17987  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
17988  }
17989  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
17990  {
17991  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer);
17992  }
17993  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
17994  {
17995  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
17996  }
17997  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
17998  {
17999  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
18000  }
18001  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
18002  {
18003  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
18004  }
18005  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
18006  {
18007  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
18008  }
18009 
18010  // We only reach this line if we cannot compare values. In that case,
18011  // we compare types. Note we have to call the operator explicitly,
18012  // because MSVC has problems otherwise.
18013  return operator<(lhs_type, rhs_type);
18014  }
18015 
18020  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
18021  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
18022  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
18023  {
18024  return (lhs < basic_json(rhs));
18025  }
18026 
18031  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
18032  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
18033  friend bool operator<(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
18034  {
18035  return (basic_json(lhs) < rhs);
18036  }
18037 
18057  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
18058  {
18059  return not (rhs < lhs);
18060  }
18061 
18066  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
18067  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
18068  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
18069  {
18070  return (lhs <= basic_json(rhs));
18071  }
18072 
18077  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
18078  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
18079  friend bool operator<=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
18080  {
18081  return (basic_json(lhs) <= rhs);
18082  }
18083 
18103  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
18104  {
18105  return not (lhs <= rhs);
18106  }
18107 
18112  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
18113  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
18114  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
18115  {
18116  return (lhs > basic_json(rhs));
18117  }
18118 
18123  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
18124  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
18125  friend bool operator>(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
18126  {
18127  return (basic_json(lhs) > rhs);
18128  }
18129 
18149  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
18150  {
18151  return not (lhs < rhs);
18152  }
18153 
18158  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
18159  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
18160  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
18161  {
18162  return (lhs >= basic_json(rhs));
18163  }
18164 
18169  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
18170  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
18171  friend bool operator>=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
18172  {
18173  return (basic_json(lhs) >= rhs);
18174  }
18175 
18177 
18179  // serialization //
18181 
18184 
18216  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& o, const basic_json& j)
18217  {
18218  // read width member and use it as indentation parameter if nonzero
18219  const bool pretty_print = (o.width() > 0);
18220  const auto indentation = (pretty_print ? o.width() : 0);
18221 
18222  // reset width to 0 for subsequent calls to this stream
18223  o.width(0);
18224 
18225  // do the actual serialization
18226  serializer s(detail::output_adapter<char>(o), o.fill());
18227  s.dump(j, pretty_print, false, static_cast<unsigned int>(indentation));
18228  return o;
18229  }
18230 
18239  JSON_DEPRECATED
18240  friend std::ostream& operator>>(const basic_json& j, std::ostream& o)
18241  {
18242  return o << j;
18243  }
18244 
18246 
18247 
18249  // deserialization //
18251 
18254 
18319  static basic_json parse(detail::input_adapter&& i,
18320  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
18321  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
18322  {
18323  basic_json result;
18324  parser(i, cb, allow_exceptions).parse(true, result);
18325  return result;
18326  }
18327 
18328  static bool accept(detail::input_adapter&& i)
18329  {
18330  return parser(i).accept(true);
18331  }
18332 
18389  template <typename SAX>
18390  static bool sax_parse(detail::input_adapter&& i, SAX* sax,
18391  input_format_t format = input_format_t::json,
18392  const bool strict = true)
18393  {
18394  assert(sax);
18395  switch (format)
18396  {
18397  case input_format_t::json:
18398  return parser(std::move(i)).sax_parse(sax, strict);
18399  default:
18400  return detail::binary_reader<basic_json, SAX>(std::move(i)).sax_parse(format, sax, strict);
18401  }
18402  }
18403 
18451  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
18452  std::is_base_of<
18453  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
18454  typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category>::value, int>::type = 0>
18455  static basic_json parse(IteratorType first, IteratorType last,
18456  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
18457  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
18458  {
18459  basic_json result;
18460  parser(detail::input_adapter(first, last), cb, allow_exceptions).parse(true, result);
18461  return result;
18462  }
18463 
18464  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
18465  std::is_base_of<
18466  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
18467  typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category>::value, int>::type = 0>
18468  static bool accept(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
18469  {
18470  return parser(detail::input_adapter(first, last)).accept(true);
18471  }
18472 
18473  template<class IteratorType, class SAX, typename std::enable_if<
18474  std::is_base_of<
18475  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
18476  typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category>::value, int>::type = 0>
18477  static bool sax_parse(IteratorType first, IteratorType last, SAX* sax)
18478  {
18479  return parser(detail::input_adapter(first, last)).sax_parse(sax);
18480  }
18481 
18490  JSON_DEPRECATED
18491  friend std::istream& operator<<(basic_json& j, std::istream& i)
18492  {
18493  return operator>>(i, j);
18494  }
18495 
18521  friend std::istream& operator>>(std::istream& i, basic_json& j)
18522  {
18523  parser(detail::input_adapter(i)).parse(false, j);
18524  return i;
18525  }
18526 
18528 
18530  // convenience functions //
18532 
18563  const char* type_name() const noexcept
18564  {
18565  {
18566  switch (m_type)
18567  {
18568  case value_t::null:
18569  return "null";
18570  case value_t::object:
18571  return "object";
18572  case value_t::array:
18573  return "array";
18574  case value_t::string:
18575  return "string";
18576  case value_t::boolean:
18577  return "boolean";
18578  case value_t::discarded:
18579  return "discarded";
18580  default:
18581  return "number";
18582  }
18583  }
18584  }
18585 
18586 
18587  private:
18589  // member variables //
18591 
18593  value_t m_type = value_t::null;
18594 
18596  json_value m_value = {};
18597 
18599  // binary serialization/deserialization //
18601 
18604 
18605  public:
18694  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_cbor(const basic_json& j)
18695  {
18696  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
18697  to_cbor(j, result);
18698  return result;
18699  }
18700 
18701  static void to_cbor(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<uint8_t> o)
18702  {
18703  binary_writer<uint8_t>(o).write_cbor(j);
18704  }
18705 
18706  static void to_cbor(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<char> o)
18707  {
18708  binary_writer<char>(o).write_cbor(j);
18709  }
18710 
18790  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_msgpack(const basic_json& j)
18791  {
18792  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
18793  to_msgpack(j, result);
18794  return result;
18795  }
18796 
18797  static void to_msgpack(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<uint8_t> o)
18798  {
18799  binary_writer<uint8_t>(o).write_msgpack(j);
18800  }
18801 
18802  static void to_msgpack(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<char> o)
18803  {
18804  binary_writer<char>(o).write_msgpack(j);
18805  }
18806 
18887  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_ubjson(const basic_json& j,
18888  const bool use_size = false,
18889  const bool use_type = false)
18890  {
18891  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
18892  to_ubjson(j, result, use_size, use_type);
18893  return result;
18894  }
18895 
18896  static void to_ubjson(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<uint8_t> o,
18897  const bool use_size = false, const bool use_type = false)
18898  {
18899  binary_writer<uint8_t>(o).write_ubjson(j, use_size, use_type);
18900  }
18901 
18902  static void to_ubjson(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<char> o,
18903  const bool use_size = false, const bool use_type = false)
18904  {
18905  binary_writer<char>(o).write_ubjson(j, use_size, use_type);
18906  }
18907 
18908 
18964  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_bson(const basic_json& j)
18965  {
18966  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
18967  to_bson(j, result);
18968  return result;
18969  }
18970 
18979  static void to_bson(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<uint8_t> o)
18980  {
18981  binary_writer<uint8_t>(o).write_bson(j);
18982  }
18983 
18987  static void to_bson(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<char> o)
18988  {
18989  binary_writer<char>(o).write_bson(j);
18990  }
18991 
18992 
19090  static basic_json from_cbor(detail::input_adapter&& i,
19091  const bool strict = true,
19092  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
19093  {
19094  basic_json result;
19095  detail::json_sax_dom_parser<basic_json> sdp(result, allow_exceptions);
19096  const bool res = binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(i)).sax_parse(input_format_t::cbor, &sdp, strict);
19097  return res ? result : basic_json(value_t::discarded);
19098  }
19099 
19103  template<typename A1, typename A2,
19104  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<detail::input_adapter, A1, A2>::value, int> = 0>
19105  static basic_json from_cbor(A1 && a1, A2 && a2,
19106  const bool strict = true,
19107  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
19108  {
19109  basic_json result;
19110  detail::json_sax_dom_parser<basic_json> sdp(result, allow_exceptions);
19111  const bool res = binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(std::forward<A1>(a1), std::forward<A2>(a2))).sax_parse(input_format_t::cbor, &sdp, strict);
19112  return res ? result : basic_json(value_t::discarded);
19113  }
19114 
19195  static basic_json from_msgpack(detail::input_adapter&& i,
19196  const bool strict = true,
19197  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
19198  {
19199  basic_json result;
19200  detail::json_sax_dom_parser<basic_json> sdp(result, allow_exceptions);
19201  const bool res = binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(i)).sax_parse(input_format_t::msgpack, &sdp, strict);
19202  return res ? result : basic_json(value_t::discarded);
19203  }
19204 
19208  template<typename A1, typename A2,
19209  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<detail::input_adapter, A1, A2>::value, int> = 0>
19210  static basic_json from_msgpack(A1 && a1, A2 && a2,
19211  const bool strict = true,
19212  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
19213  {
19214  basic_json result;
19215  detail::json_sax_dom_parser<basic_json> sdp(result, allow_exceptions);
19216  const bool res = binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(std::forward<A1>(a1), std::forward<A2>(a2))).sax_parse(input_format_t::msgpack, &sdp, strict);
19217  return res ? result : basic_json(value_t::discarded);
19218  }
19219 
19279  static basic_json from_ubjson(detail::input_adapter&& i,
19280  const bool strict = true,
19281  const bool allow_exceptions = true)

19284  detail::json_sax_dom_parser<basic_json> sdp(result, allow_exceptions);
19285  const bool res = binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(i)).sax_parse(input_format_t::ubjson, &sdp, strict);
19286  return res ? result : basic_json(value_t::discarded);
19287  }
19288 
19292  template<typename A1, typename A2,
19293  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<detail::input_adapter, A1, A2>::value, int> = 0>
19294  static basic_json from_ubjson(A1 && a1, A2 && a2,
19295  const bool strict = true,
19296  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
19297  {

19299  detail::json_sax_dom_parser<basic_json> sdp(result, allow_exceptions);
19300  const bool res = binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(std::forward<A1>(a1), std::forward<A2>(a2))).sax_parse(input_format_t::ubjson, &sdp, strict);
19301  return res ? result : basic_json(value_t::discarded);

19362  static basic_json from_bson(detail::input_adapter&& i,
19363  const bool strict = true,
19364  const bool allow_exceptions = true)

19368  const bool res = binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(i)).sax_parse(input_format_t::bson, &sdp, strict);
19369  return res ? result : basic_json(value_t::discarded);

19371 
19375  template<typename A1, typename A2,
19376  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<detail::input_adapter, A1, A2>::value, int> = 0>
19377  static basic_json from_bson(A1 && a1, A2 && a2,
19378  const bool strict = true,
19379  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
19380  {
19381  basic_json result;
19382  detail::json_sax_dom_parser<basic_json> sdp(result, allow_exceptions);
19383  const bool res = binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(std::forward<A1>(a1), std::forward<A2>(a2))).sax_parse(input_format_t::bson, &sdp, strict);
19384  return res ? result : basic_json(value_t::discarded);
