19390 
19392  // JSON Pointer support //
19394 
19397 
19431  reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr)
19432  {
19433  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
19434  }
19435 
19459  const_reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr) const
19460  {
19461  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
19462  }
19463 
19502  reference at(const json_pointer& ptr)
19503  {
19504  return ptr.get_checked(this);
19505  }
19506 
19545  const_reference at(const json_pointer& ptr) const
19546  {
19547  return ptr.get_checked(this);
19548  }
19549 
19572  basic_json flatten() const
19573  {
19574  basic_json result(value_t::object);
19575  json_pointer::flatten("", *this, result);
19576  return result;
19577  }
19578 
19609  basic_json unflatten() const
19610  {
19611  return json_pointer::unflatten(*this);
19612  }
19613 
19615 
19617  // JSON Patch functions //
19619 
19622 
19670  basic_json patch(const basic_json& json_patch) const
19671  {
19672  // make a working copy to apply the patch to
19673  basic_json result = *this;
19674 
19675  // the valid JSON Patch operations
19676  enum class patch_operations {add, remove, replace, move, copy, test, invalid};
19677 
19678  const auto get_op = [](const std::string & op)
19679  {
19680  if (op == "add")
19681  {
19682  return patch_operations::add;
19683  }
19684  if (op == "remove")
19685  {
19686  return patch_operations::remove;
19687  }
19688  if (op == "replace")
19689  {
19690  return patch_operations::replace;
19691  }
19692  if (op == "move")
19693  {
19694  return patch_operations::move;
19695  }
19696  if (op == "copy")
19697  {
19698  return patch_operations::copy;
19699  }
19700  if (op == "test")
19701  {
19702  return patch_operations::test;
19703  }
19704 
19705  return patch_operations::invalid;
19706  };
19707 
19708  // wrapper for "add" operation; add value at ptr
19709  const auto operation_add = [&result](json_pointer & ptr, basic_json val)
19710  {
19711  // adding to the root of the target document means replacing it
19712  if (ptr.is_root())
19713  {
19714  result = val;
19715  }
19716  else
19717  {
19718  // make sure the top element of the pointer exists
19719  json_pointer top_pointer = ptr.top();
19720  if (top_pointer != ptr)
19721  {
19722  result.at(top_pointer);
19723  }
19724 
19725  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
19726  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
19727  basic_json& parent = result[ptr];
19728 
19729  switch (parent.m_type)
19730  {
19731  case value_t::null:
19732  case value_t::object:
19733  {
19734  // use operator[] to add value
19735  parent[last_path] = val;
19736  break;
19737  }
19738 
19739  case value_t::array:
19740  {
19741  if (last_path == "-")
19742  {
19743  // special case: append to back
19744  parent.push_back(val);
19745  }
19746  else
19747  {
19748  const auto idx = json_pointer::array_index(last_path);
19749  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(static_cast<size_type>(idx) > parent.size()))
19750  {
19751  // avoid undefined behavior
19752  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
19753  }
19754 
19755  // default case: insert add offset
19756  parent.insert(parent.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx), val);
19757  }
19758  break;
19759  }
19760 
19761  // LCOV_EXCL_START
19762  default:
19763  {
19764  // if there exists a parent it cannot be primitive
19765  assert(false);
19766  }
19767  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
19768  }
19769  }
19770  };
19771 
19772  // wrapper for "remove" operation; remove value at ptr
19773  const auto operation_remove = [&result](json_pointer & ptr)
19774  {
19775  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
19776  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
19777  basic_json& parent = result.at(ptr);
19778 
19779  // remove child
19780  if (parent.is_object())
19781  {
19782  // perform range check
19783  auto it = parent.find(last_path);
19784  if (JSON_LIKELY(it != parent.end()))
19785  {
19786  parent.erase(it);
19787  }
19788  else
19789  {
19790  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + last_path + "' not found"));
19791  }
19792  }
19793  else if (parent.is_array())
19794  {
19795  // note erase performs range check
19796  parent.erase(static_cast<size_type>(json_pointer::array_index(last_path)));
19797  }
19798  };
19799 
19800  // type check: top level value must be an array
19801  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not json_patch.is_array()))
19802  {
19803  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
19804  }
19805 
19806  // iterate and apply the operations
19807  for (const auto& val : json_patch)
19808  {
19809  // wrapper to get a value for an operation
19810  const auto get_value = [&val](const std::string & op,
19811  const std::string & member,
19812  bool string_type) -> basic_json &
19813  {
19814  // find value
19815  auto it = val.m_value.object->find(member);
19816 
19817  // context-sensitive error message
19818  const auto error_msg = (op == "op") ? "operation" : "operation '" + op + "'";
19819 
19820  // check if desired value is present
19821  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(it == val.m_value.object->end()))
19822  {
19823  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have member '" + member + "'"));
19824  }
19825 
19826  // check if result is of type string
19827  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(string_type and not it->second.is_string()))
19828  {
19829  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have string member '" + member + "'"));
19830  }
19831 
19832  // no error: return value
19833  return it->second;
19834  };
19835 
19836  // type check: every element of the array must be an object
19837  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not val.is_object()))
19838  {
19839  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
19840  }
19841 
19842  // collect mandatory members
19843  const std::string op = get_value("op", "op", true);
19844  const std::string path = get_value(op, "path", true);
19845  json_pointer ptr(path);
19846 
19847  switch (get_op(op))
19848  {
19849  case patch_operations::add:
19850  {
19851  operation_add(ptr, get_value("add", "value", false));
19852  break;
19853  }
19854 
19855  case patch_operations::remove:
19856  {
19857  operation_remove(ptr);
19858  break;
19859  }
19860 
19861  case patch_operations::replace:
19862  {
19863  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
19864  result.at(ptr) = get_value("replace", "value", false);
19865  break;
19866  }
19867 
19868  case patch_operations::move:
19869  {
19870  const std::string from_path = get_value("move", "from", true);
19871  json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
19872 
19873  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
19874  basic_json v = result.at(from_ptr);
19875 
19876  // The move operation is functionally identical to a
19877  // "remove" operation on the "from" location, followed
19878  // immediately by an "add" operation at the target
19879  // location with the value that was just removed.
19880  operation_remove(from_ptr);
19881  operation_add(ptr, v);
19882  break;
19883  }
19884 
19885  case patch_operations::copy:
19886  {
19887  const std::string from_path = get_value("copy", "from", true);
19888  const json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
19889 
19890  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
19891  basic_json v = result.at(from_ptr);
19892 
19893  // The copy is functionally identical to an "add"
19894  // operation at the target location using the value
19895  // specified in the "from" member.
19896  operation_add(ptr, v);
19897  break;
19898  }
19899 
19900  case patch_operations::test:
19901  {
19902  bool success = false;
19903  JSON_TRY
19904  {
19905  // check if "value" matches the one at "path"
19906  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
19907  success = (result.at(ptr) == get_value("test", "value", false));
19908  }
19909  JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH (out_of_range&)
19910  {
19911  // ignore out of range errors: success remains false
19912  }
19913 
19914  // throw an exception if test fails
19915  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not success))
19916  {
19917  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(501, "unsuccessful: " + val.dump()));
19918  }
19919 
19920  break;
19921  }
19922 
19923  case patch_operations::invalid:
19924  {
19925  // op must be "add", "remove", "replace", "move", "copy", or
19926  // "test"
19927  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, "operation value '" + op + "' is invalid"));
19928  }
19929  }
19930  }
19931 
19932  return result;
19933  }
19934 
19968  static basic_json diff(const basic_json& source, const basic_json& target,
19969  const std::string& path = "")
19970  {
19971  // the patch
19972  basic_json result(value_t::array);
19973 
19974  // if the values are the same, return empty patch
19975  if (source == target)
19976  {
19977  return result;
19978  }
19979 
19980  if (source.type() != target.type())
19981  {
19982  // different types: replace value
19983  result.push_back(
19984  {
19985  {"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}
19986  });
19987  }
19988  else
19989  {
19990  switch (source.type())
19991  {
19992  case value_t::array:
19993  {
19994  // first pass: traverse common elements
19995  std::size_t i = 0;
19996  while (i < source.size() and i < target.size())
19997  {
19998  // recursive call to compare array values at index i
19999  auto temp_diff = diff(source[i], target[i], path + "/" + std::to_string(i));
20000  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
20001  ++i;
20002  }
20003 
20004  // i now reached the end of at least one array
20005  // in a second pass, traverse the remaining elements
20006 
20007  // remove my remaining elements
20008  const auto end_index = static_cast<difference_type>(result.size());
20009  while (i < source.size())
20010  {
20011  // add operations in reverse order to avoid invalid
20012  // indices
20013  result.insert(result.begin() + end_index, object(
20014  {
20015  {"op", "remove"},
20016  {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)}
20017  }));
20018  ++i;
20019  }
20020 
20021  // add other remaining elements
20022  while (i < target.size())
20023  {
20024  result.push_back(
20025  {
20026  {"op", "add"},
20027  {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)},
20028  {"value", target[i]}
20029  });
20030  ++i;
20031  }
20032 
20033  break;
20034  }
20035 
20036  case value_t::object:
20037  {
20038  // first pass: traverse this object's elements
20039  for (auto it = source.cbegin(); it != source.cend(); ++it)
20040  {
20041  // escape the key name to be used in a JSON patch
20042  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
20043 
20044  if (target.find(it.key()) != target.end())
20045  {
20046  // recursive call to compare object values at key it
20047  auto temp_diff = diff(it.value(), target[it.key()], path + "/" + key);
20048  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
20049  }
20050  else
20051  {
20052  // found a key that is not in o -> remove it
20053  result.push_back(object(
20054  {
20055  {"op", "remove"}, {"path", path + "/" + key}
20056  }));
20057  }
20058  }
20059 
20060  // second pass: traverse other object's elements
20061  for (auto it = target.cbegin(); it != target.cend(); ++it)
20062  {
20063  if (source.find(it.key()) == source.end())
20064  {
20065  // found a key that is not in this -> add it
20066  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
20067  result.push_back(
20068  {
20069  {"op", "add"}, {"path", path + "/" + key},
20070  {"value", it.value()}
20071  });
20072  }
20073  }
20074 
20075  break;
20076  }
20077 
20078  default:
20079  {
20080  // both primitive type: replace value
20081  result.push_back(
20082  {
20083  {"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}
20084  });
20085  break;
20086  }
20087  }
20088  }
20089 
20090  return result;
20091  }
20092 
20094 
20096  // JSON Merge Patch functions //
20098 
20101 
20144  void merge_patch(const basic_json& apply_patch)
20145  {
20146  if (apply_patch.is_object())
20147  {
20148  if (not is_object())
20149  {
20150  *this = object();
20151  }
20152  for (auto it = apply_patch.begin(); it != apply_patch.end(); ++it)
20153  {
20154  if (it.value().is_null())
20155  {
20156  erase(it.key());
20157  }
20158  else
20159  {
20160  operator[](it.key()).merge_patch(it.value());
20161  }
20162  }
20163  }
20164  else
20165  {
20166  *this = apply_patch;
20167  }
20168  }
20169 
20171 };
20172 } // namespace json
20173 
20175 // nonmember support //
20177 
20178 // specialization of std::swap, and std::hash
20179 namespace std
20180 {
20181 
20183 template<>
20184 struct hash<json::json>
20185 {
20191  std::size_t operator()(const json::json& j) const
20192  {
20193  // a naive hashing via the string representation
20194  const auto& h = hash<json::json::string_t>();
20195  return h(j.dump());
20196  }
20197 };
20198 
20202 template<>
20203 struct less< ::json::detail::value_t>
20204 {
20209  bool operator()(json::detail::value_t lhs,
20210  json::detail::value_t rhs) const noexcept
20211  {
20212  return json::detail::operator<(lhs, rhs);
20213  }
20214 };
20215 
20221 template<>
20222 inline void swap<json::json>(json::json& j1, json::json& j2) noexcept(
20223  is_nothrow_move_constructible<json::json>::value and
20224  is_nothrow_move_assignable<json::json>::value
20225 )
20226 {
20227  j1.swap(j2);
20228 }
20229 
20230 } // namespace std
20231 
20245 inline json::json operator "" _json(const char* s, std::size_t n)
20246 {
20247  return json::json::parse(s, s + n);
20248 }
20249 
20263 inline json::json::json_pointer operator "" _json_pointer(const char* s, std::size_t n)
20264 {
20265  return json::json::json_pointer(std::string(s, n));
20266 }
20267 
20268 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_unscope.hpp>
20269 
20270 
20271 // restore GCC/clang diagnostic settings
20272 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
20273  #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
20274 #endif
20275 #if defined(__clang__)
20276  #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
20277 #endif
20278 
20279 // clean up
20280 #undef JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH
20281 #undef JSON_CATCH
20282 #undef JSON_THROW
20283 #undef JSON_TRY
20284 #undef JSON_LIKELY
20285 #undef JSON_UNLIKELY
20286 #undef JSON_DEPRECATED
20287 #undef JSON_HAS_CPP_14
20288 #undef JSON_HAS_CPP_17
20289 #undef NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
20290 #undef NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL
20291 
20292 #endif
json::detail::json_ref::operator*
value_type const & operator*() const
Definition: json.h:11578
json::detail::primitive_iterator_t::operator--
primitive_iterator_t const operator--(int) noexcept
Definition: json.h:5425
json::detail::is_constructible_string_type
Definition: json.h:636
json::detail::index_sequence< I1...,(sizeof...(I1)+I2)... >::value_type
std::size_t value_type
Definition: json.h:282
json::detail::external_constructor< value_t::array >::construct
static void construct(BasicJsonType &j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t &&arr)
Definition: json.h:1826
json::detail::binary_writer::to_char_type
static CharType to_char_type(std::uint8_t x) noexcept
Definition: json.h:9641
json::basic_json::get_ptr
auto get_ptr() noexcept -> decltype(std::declval< basic_json_t &>().get_impl_ptr(std::declval< PointerType >()))
get a pointer value (implicit)

json::detail::parser::accept
